Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: sandrajonesSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Observatory Hotel ,to celebrate his 66th Birthday.We were absolutely thrilled with everything, from the luxurious room with the beautiful fittings to the gorgeous pool and gym area.The staff were absolutely wonderful, very professional and the attention to detail was evident. Our two daughters joined us for dinner in the hotel dining room that evening and we were not disappointed. The meal was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Savy_Sydney_Lily
Reviews.Content: My partner, twins and I, stayed at the Observatory Hotel from 16 April 2012 to 19 April 2012. Despite the luxuriousness and formality of the Hotel, the staff were very friendly and extremely thoughtful; all very approachable. We had not informed the hotel we were traveling with twin babies; yet by the end of the first day, we had a cot and baby hamper, filled with baby bathing products and diapers, delivered to the room. To say that i was moved by these gestures, would be an understatement. A bottle warmer was also provided, again, without our asking for same. All staff were extremely polite and very helpful whenever we needed assistance with anything. Not that i required this, but every night upon our arrival back to the hotel, our bed was turned down, and even the baby cot was tidied. It was adorable. The rooms were a lovely large size, particularly useful for the four of us, as we were traveling with quite a bit of luggage. The surrounds both within, and surrounding the hotel, were quiet. I had no problems getting to sleep. The hotel's location is in a quiet area, approximately 15 minutes from The Rocks area, and about 20 minutes from the centre of town (by foot). The bedroom was clean, spacious with a luxe period decor. The bed was a large king size, and pillows comfy. No problems were experienced with the tv. A dvd selection is available from the concierge. We didn't have water views, but we didn't mind as we were out most of the time. The bathroom had a double basin, and a very big bath. I'm 6 feet tall, and even i could fit comfortably in it! The bathroom was always cleaned very well, with Peter Morrissey toiletries provided. The single shower had two shower heads, one above and one on the side - you can take your pick which one you want to use. Room service was quick and professional. The room service menu had an extensive selection of food to choose from. On one occasion my fiance wanted to order takeaway dinner from a local restaurant. Leaving money with the concierge, my fiance not only received his takeaway without incident, but the concierge was kind enough to arrange for plates and cutlery to be sent to the room (again without our asking). It's been such thoughtful service that endeared the hotel to us. We have stayed at many 5 start hotels, but no other has shown us the same attentiveness as the Observatory. The only down-side was leaving, and the withdrawal effects suffered as a result! (gush gush). Overall, our experience at The Observatory Hotel was wonderful, and i hope to be able to stay there again in the future. The staff were all class, kind and professional in every way.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: Kerryful
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed over the weekend and enjoyed the gourmet package which was very well worth it. The staff are absolutely wonderful. So professional, friendly and super helpful. The hotel made us feel like we were in Paris it's an elegant, sophisticated hotel with excellent pool/spa facilities. It is all very dreamy :)

Reviews.Title: “Historic and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissWizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in a suite and it was just fantastic. Old world charm with a very comfortable bed and a lovely dressing table. The bedroom itself was very spacious with a dressing table and a comfortable set of chairs whilst the living room had a lovely couch for two people and a round dining table. It was very spacious and just the epitome of comfort. The hotel service was fantastic - check in and check out was a breeze and the housekeeping staff were very nice too. We utilised valet parking when we were there and they made it so easy for us. I love going to the Globe Bar as well for a drink and the sofas are just so plush and soft. It's beautiful hotel with lovely little touches and an amazing art collection. You really feel like you're in a boutique establishment and the flowers are just heavenly. I also love all the extra touches like the pretty vases dotted everywhere. My only complaint would be that one of the concierges was a bit rude and distant and not what I'd expect of a 5 star hotel. The only why I ranked service as 4 star is because of that concierge - I really do think that a great concierge can make or break a trip. Cracking a smile every now and again also helps but obviously it was beyond this gentlemen's nature. Apart from this my stay was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Jampala
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 11 to celebrate our anniversary. Its a classic hotel with antique looks. Check-in was very easy. We booked a city view hotel and room is very nice with classic furniture. The bed was very comfortable as well. All the amenities were of top quality. The spa was superb. We had a dinner at Galileo restaurant and its mouth watering. Overall its a very nice hotel where you can relax. We thought of upgrading to water view room but we checked the room and it didn't justify the extra dollars we need to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: joolsBlaxland
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to an executive suite with water views as it was our wedding anniversary. What a wonderful surprise! All rooms at the Observatory are elegant and beautiful but we loved our suite. The service is impeccable, the breakfast sumptuous, the facilities, especially the pool and spa, the best! We had the room service seafood platter for 2 which was delicious. Will we come back? Absolutely. We love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin better offering for better price”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: Check in after a hectic day is critical to a Hotel success. Arriving at 2.30 pm to be told room not available till 3pm compares unfavorably against Westin where pre midday check in no problem. Whilst rooms nice and spa enjoyable, Westin has same for 30% less. Westin my choice of extended stay next time

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Murray W
Reviews.Content: This must be our fifth or sixth stay at the Observatory Hotel. The reason we keep coming back is the fabulous staff, gorgeous suites and top bar. The staff now know just how I like my martini's and remember my wife and I when we return. The rooms we have stayed in have all been lovely, even if some of them could use a spruce up. A real highlight of all our stays is the relaxed breakfast in the restaurant each morning - the staff are always willing to please and nothing is too much of a problem. The location of the hotel is great too - walking distance to the Sydney Theatre, Lord Nelson, Observatory Hill, the Harbour Bridge, the Rocks, the city......etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient,subtle and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: Annette096
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate indeed to have chosen such an elegant and efficiently run hotel. We stayed for five nights in a deluxe king room with water views. The room was large and comfortable in a traditonal way with desk, two armchairs,balcony and fabulous bathroom.. Housekeeping was exceptional, as was the concierge staff. We booked and ate one evening in the restaurant Galileo. This was in keeping with the five star experience of the hotel-an elegant meal with excellent service and quality(as was the breakfast experience) Our only concern was the inexperience of one male member of staff in the Globe bar. He stood out because he did not present the same style and knowledge as his colleagues. Hopefully he will quickly improve. If guests are searching for quiet efficiency and elegant service in tasteful surroundings, The Observatory will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: UKSarahAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little off the beaten track (well, as off the beaten track you can get in central Sydney) but it means you are in what feels like a quiet, local neighbourhood. There's a couple of small restaurants & cafes at the end of the street that are more populated with locals than tourists. However you are only a 15 minute walk from Circular Quay through the Rocks. The hotel itself is well decorated without being flash. The rooms are huge with a bathroom the size of some hotel bedrooms. A door shut off the bathroom and wardrobe area from the bedroom which meant we got no noise from the corridor even when we had a room close to the elevators. Beds were very comfortable. We arrived, after a transpacific flight, mid-morning and while we couldn't get into our room had access to the beautiful pool area & spa so could relax down there, swim, shower and change clothes. The shower area isn't huge but the pool area is wonderfully soothing with it's star-studded ceiling. There was only one computer in the business center, internet was an additional charge and there was no wi-fi in the lobby but that unfortunately seems to be an Australian standard. Michael the head concierge was a fount of knowledge and more than helpful when we had an issue to deal with. Having left our problem with him we were confident it would be resolved while we got on with our vacation and it was. The whole place is just solidly classy.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility with throbbing Sydney nearby”
Reviews.Author: WeGoMama
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay at this lovely hotel. The staff was very helpful especially the concierge group. The accommodations were divine. Thoughtful gestures like custom cookies for the kids with their names were very welcoming for all of us (though they were prettier than they were tasty). We were given gentle warnings on dining places folks had steered us towards and the concierge staff were 100% accurate.

Reviews.Title: “What a service!”
Reviews.Author: paikan07
Reviews.Content: This is the service you should get everywhere you go. Many 5 stars should go there and get some lessons. Rooms are nice although I'm not a big fan of this classical style. Bed was very comfy and the room was quiet. You're 5-10 min away from the Rocks. The service was great. Everybody was really friendly and helpful, I don't remember getting such a service in the past years, especially for that price. They also let us take a shower in the spa before taking our flight although we gave the room back a few hours earlier. If I had to say anything it would be regarding Internet. I know most of 5 stars hotels only provide pay per use internet but why a 3 stars hotels provides free internet and not a 5 stars?

Reviews.Title: “Five star and then some....”
Reviews.Author: evamelb
Reviews.Content: As a five star Orient Express hotel, one expects the Observatory Hotel to be superlative and luxurious - which it is. Fluffy towels, Peter Morrisey toiletries, fabulous linen, comfy beds, heated towel rails - it's all there and then some. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was spacious and comfortable. But it was the little extras that delighted and made this a special occasion. Yes, there was the high tech iPod dock/digital alarm clock - but there was also the little analogue, battery operated alarm clock by the bed for those who get nervous if they have an early morning wake up. A plate of fruit in the room for snacking on. Night time turn down service includes fresh towels, toiletries and bottled water left by the bed. The paintings on the walls are not prints but lovely original sketches and watercolors. The staff are more than efficient but welcoming, friendly and accommodating - no request is too much trouble. The library, bar and drawing rooms in the public areas give the hotel a 'clubby' atmosphere rather than the cold corporate feel of so many larger hotels. A wonderful experience - but don't stay there if you are expecting a harbor view - the water view is of Darling Harbor - lovely, but obscured in the morning for us by a large cruise liner.

Reviews.Title: “Barangaroo doesnt really make great waterviews”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: Has a fine reputation in Sydney for its old world boutique touch, fine dining at the Galileo Restaurant & constant hotel awards. Located in a quiet corner of The Rocks, away from Sydneyâ€™s party night life, part of the older Sydney town it is definitely great for introverts & couples. The hallways & public areas looked very grand, tasteful designs & beautiful flower arrangements. Our Superior Water view room had a view from Barangaroo in Darling Harbour, which is basically the docks area for large cruise liners, not the most inspiring view but from our balcony we could see planes queuing in the sky preparing to land one after another which was cool to watch. Our room wasnâ€™t quite boutique-style but furnished using old style pattern & colours, it sometimes felt like an old personâ€™s home. The soft lighting matched the cream & white tones of the carpet & curtains, but the floral patterns need to go. Bathroom with dual marble sinks, rain shower head, deep bath & Peter Morrissey designer bath products. Comfortable Queen mattress with fine Sheridan bed sheets. Staying here for a special occasion, management very kindly provided a chilled bottle of champagne to help celebrate our night. Staff were extremely professional. Very courteous to us at all hours. Located 10 min walk from The Rocks, 20 min from Circular Quay. In hindsight, donâ€™t stay in the cheaper rooms under $400), stay at your grandmas, pay the extra for a boutique room & spoil your girl for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jan255114
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week in Sydney, made all the better by our lovely stay at the Observatory Hotel. The service was fantastic all the way through, and our room was so nice and clean. We were looking out on Darling Harbour, and 3 mornings we awoke to an amazing Cruise Ship berthed outside our window. We were only 10 minute walk from The Rocks and Circular Quay. The staff went out of the way to help us, and even booked us a Restaraunt for Dinner that we had chosen. The Lap pool and spa were fantastic, at the end of a busy day site-seeing. Thanks alot for having us

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: maxandrosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in two weeks , each time booking a deluxe king room. On the first visit we were very impressed--the room smelt of cinnamon , quite lovely. As the friends who had recommended the hotel to us were staying there too , we met up and went out to dinner--they stay there regularly. We told them how impressed we were--you could not fault it. The second visit was a totally different experience. The room looked tired and it smelt of stale tobacco smoke--as we had an appointment we quickly checked in and went out to met friends. When we came back the smell in the room was so intense I went to reception and complained. A young man came to the room , agreed it smelt unpleasant and offered us another room. As it was late we declined. They really should not let no smoking rooms that reek of smoke. It also needed a new mattress. Not our best night in a luxury hotel! I would stay there again , but not in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValerieTrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Observatory hotel before leaving Australia and enjoyed it very much though found its location a little disappointing, especially after having stayed at the Harbour Rocks hotel at the beginnig of our trip: the added ten minute walk uphill from Circular Quay was a drag after a day of exploring the city. We did enjoy the pool & jacuzzi very much as well as the extremely comfortable king size bed and wonderful shower. Probably the best sleep we had while in Sydney. All in all, it's a lovely luxury hotel in an older european classic styling. Excellent service by the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tara w
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the large rooms and sumptuous bathrooms. The positioning is good, and with a quick taxi ride, you can be exactly where you want to be. The staff were very helpful, which was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: maabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in March. The rooms were wonderfully furnished and very comfortable.We found the room to be very clean and the bathrooms were lovely with a huge shower and deep bath with lovely toiletries..The staff are all very welcoming and professional and cannot do enough for you. I loved that staff turned down your bed each night and supplied a bottle of water and relaxing tea and hot chocolate to drink. It was these little touches that made our stay special and relaxing. I thoroughly recommend this hotel for special occasions and will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms near The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: richardson30
Reviews.Content: Took a standard room on this trip which was spacious, huge bathroom, iron/board, in room tea and coffee facility and faced opposite the tennis court so an extra feeling of space when looking out of the window. Stayed in one night for dinner and found the food excellent in the bar area. Excellent service which is what you expect from Orient Express. Down side a charge for the Internet but one computer in the business centre which is free. Hadn't stayed in this part of Sydney before and had an interesting walk around the rocks and on the way down a couple of nice old pubs and see food restaurants. Probably would not stay here again as we prefer to walk/run around Botanical Gardens in the morning and walk just too far. Very close to City though. Take taxi to Rose Bay, Pier One or Catalina (great views and food). Lucios in Woollahra (fab art and food) if you want to get away from tourist areas. Also NSW Art Gallery a must.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but poor administration”
Reviews.Author: tonyan598
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful rooms and a spacious and comfortable lobby. It is well located for walking to venues at the eastern (quay and rocks) end of the City. Sadly our 4 day stay was somewhat marred by several lapses in service and administrative inefficiency. The reservation and booking process was one of the poorest we have encountered in travel. In spite of prepaying for the entire stay, the hotel had reserved only the day we were leaving, and reception suggested that we must have changed our reservation. When we produced the non-cancellable booking notice we were upgraded to a very comfortable suite. Attempts to book a table at the main restaurant were at first met with no answer on the phone, then reception took the booking but it did not get relayed. We were successful on our third attempt. We struggled unsuccessfully to get newspaper service. The hotel did not recognise several requests for our choice- The Australian. We eventually gave up. The hotel does not provide wi-fi service to rooms. We were told that there were wi-fi routers for hire but none were available during our stay. Wi-fi is available to guests in the lobby at $10 per hour. We wanted to follow an emerging political crisis on ABC radio national. The integrated radio in the TV had only 5 working stations, not including ABC radio national. We asked for a separate radio. A non-working radio was supplied and abandoned in the room during the whole of our stay even though the staff were unable to make it work. On returning home after settling our final bill we were surprised to find that an undisclosed $406 pending debit had been made to my credit card. It took 4 days to get it released.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: ByoBoy
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is the only hotel in Sydney exuding an authentic European luxury, a legacy of former GM Patrick Griffin who worked tirelessly to ensure that "The O" was one of the city's best 5-stars. Guests are swaddled within a world of creature comforts and fine detail. Service is top rate and the concierge can arrange almost anything. Rooms & suites are immaculate, the housekeeping exemplary and public spaces (Globe Bar, in particular) a fine example of understated style, as is the 'subterranean' pool and the day spa. Ask for a room looking west with inner harbour views otherwise your view is that of Kent Street. Note that the historic Lord Nelson pub at the end of this street is one of the best in town and brews its own beer. As noted by others, one drawback is the hotel's location. Upper Kent Street is lined with down-at-heel housing, is tricky to access from the city centre and is a strenuous uphill walk (especially hauling luggage) from The Rocks and Circular Quay. There's a bus stop (339, 431) a short walk from the hotel entrance but I'd imagine most Observatory guests use taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Big Swimming Pool”
Reviews.Author: lovers1996
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just finished our 12 night cruise which ended in Sydney. We walked from the Circular Quay cruise terminal with our suitcases to the hotel. It was a short walk (less than 10 minutes), but unfortunately it was an extremely humid morning in Sydney (I come from Brisbane and I had not experienced humidity like this in a long time). We both stopped about 50 metres from the hotels entrance because I was sweating profusely. While we had stopped so I could wipe off the perspiration, the doorman noticed us. He came down and greeted us with his trolley and insisted that he take our luggage. We were both so grateful for his help. Regretfully I didnâ€™t get his name, because I would love to have commended him to hotel management. We arrived at the hotel quite early. From memory it was about 10am. To my surprise, the room was available and we were able to go straight to the room. Given my state I was also extremely grateful for this. The luggage arrived shortly after we got into our room. When I opened the room door and entered I was astonished at the size of the room. It was huge! It was a Deluxe King City View room. However, we didnâ€™t really get a view of the City. What we got was a view of the houses (which appeared to be housing commission) across the road. The bathroom was also huge. It had dual basins and separate bath and shower. However, my wife thought the room (but not the bathroom which was modern) was very old fashioned and out dated. She didnâ€™t find the wallpaper and some of the furnishings appealing. The bed was comfortable and we both slept well. However, early one morning (a Saturday or Sunday) we were awoken by loud noise outside on the road. I thought that people were arguing and fighting after a night on the town. When I opened the curtains I saw a long trail of cyclists going past (hundreds of them). They were talking extremely loudly so that they could hear one another. Of course this is no fault of the hotel. But do be aware if you have a room overlooking Kent Street you maybe woken early by inconsiderate cyclists on the weekend. The other impressive feature of this hotel is the swimming pool area. The indoor swimming pool is massive for a hotel; especially a CBD hotel. I estimate that the pool is 25 metres long. There was also a good sized spa along with a sauna and steam room in the menâ€™s and womenâ€™s change rooms. The change rooms themselves were 5 star. Also the pool area and change rooms were very clean. Another nice touch to the pool area was the ceiling, which was beautifully decorated. It resembled the night sky, full of stars, which was obviously in keeping with the hotels observatory theme. The hotel also had a gym near the pool area. The gym looked quite good, but we didnâ€™t get a chance to use it. The location of the hotel may not appeal to everyone. It is quite close to The Rocks and Circular Quay, but a bit of hike into the centre of the CBD. Also the immediate neighbourhood seems to comprise of housing commission properties. When you are walking back from The Rocks (via Argyle Street) to the Hotel at night it does feel a bit unsafe. Buffet breakfast was included in our package. We both love our buffet breakfasts and unfortunately this buffet breakfast wasnâ€™t up to our standard. The variety of food was too limited. However, I will say that the fresh fruit that was offered was very sweet and of the highest quality. If you have to pay for this buffet breakfast I believe it is $36 per person. For what is offered, $36 is a rip off. In summary the rooms are huge, clean and the beds are very comfortable. I should also add that housekeeping is of a very high standard here. The swimming pool area is so much better than what you will find at any other City Hotel. The service of all staff, especially concierge, is outstanding. The location of the hotel depends on oneâ€™s preference. The buffet breakfast isnâ€™t worth the money. Overall an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection ...”
Reviews.Author: Valiant2
Reviews.Content: Difficult to improve upon this place much. It has fine fittings, lovely bedrooms, super location but most of all its wonderful, wonderful staff make it such a delight. The Concierge team are the perfect ambassdors: attentive but not over-bearing; insightful but not pressing their views; welcoming but never over-familiar. The internet was much more relibale than last year (but still slow!), and the Manager took the trouble to tell me that its upgrade programme will soon be complete. Basically, the whole service is delivered with such a passion, friendliness and style that you simply *will* them to exceed ... and they virtually always do!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: bodmor
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to have stayed in this great hotel on a good few occasions over the last few years, both for work & pleasure. The rooms are quite large for inner Sydney standards and it is everything you would expect from a five star hotel. Admittedly we've paid for their cheaper rooms (& you always get what you pay for) & are always one floor up facing the tennis courts opposite. The next time we will pay the extra for a west facing harbour view room. Its very classy olde world charm, so for us its refreshing to see they've not given it the standard "noughties" makeover like most other hotels! But I can see that some folk will think it may be a little frayed around the edges. There are a few restaurants nearby including a good "boutique" fish n chip place & a good Indian restaurant on the same street. The cafe in the Observatory, just up the stairs opposite the hotel do good salads. Our only gripe in the many times we have stayed there ...last year we stayed for 2 nights which ended up being the hottest days of the year & the aircon was just not strong enough ...it was easily about 30C in our room on the coldest setting. We rang reception who said the aircon was working to the max but the outside temperature was too hot. Unfortunately they didn't have any fans & Kmart was a little far away, but a few backup fans (even from Kmart) would have been great!! However we will still be back!

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel, off the beaten track and quite superb”
Reviews.Author: bryneithinman
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get into our usual hotel and chooses this instead. We were not disappointed. It was small, very personal and very stylish. The rom overlooked the harbour and was huge, with all the services we could possibly want. My partner thought it was a little noisy, possibly because our room was very close to the central staircase. I was not bothered. We stayed for three nights and the fact it was a little walk away from the main Rocks area was wonderful as it was off the main tourist track. We will definitely be back! The only sour note? In this day and age, I think a charge of $50 for three days internet usage for an iPad that could only be used in the lobby was extortionate (the rooms only had wired access).

Reviews.Title: “Smaller five star in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Fell0w_Traveller49
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and never failed to enjoy the experience (including one stellar 4-day stay over NYE 2000). We usually stay in a room on the top floor on the southwest corner, with a great view over the western harbour down to Parramatta and the Blue Mountains. Staff are absolutely top notch, friendly and helpful as only Australians can be. The restaurant is much better than the usual hotel fare, and the Globe Bar is a great spot to relax. But the pool takes the cake. The ceiling is dark blue and painted with stars with small lights, a brilliant effect. The hotel is tucked away in Sydney's historic Rocks, but just a short walk over Observatory Hill (thus the name) to Circular Quay. All in all, always a treat to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ammark57
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Sydney a few times now, I think the Rocks area is my prefered location to stay. The hotel was beautiful, the staff very attentive. As we were only staying two nights ( a follow on stay after Canberra) I chose a standard city view room, which was very well appointed and spacious, and of great importance impeccably clean, as was the whole hotel. Any road noise was very minimal. A couple minuses were the $40 charge for breakfast, I don't think so, and $17 for a glass of wine. Walking to either the Rocks area, or Darling harbour is 5 - 10 mins, but easy going and not like the madness of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: Lucyleopard
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in a deluxe water view room. The view wasn't great being of cruise ships in port but it was the quieter side of the hotel which is good in a city. We had a couple of maintenance issues with our room but these well dealt with quickly. The hotel was very comfortable, the ambiance was relaxed with the guests seemingly being a mixture of business and leisure (we stayed midweek). The small gym was well equipped. Food: breakfast was expensive but the quality was good with plenty of choice on the continental buffet. We ate in the Galileo Restaurant one evening. We opted for the 5 course degustation menu which was excellent. The Concierges were excellent. They went out of their way to help us make the most of our time in Sydney providing ferry timetables, restaurant advice etc. Each time we returned they greeted us warmly and wanted to hear about our day. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants luxury with a more personal touch than is generally offered by "chain hotels."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great spot. But has its issues.”
Reviews.Author: Kevn7
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay at The Observatory was a really nice experience however for the price and stars we didnt expect DVD players we had to tap to load a disc and water dripping over our shoes in the closet. A call to front desk got us a brief " sorry, we will check it out later" and water was dripping from the floor above into the closet by then. The room was beautiful though and the day spa amenities are amazing. The spa and pool is a highlight. If you can get a good price on an king size room ( we were in 103) then you will enjoy a beautiful and classy hotel experience. Hopefully without maintenance issues and an old fashioned "water closet".

Reviews.Title: “Had to move out due to overbooking.”
Reviews.Author: Mona A
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel months in advance, and got a call 2 days before we were about to arrive that the hotel was overbooked and we had to stay at another hotel for our last two days of the stay. We were supposed to stay there for five nights and to have to move after just three nights was very uncovenient. The hotel picked us up at the airport for free and gave us a nice three course dinner, but we would rather stayed at the hotel for the whole stay then have to move. As long as you only have 5 days in Sydney, you would like to use everyday to enjoy yourself, not moving around. The hotel is very nice and the service is also good, but things like this should not happen at a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excelent service for a city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelbug76
Reviews.Content: Have to admit we were a bit reluctant about choosing the Observatory due to the big difference in price compare to the â€œbig nameâ€� hotels. I understand, must of them do offer harbor view, but even though we like to splurge from time to time in our hotel choices, we decided we wouldnâ€™t spend that much time in front of our window and would rather spend that difference enjoying the gastronomic choices in Sydney. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is on The Rocks area, a hot spot in the metropolitan area, walking distance to Darling Harbor, the Opera House and the CBD area. If you want to reach the Sydney Fish Market (A MUST) I suggest you rather take a taxi from there. A very well maintained hotel, victorian style, nice ambiance. Service is great, everybody was so attentive, reservation process was done very professionally. We decided to change our reservation and didnâ€™t encounter any trouble, they were very helpful. We even had a couple of problems with our room that now I donâ€™t even find worth it to mention because they were taken care of diligently.Rooms are cozy and VERY spacious. Breakfast was not included in our rate. It was pretty amazing but comes on a very high price, but then again you are in Sydney. Great choice of food, fresh juice. All in all very nice. You can find other places for breakfast around, if you are interested. Try The Fine Food Store at the Rocks, a good 10 mins. walk but in my opinion really worth it. Small and nice coffee shop, nice environment, wi-fi and choices for breakfast were great and healthy. A great value for money, totally worth it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrey s
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate, the service efficient and the location is superb. Loved the hotel, loved this city

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Sydney Visit”
Reviews.Author: Alanwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and really liked it. Close proximity to all good spots so you can walk everywhere. Tennis court across the street. Skip the Continental breakfast and go up Kent Street(to the left) for one third the price for a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Olde Worlde Style and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMumBerry
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old building with large rooms and stylish traditional decor. Big comfortable beds and modern bathrooms. Fantastic service is a stand out quality of the hotel, the concierges in particular were exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable. We stayed twice in November and December 2011, both in city view rooms. The higher floor had a little balcony to sit outside but a slightly smaller room and the bathroom has a shower over the bath. The lower floor room had no balcony but was a bigger room and had a separate shower. The hotel is a little bit of a walk from the main shopping area-but we were Christmas shopping and had several bags to carry! We have stayed in several hotels in Sydney at different times and this certainly ranks up there with the best because it is more personal and has more character than some of the bigger chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Class of Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: vimalvizag
Reviews.Content: We stayed on their Gourmet Package which included dinner and breakfast and it was a lovely stay. All the staff we encountered - in the lift, in the stairs, at any place in the hotel, always greeted us and made us feel very welcome. The room was very nice, clean, well equipped, pretty standard for a hotel of its type but well fitted out. The water view is out over the Barangaroo area and towards Darling Harbour and we even managed to see some fireworks in the evening over Darling Harbour. The pool is awesome. Parking was extra but we knew about that ahead of time. The only sad point was I managed to lose an expensive piece of jewellery. It may have been anywhere in Sydney, not just at the hotel but the hotel did try very hard to help me out. Only small criticism was to be offered "still or sparkling water" with dinner. I take still water to mean tap water (ie free) not $10+ a bottle water that arrives at the table already opened. Probably better to make this clear.On the plus side, our dinner was a set menu and when I didn't like either of the main courses, I was easily accomodated without any fuss - well done. Service was exemplary Overall, a lovely stay. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: We stayed on their Gourmet Package which included dinner and breakfast and it was a lovely stay. All the staff we encountered - in the lift, in the stairs, at any place in the hotel, always greeted us and made us feel very welcome. The room was very nice, clean, well equipped, pretty standard for a hotel of its type but well fitted out. The water view is out over the Barangaroo area and towards Darling Harbour and we even managed to see some fireworks in the evening over Darling Harbour. The pool is awesome. Parking was extra but we knew about that ahead of time. The only sad point was I managed to lose an expensive piece of jewellery. It may have been anywhere in Sydney, not just at the hotel but the hotel did try very hard to help me out. Only small criticism was to be offered "still or sparkling water" with dinner. I take still water to mean tap water (ie free) not $10+ a bottle water that arrives at the table already opened. Probably better to make this clear.On the plus side, our dinner was a set menu and when I didn't like either of the main courses, I was easily accomodated without any fuss - well done. Service was exemplary Overall, a lovely stay. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “So Special!”
Reviews.Author: koala2
Reviews.Content: After 5 stellar days at The Observatory, I never want to stay anywhere else in Sydney! I'm just so sorry it's taken me so long to find this beautiful gem. I couldn't fault a single thing, but the stand out for me is the staff - a fabulous group of warm, gracious, friendly, generous highly professional people who love what they do & it shows. Not a tinge of pomposity in any of them. Huge rooms with the added bonus of a short hallway with a door closing off the bedroom from the outside world. Not a chance of any disruption from noisy neighbours or insensitive guests slamming doors. The food was exceptional, other Hotels of this genre need to do some snooping & take notes. The public areas were incredibly comfortable & the Globe bar divine. Thank you from a grateful, loyal fan.xx

Reviews.Title: “Didn't see what the fuss is all about...”
Reviews.Author: LuckyStar81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for two nights recently for what I had hoped to be a luxury, relaxing weekend. But I ended up being quite disappointed. What others perhaps see as old world charm, we saw as rather outdated decor. I certainly do appreciate an antique/rustic style, however it seemed apparent that this hotel is simply old and tired and in need of an update. The room I purchased was advertised as being a "City View" room, however the view we actually got was a view of an old tennis court across the road with just a glimpse of an office building to our far right if you stretched your neck out far enough. Hardly what we would define as a "City View" room. Our TV was next to impossible to watch because of the poor reception, and upon mentioning this to staff on a couple of occasions, we were advised that some rooms unfortunately do get bad reception. Which, frankly, is an unacceptable excuse for a 5-Star hotel at 5-Star hotel prices. The staff, however, were this hotel's main asset. We were made to feel very welcome and taken care of for the most part (except for one member of the breakfast staff) and that's to be praised at least. Overall, our experience at this hotel was quite disappointing, especially for the price paid. I have stayed in 4-Star hotels which represented much better luxury and value.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Miss Bollie
Reviews.Content: From the welcome by the Concierge to check-in at Reception, the welcome received at this Hotel is always so warm and friendly. But this is only the beginning of a great experience for all who choose to stay in this delightful Hotel. The rooms are large and beautifully decorated, the bathrooms luxurious and the public spaces are quite lovely. The sense of total relaxation soon envelops you and the desire to extend your stay is ever present.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: grahamggm
Reviews.Content: Huge room, great staff, near the rocks area ideal for us rather a strange street though .Rather old world charm, we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at the Five Star level”
Reviews.Author: LadyMolestrangler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Observatory and on both occasions we have delighted in staying at this 5 star hotel that has a very separate and special nature. Firstly it is not catering for a massive number of guests and that is reflected in the friendly and welcoming staff. It was 11 years since our previous visit but the Reception staff welcomed us back. The concierge service is outstanding and they attempt to satisfy your every request. Our room was quality in terms of comfort; space; amenities and decoration. It was spotlessly clean and the room service was friendly and efficient. The swimming pool is tremendous with its stars in the ceiling and very subtlely lit. The Globe Bar was beautifully decorated and the service quick and reliable. We did not eat in the Observatory. Because of its splendid location - on foot, 5 minutes to the Rocks; 10 minutes to Circular Quay and the the CBD - we choose to eat out finding the restaurants on Circular Quay more economical than the Observatory for breakfast and great enjoyment in watching the comings and goings. We had a reservation through Travel 2 that was much more economical than booking direct but regardless of this we would not wish to stay anywhere else in Sydney than at the excellent Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, luxurious and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Fernjc
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is everything you want a hotel to be. It is large, but feels like a home from home. It has a certaing grandeur, but no stuffiness. Instead, the large rooms feel welcoming and comfortable, with every whim catered for, including a proper hai dryer and free wifi. The location is fantastic, an easy stroll to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the CBD. The food? Delicious. Fantastic service and great selection. The staff? Polite, helpful, friendly. The swimming pool? Wow, worth a stay for this alone...a proper pool, with dimmed lighting and a twinkling sky above. This feels every inch like a luxe spa pool. I could live in this hotel quite happily and it hard to fault it. It is expensive if you book direct, but affordable deals can be found on wotif and ratestogo etc.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class, elegant and charming.”
Reviews.Author: cucuruchito
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel makes a difference as regards hotel standards, not only in Sydney but internationally. Elegant, with attention to detail ,beautifully decorated and with one of the best restaurants , Galileo (best scallops ever..) Also, the bar , The Globe, where you are supposed to have informal meals.. is a great experience as well! Having breakfast at Galileo and its atmosphere.. is starting the day with all the possible glamour , the maitre is there to welcome you and Mauricio, one of the waiters remembers exactly what you want to have! The concierge service is remarkably outstanding, Michael Anderson and his team,we have to mention Ryan here, they are professional, kind and help you with everything you might need. We stayed for 10 nights in a very beautiful, spacious and comfortable suite with ocean view. There is no view to the opera house or the bridge but they are both at walking distance. The hotel is in The Rocks, a historic neighborhood not far from anywhere, 20 minutes by taxi to Bondi Beach, 10 to the Fish Market (great lunch experience), Darling Harbour (Sea Aquarium) , David Jones Mall (very good shopping there!) or Taronga Zoo where you can arrange coala encounters for your kids..and yourself! The pool is just lovely! It is the place to relax. Now, things to improve, and this one seriously: The spa needs to change to policies, it is not acceptable that in a stay of 10 days we could not be able to book a spa treatment. They said they were booked already every day! it seems it is open to non guests... I think they should save at least some free shifts so guests are able to book a treatment that lasts longer than 30 minutes... we were disappointed about that and when calling the spa we were told they were completely booked for 9 days in advance... (we couldn t make it). Spa is part of the service to be offered to guests and if you need to book 15 days in advance or the spa is understaffed or overbooked the hotel should let you know about this in advance. Also, wi fi!!! They need to fix that. There is no wi fi in the rooms. And Galileo Restaurant, I loved the atmosphere, the cipriani style lamps, the dim light, everything is perfect but two things: 1) The Samsung TV ruins that lovely corner table. 2) There is a universal trend to put on display empty bottles or great wines. Actually, this is closer to being considered trash than decoration details. It s disappointing as you get closer to the bottles as we did to the read the labels to notice someone has already had them and they are still there.. we don t get it. Please don t join this weird trend it has nothing to do with the rest of the hotel atmosphere. We would definitely go back and stay at The Observatory. It is a lovely hotel. It gives you the feeling you are at your elegant home in Sydney and everybody is there if you need something.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: andblake
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel. Comfortable rooms, a central yet secluded location, excellent restaurant and the most helpful concierge desk I have found in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Charm & Class”
Reviews.Author: RottenRonald
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stopover in Sydney and were lucky enough to book an one bedroom suite at an incredible rate. The suites are very comfortable, well decorated and a large bathroom with lots of amenities. We ate at the bar, Tapas style and found the food well above average. As throughout the hotel the level of service was exemplary and friendly. Definitely check out the pool. Highly recommended especially if you can score a good deal on a room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob12375
Reviews.Content: While traveling in Sydney on vacation we stayed at this hotel for four nights. We were upgraded by the hotel upon arrival and stayed in a lovely junior suite that had a balcony with a water view. They hotel is located in "the Rocks" area of Sydney and there was lots to do and see within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Sydney for business and leisure, my first choice is always the Observatory if I can get a good deal. Look for great barging on certain dates and book the hotel and plan your trip around this. Great service, lovely homely rooms and once you walk in you do not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Above and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Still call Australia Home
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for 2 nights in November and needed to stay in N.Sydney, but all hotels were sold out. I had stayed here 4 years ago on my last visit and called to see if they had space. I was very pleased they had space and enjoyed another delightful stay in the best hotel I have stayed in since the last time I was in Sydney. The rate for the room was less than for a lot of other hotels around the inner city for what was a truly luxurious experience. It took 10 minutes to cross the bridge to my meeting location. Perfect and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Sylvester1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Observatory after we attended a special party for me held in a private room. Thanks to the Observatory, the function was an outstanding success. In fact I cannot fault any aspect of the event. The food, the service and the room were all superb. Special mention must be made of the staff - every staff member we came across were excellent. In particular, the staff members who looked after our function went above and beyond their duty to make sure that the party was the success that it was. As for the hotel itself, this was our second stay in eighteen months. As the first time, we found the hotel comfortable, elegant and well located. The breakfast is a must. I love this hotel and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “All class - a really beautiful five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: HilsTassie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Observatory and I'm already planning when we can return. The Observatory is such a comfortable and beautifully appointed hotel. Quiet and at the same time walking distance from the city, Darling Harbour and the Rocks. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “it really is luxurious”
Reviews.Author: anne h
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the observatory hotel for one night in November, prior to embarking on a South Pacific Cruise. This was our first time staying in this hotel and it will not be our last. The location was perfect for us and also nice and quiet. The true gem of this hotel is Andrew the concierge, one of the best....

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: nswAustralia5
Reviews.Content: We have just been lucky enough to stay again at the Observatory. This time we stayed in a Deluxe room. Beautiful room, comfortable furniture. We were upgraded to a waterview, which was a lovely surprise. We tried the gym this time round, it is small, but packed with equipment, and did the job. We also tried the bar this time for dinner, great food, grand piano being played and good service, even though the place was quite busy. This hotel is wonderful, can't wait for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rasselas
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. It has an excellent position up behind the Rocks area so is easy walking distance to Circular Key, but is also in a very quiet street. The room was very large and beautifully furnished in a homely style, with a large bathroom including a huge bath and separate shower. Some rooms look onto the inner harbour, but we had a less expensive (but for us still very expensive) room looking across to a tennis court. Very pleasant. There was a balcony and we opened the french windows and ate breakfast next to them. We usually stay in much cheaper hotels so the price of breakfast in the dining room was a bit of a shock, but room service prices were reasonable and you could just order one thing, making it much more economical. There is a small cafe a short stroll north of the hotel which you could try, but the room was so nice we just enjoyed spending a little time there. We also bought some excellent samosas from an Indian restaurant there and took them back to the room. There is a lovely bar area where you can have nice food reasonably priced for dinner. The service was impeccable throughout the hotel. I'm not a fan of 5 star hotels when I travel as I find them too clinical and their service often has a forced, fake feel (not to mention I usually travel on a budget). Not this place, which manages to feel like a small and homely hotel even while it has every luxury. Mrs Rasselas recommends the relaxation massage in the spa. There is a swimming pool. Transport - walking is good from there but taxis are the best option if you are not very fit. We tended to eat over in Surry Hills area which has many excellent cafes and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Re: Warmth”
Reviews.Author: JbirdMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great service, boutique feel. Friendly staff. Location is a little removed but can get to places via taxi. Room service great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely Service, Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: Everything about the experience of being at the Observatory is excellent, in an expensive way! Every person was courteous, helpful, and went out of their way to provide an excellent standard of service rarely seen in Sydney. Yes, the decor is a bit like your Grandma's house, but the rooms are huge, silent, and equipped with anything you might want. The bathroom is the main reason I will come back, with a lovely rainshower as well as a normal showerhead (for those times you don't want to get your hair wet), great water pressure and the most lovely big deep bath with complimentary lavender bath salts in a silver dish on the side. Superb and SO relaxing. The restaurant itself is very expensive, but room service is not overly expensive for 5 star and the food excellent. If only one could check in earlier and leave later it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great times remembered still!”
Reviews.Author: JacOnH0liday
Reviews.Content: I have had in the past two functions at this hotel, and can say that the service goes beyond what you expect. The partys were in the last 10yrs, but a recent stay this year, i can see the standard of service has not changed. My mum had her 60th birthday on Christmas Day in the yr 2000, and we had a party of 18! I still remember that despite the Christmas bustle we recieved top class service and attention! My second function was my 28th birthday in one of the function rooms... This was a surprise party for me, and i stayed up to 4am sitting with a couple of friends and the service right through to that time never stopped. The attention to detail of service came right down to supplying my poor husband with Berocca in the early hours of the morning too. First class. I remember i tore my stocking, and they provided nail polish for me on request to stop the stocking from tearing further... How great are they!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive care and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBookgirl
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate to travel extensively and stay in many impressive hotels overseas. This was a fantastic surprise for an Australian hotel, which reminded me of the Peninsula HK, my personal gold standard in service. I stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and quiet, but it really was the service which impressed. From the point of arrival, and being met by the very professional James, through to check in with Edward, I could not speak more highly of my time at this hotel. The room service menu is limited, but the staff were very helpful when I said that I wanted a lighter option, modifying an existing dish. The in room breakfast was fresh and delicious, and the range available was excellent. Thank you for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Staff 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Camerong
Reviews.Content: This property is a lovely hotel. What make this property standout from its competitors is not it's facility's but the staff. The staff are best practice for this industry. I have never stayed in any hotel worldwide that have such professional staff. Congratulation to the staff of the Observatory, you make another Sydney 5 star hotel, a great hotel. Cameron Grace

Reviews.Title: “Classy and charming”
Reviews.Author: FRANK11528
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this beautiful hotel. The check in process was efficient and quick. I asked if I could have a look at their one bedroom suite as I was booked in a junior suite. The rooms are just fantastic if you like that old English type of decor.I particularly like the Nespresso coffee machine, something I think all hotels should have as instant coffee can be hard to swallow. I left my car in the street for the Concierge to park and the car was waiting for me when I checked out. Service is excellent, the rooms are clean and spotless. If there is one minus ( only a small one), I would say that my junior suite had too much furniture in it making it a little cluttered. Overall, my hearty congratulations to the managment team at The Observatory Hotel - keep up the good work. I will be back before years end.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: spj709Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Saturday night after being given the night by our daughter as our birthday presents. It was wonderful. Fantastic service and a great room very well equiped. We wish we could have stayed there longer.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: We find ourselves always going back to this Hotel, everything is just perfect, decor is old English, everything is in the right place, service is second to none, the restaurant is awesome (expensive) but very very good food. The soap is the best, " I even asked where they got it so we could get some for home" You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jaimeandjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for two nights as part of our babymoon - a month before the birth of our baby boy. We were keen to spend the weekend somewhere special in our home town. We absolutely got it right. The hotel is magestic. Old world furnishings and expansive rooms, magnificent beds, great food, unmatched room service, superb pool and gym. My only concern is that this review does not do it justice. One great feature was that this is the only 5 star hotel in Australia that allows pets (and has pet food on the menu....one of the many things that makes it world class.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: TVBA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night since the company had a conference there. The room is large for the CBD hotel standard. I stayed at 3rd floor and found cockoraches in the bathroom.... The bathtub is pretty high and is quite difficult to "climb" in if you are not very tall. It would be hard for any elderly travelers. We had buffet lunch in their resturant and I have to personally send my plate to the waiters a few times in order to have a clean one for my next dish. I told them that they have to keep on eyes on the dirty plate which is quite a basic service standard for any buffet meals. It's ok if the company pay the bill otherwise I'd be very disappointed for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Tracy528
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent and very comfortable rooms. They are very regal. The staff at all hours of the day are attentive and willing to help you with your stay. I will definitely stay Hera again. The location is not a far away from the rocks and circular Quay. In a quiter location away from the hustle of Sydney Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: singpon
Reviews.Content: I lived in Sydney for 4 years and never really had the chance to stay in a hotel over there. When I got back there in June this year we stayed 3 nights in the Observatory Hotel. I had has the spa day a few years ago and since then I was longing for staying there for a couple of nights. We were upgraded to this fantastic suite with separate living,champagne and a personal card from the manager. The decoration is classic and quite charming and I really liked the fact that I could open the windows and enjoy the fresh breeze and the view. The breakfast is just PERFECT...great menu! Staff is helpful and the location is good as well,just a few minutes away from the buzz of Sydney's cbd.

Reviews.Title: “Michael Anderson the concierge was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cassidy24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three hotels while in Sydney: The Observatory, The Four Seasons and the Amora Hotel Jamison. The Observatory was our favorite, hands down. The room (and the bath) were huge compared to the other hotels, and very charming. The service was superior in every way -- and the concierge Michael Anderson recommended two delicious restaurants and got us last minute reservations, with detailed directions to get there. Our only complaint was that the other two hotels upgraded us to harbor views and the Observatory did not, though there were probably a few empty rooms. Also, the bedspread is a bit shabby and needs a re-do, though it was clean. The Rocks location will not appeal to everyone. If old world charm isn't your thing, stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: We had spent the previous week at the Cape Grace Hotel in Cape Town, which seems to me to be the ideal boutique hotel. The Observatory isn't. The strengths of this hotel are the good sized room, with a particularly nice shower, and the generally helpful staff. We had a room with "charming views of Observatory Hill". Actually all we could see was a road. The" welcome fruit bowl" contained a satsuma and two small nectarines which were still rock hard when we left. Internet is not complementary and, although expensive at $10 per hour or $20 per day, there is no WiFi in the room. Connecting the very short Ethernet cable involved getting down on all fours under the desk. Two large bottles of mineral water were on display but these were of course $10 each to consume (previously I have only seen this revenue generating idea in low end chain hotels). Paying by credit card attracted a surcharge (a bit like a budget airline and the first time i have ever seen this in a hotel). Downstairs public rooms were continuously taken up by functions. I will not return

Reviews.Title: “A special experience”
Reviews.Author: Rob A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at the Observatory for two nights to kick off our honeymoon - having previously stayed following our engangement. On both occasions we have found the staff, hotel and whole experience to be top notch. Staff are friendly and helpful and go out of their way to make the stay enjoyable. The hotel itself is well located, luxurious and a great place to either base yourself to experieince Sydney or (in our case) stay in and treat ourselves. Thanks to everyone we met and were served by for a fantastic experience - I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Australiando
Reviews.Content: We've been at The Observatory Hotel in October (three nights). Our Junior Suite was perfect, big, absolutely clean. The staff was nice and friendly. The hotel is in a very good position; a lot of places are in 15 minutes walk. Also the Galileo restaurant was good. We're satisfied. The only remark is: "I cannot spend 9 dollars for drinking a "special" (for you) water from the minibar".

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Archieflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is starting to look dated even if the rooms still retain a little of the old world charm. The room was fairly small and had just enough space for the bed, TV stand and a writing table. Breakfast is a very limited selection and dining is limited, menu-wise and it's pricey. You're better off taking a walk to Darling Harbour where there is a nice selection of restaurants. The service was impeccable, though and the concierge was one of the most helpful ones I have encountered. Location-wise, it's fairly decent as it's a nice stroll to the CBD or Darling Harbour, but still a fairly quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Debbie J
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a trip of a lifetime - we had booked 8 nights at this hotel - paid in advance (a requirement of our booking). The room was pleasant, comfortable and overlooked the harbour although we weren't impressed with the half bottle of rather expensive white wine in the mini bar (screw top) which had been opened by a previous occupant and filled with water - nice. We waited over an hour for a replacement which was warm and we were still charged for it. The hotel tried to charge double the price for the car parking (we hired a car for a couple of days) an apology would've been appreciated when we checked our bill. Oh yes the very expensive restaurant - we were given the worst positioned table in the restaurant which rocked as the table top was so loose, eventually we were moved to another table to find someone elses wine bucket positioned at the side of my chair - limited overpriced menu and a surly front of house waitress who served my husband before me - whatever happened to good old fashioned ladies first? We ate out for the rest of the week. Then the hotel lost my towelling dress I brought with me - it was mistaken for a towel by the housemaid - we did manage to get some compensation for this. We went down for breakfast once - the menu was OK but again ridiculously expensive for what it was. Just down the road there is some very poor housing stock which we weren't expecting in the vicinity of the hotel.....p s .make sure you have deep pockets at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: eiscicle
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at more budget-conscious hotels but decided to splurge on a recent trip to Sydney. The Observatory was worth every penny! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Everything was impeccable, from the state of the room to the attentiveness of the staff. Highly recommended if your pockets are deep enough to afford this place! :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJW337
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights at this hotel and we both thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Without exception, all the staff were very professional and offered us every assistance during our stay. The room was very spacious, comfortable and well appointed. We loved the old world charm exuded by the quality furnishings and fittings. It is well located and within walking distance of many services and attractions. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to OEH standards.”
Reviews.Author: Sinatrad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty and needs an upgrade. Stains in the elavator and filthy walls throughout The staff is mediocre and service is lacking. Drinks are overpriced in the Globe bar.

Reviews.Title: “Costly extras but worth it”
Reviews.Author: mrfleetAuckland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on many occasions and despite no club lounge, no complimentary wi-fi it remains our favorite hotel in Sydney. Service impeccable, wonderful rooms and it's only a 10 minute walk to The Rocks. We were upgraded to harbour view room and this was greatly appreciated. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you don't mind paying a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: yoyowayno
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 9:50am on the day of our booking, we were welcomed by the concierge who took our bags and last name and were escorted to reception. We were then welcomed by reception, who knew our name and booking which was great. Our room wasn't ready as yet, which we were ok with and were happy to only drop off our bags. However, they accommodated us and found a room for us which was available immediately. A porter brought our bags to the room and was very friendly and showed us around the spacious accommodation. It was clean, decorated in a period manner akin to the rest hotel, and had small touches like the expected weather/temperature for the next day on the room service menu. The spa/pool area was pretty special and very picturesque. The location was good that it was close to circular quay and some markets and other attractions. Albeit the immediate neighbourhood is a little rundown. We paid an excellent rate with wotif.com and would stay there again (especially if we could get that rate again!)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: haveboots_willtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once after our flight in from the UK, and once before flying back - five nights in total. In the first stay we had a cityview room with shower over the bath, and in the second stay we were upgraded to a harbour view room with a separate shower cubicle, double sink and better toiletries. Both stays were very comfortable, no noise at night (we slept well), friendly staff and a good breakfast (which is expensive at $45 but we always got it for $30). The hotel interior is a bit olde worldy, but you can't beat clean rooms, fluffy towels and excellent service. The hotel location was good for us, just a short walk to the harbour, and good restaurants and pubs nearby (Fish at the Rocks and the Lord Nelson). As seems normal in Australia, the wifi is expensive, but we could use the hotel's business center to check in for flights. If we ever return to Sydney we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: MREL7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Observatory Hotel with a friend for 3 nights. I can honestly say that this place blew us away. Our twin-share room was spacious, exceptionally clean and quiet! We did not hear any noise from the street or from other rooms at any stage during our stay. The bathroom has a very large shower and a seperate bath. The pool and spa area are wonderful - guests can help themselves to tea or water whilst relaxing in the area. The newspaper is provided every morning and a bottle of water is placed by the bedside tables each night. The service at The Observatory is superb - especially from concierge. I must thank Michael (Chief Concierge) who provided us with fantastic suggestions on where to dine or have a drink. We enjoyed every place that was recommended which enhanced our time in Sydney. I must also thank Brian and Gustavo from concierge who always provided us with accurate directions, happily answered our questions, provided us with endless information and booked our shuttle. Fantastic hospitality! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is contemplating on staying here to relax and unwind as we did. It is in the most beautiful location - stone throw away from The Rocks, a short walk to Darling Harbour and it is very easy to get into the city centre. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: ANAVOA
Reviews.Content: I have been to Sydney many times and I have never stayed at a hotel that was so comfortable. We arrived very late at about 11pm and the room was great. The bed was prepared, there was welcome fruit and a card congratulating our anniversary. There was water in the kettle for us to make a hot chocolate drink or Valerian tea. Just so very thoughtful. In the morning, we realised there was a balcony which we could sit out and get some fresh air. Also I thought the room was very spacious compared to a lot of hotels in sydney. I also used the gym and the pool which was amazing. Alas I didn't had time to try the spa which I definitely will oneday. The other good point about this hotel is how close it is to the Sydney Observatory. We did a night tour there which was a highlight of our trip. Also we walked to the rocks which was so lovely. The hotel is very convenient to get to darling harbour and king st wharf too. Overall, I was incredibly happy with the trip and the hotel. Definitely would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly so many other choices”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel online for my girlfriend's birthday on a secret deal so was a little nervous but read some good reviews. When we arrived the foyer looked beautiful but then when walking up to the desk i saw bits of the 'old world charm' were actually just a bit old. The woman at the desk then informed us that because we'd booked online there wasn't a king sized bed so we'd either have to have a twin room or pay $75 dollars extra for a king bed. She added that it was because we'd booked through another agent - as if that was a little bit lower than booking through the hotel. Coupled with the extra fee for parking it was the greatest start to the weekend but I was looking forward to the room. Suspiciously it looked like the any of the king rooms advertised, however older. I like antique decor but our room really felt like it needed a good refurb. Draws were broken, wood was chipped, the bed was saggy and the blanket across it seemed very old and worn. The bathroom was nice though with a great bath. We had breakfast and it was adequate. While the buffet isn't extensive and the meals not much better than a cafe down the road the setting is lovely as were the waiters - but you do expect that from what is meant to be a five star hotel. Sadly I won't be back nor will I recommend this hotel to anyone. Character is one thing but great character needs upkeep and needs to be passed on the staff. There are many exquisite hotels in Sydney for the same price or less.

Reviews.Title: “A very good boutique hotel: Civilized, old world charm and personal.”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights and it was raining a lot on the weekend so I stayed in quite a bit. My room was one of the smaller ones just opposite the lifts but I have no complaints: They're still spacious and noise was never an issue. Room service is swift. Staff are wonderful, service almost as good as in Asia. Tall Michael, chief concierge, is truly world-class and tops them all. I'd ask him to run my hotel if I had one. Location is fine, even though the CBD is obviously not a beach. If you prefer a more anonymous place to stay and if you're into 21st century modernities this is not the right place for you as it's old world and personal. The only little downside is a rather limited food menu in the bar - that menu would profit from some additions.

Reviews.Title: “Home away From Home”
Reviews.Author: rickie g
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when in the area. Because I often travel for business, this hotel has become somewhat of a 'home away from home' when I am away. The rooms are massive, the food is great, the service is even better. I always look forward to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Head Staff failure.”
Reviews.Author: empty186
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days for a conference recently. Rooms are oversize and tasteful but the beds were shockingly saggy. Area is generally quite at night but within walking distance to the Quay, the Rocks, Darling Harbour. Caution: don't try to drive during peak hour, nightmare to get out of the area! Food in Galileo.......Michelin star Chef Masahiko Yomoda trained under Joel Robuchon - enough said, he lives up to his reputation. However...... The overly bubbly, Head Waitress took our order... Entree was wonderful.... Mains arrived..... 5 minutes later I asked Ms Bubbly if there was a reason I was looking at my $70 piece of steak with no side dishes! Looking agast she bolted to the kitchen then came back to tell me the Chef had overcooked the sides and was redoing them! I wonder if she told him the excuse she used???? Room Service breakfast was a delight as was the Room Service waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Space and refinement”
Reviews.Author: jakin4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice within the last month, on both occasions I received service beyond reproach and the rooms are much larger than and more comfortable than many other hotels in the 5* category. The position of the hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, however this shouldn't stop you from staying here. It's easy to grab a taxi and I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for one to arrive. I used my centurion card to book this hotel, and included in my room rate was a $100 bottle of wine in my room, continental breakfast as well as an early check in, late check out and a guaranteed upgrade at the time of booking. The only concern to me is the room service offerings, it falls short of most other hotels. This is only a problem if you arrive at a late hour and the restaurant is full (I arrived on the first occasion at 8pm into the hotel and couldn't get in) or don't want to be bothered with a taxi. I mentioned at checkout on my first visit that I'd like to see at least a steak on the menu. On my return about a month later, the room service menu had been updated to include a steak. I ordered it and it was fine.. To be honest, i could have been on the menu in the first instance, but I didn't see it. Will be returning to this hotel on a regular basis, whenever I stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Annoyed and Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was great, the staff very generous, and the hotel itself is very nice. But that's where my good review stops. Their accounts and administration department seem to be fairly incompetent and after 8 days, alot of phone calls on my behalf (one returned on their behalf!) I still have some extra mystery charges (that they have no record of charging to my card) and a very large $780 deposit holding yet to be refunded (that I was told would be released after 3-5 days even though my trip was pre-paid by my business). I usually wouldn't make such a fuss, but you would think a hotel as nice as this one would have their accounts in order, and the hotel staff's obvious inability to admit fault on their behalf is pretty frustrating (and getting passed onto a different department or manager every time I call isn't the best feeling). By all means, stay at the observatory, it's a very nice hotel, but if an issue arises, don't expect it to be resolved in a timely fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Well done and with a great concierge”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus3325
Reviews.Content: We were there in August and the place is wonderful - especially the service, which was very accommodating. We arrived at 9 AM and they told us to use the indoor (gorgeous) pool and spa area, which we did until 11:30, then to the room. Well-appointed and immaculate room and bath. The concierge (tallish and in his early 50s, I would guess - but I cannot recall his name!) was extremely helpful - he gave us directions to a great French-owned patisserie as well as to a few places around the Rocks area. He was spot on - the French place really hit the mark. We will stay there again when returning to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fodorâ€™s Favorite in Sydney, A Fantastic Boutique Hotel Vies for Best in Sydney. We Loved it. Small, but First Class!”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here at the tail-end of our honeymoon and found the hotel to be 5-Star (which is tops by U.S. Measures) and worthy of the many accolades it has receivedâ€”including the favorite Sydney Hotel in our 2012 Fodorâ€™s guide book. Great service, fantastic old-world rooms, marble baths, rainshower baths, a good mini-bar, comfortable beds, iPod friendly stereos and all around room comfort We were upgraded to a corner suiteâ€”which is worth requesting.
