Itâ€™s in a fantastic part of town with lots of walk to in the Rocks and nearby Georges Street. This is a smaller hotel, only three floors, so views are limited. The Globe Bar was ultra luxe, but comfortable. The restaurant looked fantastic. Room service was prompt and first-rate foods. Our ONLY complaints were that: a) Wireless Internet is limited to certain places in the hotel. Being an old building, they probably need dozens of transmittersâ€”but for a 5-star hotelâ€”they should buck up for complete wireless. Come on! Please fix this. b) Expensive. You get what you pay forâ€¦ so this is not a complaintâ€”just a caveat for the budget traveler. We found all extras (room service, liquor, laundry) at hotels to be higher than the U.S. Apparently, the Australian government taxes the blazes out of everything and it shows. We had to launder some clothes midway through our two week trip, and the price was sky high. But, of course, everything was done First Class. I can strongly recommend The Observatory to travelers who like a boutique-style Ritz-Carlton hotel with Four Seasons service and accommodations. Rooms appeared to range from $350AUS to $600AUS. The suite had two rooms and two bathrooms and two sinks. GREAT for a busy couple or with one spouse working quietly in another room. The hotel is in an older building and the furnishings are well-made older items. Also, thereâ€™s a great wine shop about Â½ block up Kent Street with a fabulous selection. Grab a bottle there vs. room service. Good hotel for adults, couples, business travelers. No for kids.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coorong
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best hotel in Australia. it is certainly my favourite. The welcome is personal and they actually remember that you've been before. In my case, my first visit was on a lastminute.com deal but the second time I checked in the desk staff were lovely and welcoming. The rooms are quietly elegant, the bathroom amenities luxurious. You feel cosseted and special but the service is not obtrusive. The only other time I have felt like this as a hotel guest was in Paris at the Hotel d"Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent guest services, but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: pkmiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property about 7 years ago and not much has changed. The service is still really wonderful, especially the concierge. However, the rooms and public spaces look the same, they really need to update. Also, the food is ok but it used to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, stay what more can you say”
Reviews.Author: SpannerPerthWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Observatory Hotel for 2 nights from the 11 th September.The location is fabulous within walking distance of all the major attractions. Walk around the Rocks to central Sydney. Great restaurants, for example Fish at the Rocks (100m), pubs the Lord Nelson (150m). The suite was really beautifully furnished well laid out and the views over the harbour were great. The Spa/pool/exercise area was great. Simply great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed at The Observatory Hotel for 3 nights from the 3rd of September.The location is fabulous within walking distance of all the major attractions. Our morning would start with a walk around the Rocks, to the Bridge, Opera House and into the Botanical Gardens. We would breakfast by the water at Circular Quay. What a way to start the day. I have always wanted to stay at The Observatory and we were not disappointed. The staff were outstanding and nothing was too much trouble. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean and the bathroom large with a separate shower and huge bath. We had a basic room overlooking Kent street on the first floor. There were no noise issues as that end of Kent street is very quiet. The lounge /bar area is lovely for a drink, we didn't try the restaurant but the room service was wonderful. The Spa and pool area was simply gorgeous we didn't swim this time but will definately bring bathers next time. All in all a wonderful stay , we visit Sydney very frequently as our son lives there we will definately stay at The Observatory again and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We finally understand why it's so highly regarded...”
Reviews.Content: Our first encounter with the hotel was through their excellent restaurant - Galileo, some months back. After a few visits to the restaurant and bar, I realised that this hotel has the benefit of being just far enough from the 'busy' part of town to make it a nice, quiet location. Late in August we stayed here as part of a birthday celebration with my wife, and the hotel exceeded our expectations in every possible way. From check in, to check out we were treated like premium travellers - something I last experienced in Europe at some of the higher end establishments. Staff here are clearly trained to a higher standard than many of the other hotels in Australia. Small touches such as 'chocolate birthday wishes' in our suite from the staff really made all the difference to our arrival. The spa and pool faciltiies are simply excellent, and I doubt you'll find better in Sydney. High tea seems to be incredibly popular on the weekends too, and I'm sorry that I didn't make a booking. Overall, a wonderful experience and will continue to return to the restaurant, bar and now the accommodation for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant yet welcoming”
Reviews.Author: SANDRA V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed three nights and we were wowed the entire stay. Our room was on the top floor with a glorious balcony and a beautiful view of The Observatory Park. The bathroom was huge and luxurious as was the room. The turn down service at night was particularly appreciated. Only downside with room was a slightly squishy bed - too soft for my taste. The location of The Hotel was perfection. Just a short stroll from Wynard Railway Station and a beautiful 5 minute meander to The Rocks and Circular Quay or 10 mins to CBD and Darling Harbour. At night we enjoyed dining at Mr Chow's and also Curry on The Rocks, both outstanding and approximately 1 minute walk. We did splurge on breakfast at the hotel on the final morning and were overwhelmed with the stylish restaurant and simple but perfect dining choices. One small observation that by 9.00 am the staff were very busy and there was a delay with requests for toast and hot drinks. A special thanks would have to go to Michael who is employed as a Conceirge who took care of us from the moment we arrived. This is the only hotel we would consider staying on our next visit to Sydney. Thank you so much for the best holiday we have enjoyed for a long time and our stay at the Hotel was definitely the hightlight!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel which will always be our preferred choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Littmans92
Reviews.Content: Situated near the Rocks and Circular Quay in an historic area of Sydney, the Observatory ranks as one of the best small hotels in the world. We were upgraded to an executive suite which had impeccable furnishings, coffee machine and river views. Service is prompt and professional. Staff go the extra mile in order to provide a consistently high level of guest care.The concierges were always helpful, knowledgeable and good humoured. There are a number of good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Excellent breakfasts are provided in colonial style surroundings in a room whose walls are covered in cartoon sketches depicting memorable Australian events. This is a hotel for travellers who like stylish, colonial style accommodation and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Place to Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MelanieSD
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in luxury and feel like and be treated like royalty then this is the hotel to stay in. The staff are outstanding from reception through to the chamber maids. The food is heavenly and even room service is 5 stars. There is a fabulous spa downstairs where you can be pampered and a beautiful indoor swimming pool where you can lie and relax and look up at the starlit sky. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Before I lived in Sydney I stayed here many times and I absolutely love it. It is an hotel that exudes elegance and class and is a must to stay in. There are very few hotels in Australia that have such a professional and yet personal service. Enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: nswAustralia5
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were met by the concierge who arranged for our car to be parked and escorted us to reception. We were then taken to our Jnr Suite and given the tour of our suite. To my delight our suite contained a coffee machine. We then went for a walk across the street to the Observatory on Observatory Hill, what fantastic views. We then went down to the hotel's pool and changed in the separate mens and womens change rooms (with robe and slippers waiting in locker), showered in beautiful change rooms afterwards, had a chilled glass of water. Went back to our room and got ready for dinner at the Observatory's restaurant - Galileo Restaurant, which was nice enough, long wait for food and long wait between each course. The shower in our Jnr Suite was fantastic, with your choice of two shower heads. We also had a very deep bath in our suite (we didn't use, but looked lovely). The toiletries they supplied were "Peter Morrisey". We were also supplied with the biggest heaviest most wonderful bathrobes to use during our stay (which you can buy for $180). Then checked out the Observatory's Sidney Nolan art works. Read the complimentary paper in the superb Drawing Room, before retiring for the night. Turn down service supplied complimentary bottled water, tea and coco mix. The next morning we walked five minutes to the Rocks and had breakfast at Pancakes on the Rocks. The staff at the Observatory, as all other Trip Advisor reviews have stated, were exceptional. The decor in our room was absolutely beautiful. We are already talking about the next time we can spoil ourselves and return to the Observatory. Totally recommend The Observatory Hotel if you are staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy69Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at "The Observatory". On arrival I was pleasently surprised by the decor and plushness of the foyer. Formal greetings out of the way I was shown to my room. Large living area with nice furnishings. Complimentary fruit platter and PC access in business area. Enjoyed a drink at the bar before dinner. All very civilised. My sleep was excellent thanks to the high end quality of the bed and linen. I would return to this hotel based on professionalism of staff, value for money and comfort factor.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THE HIGH TEA”
Reviews.Author: jbootsaus
Reviews.Content: The High Tea for $70 per person is a total ripoff. We asked for some extra sandwiches and were charged $9 extra per person for a small plate. The scones were the most pathetically small things you have ever seen. Totally disgraceful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: ozgypsy
Reviews.Content: The staff, restaurant, bed, bath, furnishings and decor were all of the highest standard. Sadly we only had one night here; I could have gladly extended our stay longer. Our request for a late checkout was cheerfully granted. Only one negative- the lovely shower sadly lacked water pressure, but it would certainly not deter us from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Viajoefico
Reviews.Content: This quite small hotel has all details well taken care of, with an efficient and helpful staff, cozy and comfortable rooms, great spa with a fantastic swimming pool, jacuzzi, vapor room and sauna that are themselves worth paying the rather high rate. Great location on a quite road, still very close to The Rocks, the Sydney Harbour, Darling Harbour and the CBD. The top among the 4 high-end hotels I've stayed at in The City.

Reviews.Title: “Very nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: ENTP Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Observatory hotel in August 2011 for three nights on a business trip and there is much to recommend it. The interiors are traditionally handsome rather than stylish (you could be in Claridges) and even the scale of the building itself lends an air of quiet reserve. All the staff I met were both helpful and friendly without being obsequious and expressed a genuine desire to ensure that my stay was enjoyable. Someone clearly has an eye for detail, too, from the floral arrangments in the public areas to the exquisite swimming pool - all are approprtiately luxurious but not gauche. The rooms are a decent size and tastefully appointed with Serendipity courtesy sets and the usual refinements. Breakfast is a high-quality affair and available until 10:30. The only drawback, in fact, is the IT. There is no WIFI in the rooms and the public system on the ground floor is painfully slow. Similarly, the public computer and printer are ancient. If you are on holiday no doubt this will not trouble you but for business trvaellers it is woefully out of keeping with the otherwise uniformly high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Eloise_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before and of my wedding a few months ago. The suite was beautiful, just what I wanted and the perfect backdrop for pre-wedding photos. Loved the antique furniture. They did a wonderful job of tidying up the room between leaving for the ceremony and returning after the wedding (and believe me, we left it in quite a mess). Bed and bathroom deserve a special mention, both were superb.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAFF! AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: HotelManager
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 8 nights and this one of the best service experiences I've ever had in my life. The front desk staff was so helpful throughout my stay. They were always willing to help. The restaurant staff was truly amazing. They knew which table I liked and would put a "reserved" sign on it each morning for me. They were so intentive, not just to me, but every customer in the restaurant. The food itself was amazing too. I liked being able to get freshly squeezed watermelon juice, or freshly squeezed pineapple, grapefruit, or orange..very nice. The pastries were amazing. I looked forward to breakfast each morning. The hotel is very clean. The housekeeping staff was amazing. It was nice being able to use the gym. The pool is indoor and HUGE!!!! It was very peaceful, I loved it. Thank you everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most elegant hotel I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Pegster
Reviews.Content: Stepped into the hotel, I felt like I have turned back the clock to the 1920s...being used to business hotels and was on a business trip when I stayed in this hotel...I can't help but feel like I am on a holiday! Luxurious, classical, elegant decor and friendly staff - definitely lived up to a 5 star hotel. The room were HUGE! Very clean ... and you have a choice of an express check-out which I enjoyed! Bar has live jazz music in the evenings - again, such a charming bar with antique looking furnishings it is a good place to wind down after work. Breakfast in the morning is european style and amazing , fantastic services very healthy breakie - no oily bacon and eggs though you definitely can order them! Best yet to mentioned - is great location! 10 mins to circular quay, 5 mins to the ROCKS. remember to walk up the hill in front of the hotel! You get the most amazing, breath-taking view of Sydney Harbour....day and night - a great place to have a picnic as well...

Reviews.Title: “Place to come back..”
Reviews.Author: Xela55
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel which is in 10 minutes walking distance to the Harbour/Opera House and in 15 minutes you are in the Centre. Pleasant rooms, excellent and friendly staff. Very good concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: KRB222
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews say, this is just a beautiful hotel with outstanding service, and we will definitely stay here again. My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week vacation throughout Australia, and it was a wonderful way to end our trip. While the location is a bit out of the way, it's certainly not inconvenient, and it's nice that it's in a quieter, more residential area. The surrounding Rocks neighborhood is very cute, and it's a short walk to sights and restaurants. The concierges were all extremely helpful, with recommendations, directions, and making restaurant reservations for us. The room was beautiful with very nice turn down service every night, and the bathroom was spacious and luxurious. Thoughtful little touches throughout the room really made it feel special. The pool was beautiful, and we wish we had spent more time there. Overall a fantastic stay and we would love to stay here again! Also - we ate dinner at Fish at the Rocks, just down the street, which was an excellent place for fresh, delicious seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Simlpy superb”
Reviews.Author: n0maDz
Reviews.Content: This hotel sets the benchmark for elegance, service and comfort. Our room was beautiful with fine furnishings that were reminiscent of a country estate in England, but with the bonus of Sydney harbour views. A welcome plate of petit fours (for my birthday) was a lovely touch. The bathroom was enormous and supplied with every amenity. Unlike some other premium hotels, the over sized shower head made showering a relaxing experience. The staff were outstanding even greeting us by name each time we left the hotel. At check- in I was wished a happy birthday. This was something my husband had made only a brief reference to when he was booking the room. Clearly though, it had been noted. Personal attention such as this was a feature of our stay. The bar area was a pleasant place to sit and watch the passing parade outside. The high tea is well worth trying, even if you are not a guest of the hotel. The indoor pool area is magical to look at with lots of downlights that look like stars in the sky. The breakfast was a little disappointing with a buffet continental section and a la carte hot food. At $45 a head I would have expected a wider selection and the buckwheat pancake is not something I'd try again. Strangely, the bircher muesli was served in tiny shot glasses. Location wise the hotel is an easy walk to the Rocks area and Circular Quay. It is also not too far to walk to the King St Wharf area where there are several good restaurants. It was a pricey stay, but for a special occasion in beautiful surroundings well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Vitrioleuse
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on our first child free night in 2 years and it was the perfect romantic winter escape. The service at this hotel sets a standard by which I will judge service provision from now on. As for the hotel itself, the only flaw I noticed was some of the tiles around the spa were in poor repair. It made the area seem dirty in a way. But this is easily overlooked considering the faultless service and surroundings we otherwise experienced. It is also worth noting that this is the first time I have stayed in such a classically styled hotel as opposed to more edgy, modern establishments. If I was up for a big night on the town, I may have found the surroundings a bit too sedate. As it turns out this was the perfect setting for our relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: girlfromca
Reviews.Content: I am so happy we stayed at this hotel in Sydney. It was so charming and unique and everything we hoped for during our stay. The rooms are lovely and so comfortable. Everyone who we encountered at The Observatory definitely went above and beyond regarding customer service. The food in the restaurant was delicious -- ambiance was perfect. The spa is beautiful. We all loved this hotel. Definitely would only stay at The Observatory upon return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FoodiePlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Observatory hotel for our last week in Oz. We arrived in the hotel and were greeted by very professional staff who were extremley helpful. The room we stayed in was a good size with all of the creature comforts and more. The hotel is located in what seems to be the middle of a normal residential street. As long as you don't mind walking up and down some hills the location is ideal for the centre. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: tosh48
Reviews.Content: We had a high tea at the hotel last year and were very impressed. We decided then that it would be nice to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday at this hotel which we did and found it to be a true 5 star hotel. From the moment we arrived we were treated as someone special by all the staff. The room was plush and welcoming making us feel relaxed. The bathroom was huge with top class toiletries. Great swimming pool, fantastic breakfast, conscientious staff. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On.”
Reviews.Author: PrettyIsParamount
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and admittedly have stayed a couple of times before too. This time I thought I was going to stay somewhere different but when you have already experienced perfection then it has a habit of drawing you back! So often such experiences are hard to repeat again and again but yet The Observatory, to us, has not managed to falter! The service is spot on - warm, polite and 100% attentive. Just what I want. The rooms are lovely, very 'English old worlde-ish' but also just kept so clean and well appointed. The room temperature was also just right and oh SO fabulous to have a turn-down service to come 'home' to at the end of the evening. It felt so homely and inviting with subtle lighting, slippers by the bed, curtains drawn and the room tidied. We also had early evening Tapas in The Globe Bar before going out for dinner which is just wonderfully relaxing and inviting... like a rich olden day den / library. Again, the service faultless and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: MrsT1906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. I cannot fault The Observatory at all. From the moment we arrived the service was outstanding. We checked in at around 10:30am as we were doing a bridge climb (a short 5 min walk away) and was pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready for us! I also ordered a personalized pastry plate for our return to our room (a surprise for my husband) and this was absolutely beautiful. Champagne breakfast the next morning in the restaurant was superb and the service brilliant. I look forward to spending many more anniversaries at The Observtory. My only regret is not staying here for our wedding night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape in Quiet City Location”
Reviews.Author: BJRACT
Reviews.Content: Great spot in the city, after 1030pm the traffic virtually dissapears so even if you are in a Kent Street room you can sleep well. Although the hotel is starting to look a bit shabby (eg a couple of broken mosaics in the spa, seats in the restaraunt need to be re-upholstered, gym equipment had some split seat cushions) it is still very comfortable. We will be back - especially if we get a good discounted deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fermamss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Beautiful and excellent hotel almost 2weeks for my vacation.I like the location of this Hotel,nice foods,Nice room services,its too cleanliness,friendly people their.Nice pool,I love also their Spa.Friendly people in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Six-Star Property in Three-Star Location”
Reviews.Author: Fussbudget07
Reviews.Content: Husband and I chose the Observatory for part of our sojourn in Sydney because 1) it got ecstatic reviews on TripAdvisor; 2) it was enthusiastically recommended by our Australian travel company, and 3) it met our requirements of a beautiful and elegant boutique hotel. Must say that all of our expectations were met, and even exceeded by the size of the room; the general appointments and amenities; the huge bathroom with deep, luxurious tub; and, first and foremost, the wonderful concierge and desk staff. The ONLY caveat I have is that we were not happy with the location of the hotel, which is in The Rocks district, a 15-20 minute walk (up a steep hill) from the Circular Quay area where we always seemed to need to be. (The fact that it poured rain every day we were there didn't help matters, but we can't blame the hotel for the weather!) If you don't mind the hike (and the sun shines on you), stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning stunning stunning...”
Reviews.Author: shmfunk
Reviews.Content: This is the poshest hotel I have ever been to. Although I have spent time in 5 stars in the past, this is the only place I've understood what 5 stars mean. Staff were friendly, helpful and professional, even when I rocked up in jeans and t-shirt to book in. Room was enormous. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: dee257474
Reviews.Content: This is an old world style hotel with great staff. The decor is superb including their own gallery of top Australian artists. We were lucky enough to get accomodation at a special promotional cost ( through wotif ) which meant we could afford to stay there. We would love to go back and will be checking their specials all the time.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful, faultess stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug0003
Reviews.Content: we flew to Sydney for a weekend getaway and decided to splurge on the Observatory Hotel... And what a splurge! It was everything we had expected and much much more. Our room was very large, beautifully decorated. It featured a king sized bed and a welcome fruit platter on arrival. Staff were excellent. Facilities (tennis court, swimming pool, day spa, business centre) were great. It's tucked away just behind the rocks. We were able to walk every where. A perfect hotel. We will be staying here again, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive luxury”
Reviews.Author: Australiadreamer
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. From check-in to check out they make you feel special. It is their attention to detail and customer service that sets this hotel apart from all others. It is a very chic hotel yet casual, and not stuffy. The staff is willing to do just about anything you ask. I love this hotel. The only small negative is its location. It is not a close or easy walk to the Quay or downtown. The only other thing that some would consider negative is its price. But for the quality of the hotel and its staff I think the price is worth it. The room is fabulous. It has two of the best closets I have ever seen in a hotel. They were better than my closet at home. It also has a desk, an armoire, and 2 chairs ( 1 is for the desk). The bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is huge. It has a large soaking tub, a separate shower, and a medicine cabinet with more storage than I knew what to do with. The hotel is entirely wheelchair accessible. The wheelchair accessible rooms are on the first floor. The room itself is fine size wise. The bathroom is where the hotel really shines. The roll in shower was the best one I have ever used. It was large and didn't get water throughout the rest of the bathroom. I could also get fully under the sink with my wheelchair. If you don't mind having to walk a little to get to the main tourist areas (or just take a taxi like I did) then this is definitely the hotel you want to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “quiet luxury”
Reviews.Author: brancusirocks
Reviews.Content: Up on a hill near the Observatory (that is well worth a visit), yet only ten to fifteen minutes' walk to the Harbour, this hotel embraces the visitor in quiet luxury. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The heated swimming pool on the basement is large even to swim lengths and also has a jacuzzi. After the first morning, we skipped breakfast in favour of sampling the local cafes. A typical hotel breakfast, it is good but not worth the cost. The room where it's served is charming, with early 20th century photographs, prints and newspaper caricatures covering every wall. We didn't try the restaurant, that serves French cuisine, but had one meal in the bar and it was decent, although again, expensive. Both check-in and check-out were smooth experiences. The staff were all polite, friendly and helpful. I'd like to stay there again and feel no hesitation in recommending it to anyone who can afford its prices.

Reviews.Title: “Stand out experience due to attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: schultzemily03
Reviews.Content: This place is a older style hotel which makes you feel warm from the minute you walk in. The service was amazing with attention to making you feel welcome. The rooms were huge and they had a stunning indoor heated pool and jacuzi. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after a night at this hotel and we will definitely be back. My husband and I have stayed at most of the 5 star inner city hotels and while they are all lovely in different ways the service and style of this place is like no other. We had a deal that included breakfast and ended up in a 2nd floor water view room with a juliet balcony which was just lovely. The staff are always willing to help you, offering to store luggage without you needing to ask, offering a tour of the hotel etc. It was lovely to see a staff member walking around the fruit buffet this morning assisting a young mum to collect some breakfast as she was carrying a small baby. These little things are what are missing from many of the larger chain hotels. The only two things I would comment on at this hotel are small gripes. When reading over the room service menu I was appauled to see a small asterisk at the bottom that read "All room service items will incur a $5 delivery charge". While I know that all hotels charge a premium for room service I thought it was ridiculous to have a price for room service food and then an extra charge to have it delivered to your room! That is what room service is and the food prices were obviously already charging a premium. This I found disappointing. As well as this, we were disappointed to be told that at breakfast we would have to pay extra if we wanted espresso coffee rather than a filtered cup. For such a high class hotel with a lovely personalised restaurant breakfast it is sad that this small thing is not included as I am sure most people would appreciate it. Other than these two things we were very happy with our choice and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Next time we will take our swimming costumes so we can enjoy the amazing pool and spa!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: lilhwn
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after an awful experience trying to be budget friendly at a much cheaper hotel. Our hotel room had a roach so we left the next day after finding a good deal for The Observatory on Expedia. Wow! Did we upgrade ourselves tremendously. This place was amazing. There were a lot of small details that I enjoyed; the beautiful and huge flower arrangements in the lobby and the hallways, oriental ceramic vases in the room and in the lobby, umbrellas to use, bottles of water provided daily (no extra charge), heated towel rack, huge tub, cute koala bear, robe and slippers. The bed was so comfortable. Our concierge was wonderful. He got us reservations at some exclusive restaurants which we thought we would have no hope of getting in to. They were also nice enough to hold our extra luggage for a week while we were in Cairns even when we didn't stay with them when we got back to Sydney. I would have wanted to stay again but they were full.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller99037
Reviews.Content: We went for a 1 night getaway from the kids and our expectations were exceeded in every way. The staff, the room, the facilities and the location were first class. I really cannot suggest anything they need to do better, well done I thoroughly recommend it and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, opulent, but you pay for this...”
Reviews.Author: tdsm80
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful few nights stay - very beautiful, and the pool area and options for treatments were wonderful also. Found the restaurant served food of the highest quality, however very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: grainte53
Reviews.Content: Was given a night and meal at the Observatory as a retirement gift - this included an 8 course degustation meal, overnight stay and breakfast the next morning. Arrived at the hotel approx 3.00pm, checked in (room ready), decided to have a cup of tea in the Globe Bar. Big mistake - $40 later for a cup of tea, cup of coffee and a small cake. Room was superb, can't fault this. Dinner - arrive at Galileo for dinner, seated OK, a bit cramped however. Room was also noisy - we had great delight in listening to the lady on the table behind us ream her husband? all night. Dinner commences, all 8 courses adequate but not impressive as such - maybe if you like high French cooking, I'm not really a fan of huge plates and tiny portions.. Wine $13 a glass for base level white. Next morning (after the 4.45am drug bust in the street below our window with 8 police cars and 12 coppers), we front for breakfast - what a fiasco - I order scrambled eggs, get poached eggs. I'll accept that. The lady on the next table had her coffee order stuffed up. Check out time - I was charged for a coffee at breakfast!!!!! The gift I was given was valued at some 100's of $'s, I get charged for a coffee that was included in the package, they stuff my breakfast order and it costs me $40 for car parking. I will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, staff were impeccable, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ladyprincess_11
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and to some of the best hotels in the world, but I have never before been so struck by the quality of the staff at The Observatory. From the moment we arrived everyone was smiling, courteous and helpful. At reservations, restaurant and spa everyone could not have been more efficient yet friendly. I would particularly like to single out a young man called Edward who escorted us to our rooms. He was extremely friendly without being obtrusive, but the main thing I remember is that this young man refused to take a tip!! In all my days I have never had a member of staff from any hotel refuse to take one! Extraordinary and very pleasing! Congratulations to them on having the services of such a fine young man. I was so impressed I will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: craftysurfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at thsi fantastic hotel for 2 nights in March, we managed to get a very good deal. Hotel is luxurious and worth every penny. We walked to the Rocks in about 10 minutes and even walked with our cases to the cruise ship terminal!. Lovely deli/cafe 2 minutes from the hotel, just turn left out of the front door. If I returned to Sydney I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: livelife990
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay in this hotel. The service at this hotel is impeccable. The staff are all very courteous and helpful, not at all of the demeanor that you may find at some five star hotels. If you like modern decor, this place is not for you. The decor is very 1920's and obviously old fashioned. If this is your style than it is perfect. I do however prefer more modern decor in hotels. The room service, concierge, housekeeping is very prompt. If you call for something, you do not need to wait long for your desired service to arrive. High Tea was nice, a tad pricey at $99 per person, however it is not something you do everyday so worth the lovely tea and beverage experience. Service at the hotel restaurant, breakfast and dinner is very good. A particular thank you to one of the staff member's in the restaurant (Sameet) who went out of his way to make us feel very accommodated for, especially traveling with a 2 month old baby which can be difficult. I do recommend this hotel if you like old fashioned, period furnishings and if you are willing to part with $600 a night. Dinner and breakfast is also pricey, but as expected in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location by the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: kyliexxxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Observatory with colleagues, the location is fantastic right by the Rocks and an easy walk to many attractions around the harbour and International Passenger Terminal. The service was very good and the suite was comfortable. I find the decor style a bit dated but it was very comfortable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: justcruizen
Reviews.Content: Its very rare that a CBD hotel can make you feel so. I stayed with my wife in this hotel for 4 night last March. I'm a tough critic when it comes to 5 stars hotels and these guys lived The desk staff and bar staff treated you like old friends and knew your name. Being slightly out of the main CBD areas means there is a bit of a walk to the shops but it also means the nights are a lot quieter. Keep up the good work. Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “An opulent tranquil refuge”
Reviews.Author: flowery3
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Sydney, and from the moment the concierge helped us from our taxi we felt welcomed and looked after at the Observatory. WE were able to leave our bags for the day, until our room was ready, and use the wireless internet ( a little expensive, but reliable and good). Our room was just a standard room, but it was large and pleasant, with a huge comfortable bed, and a lovely little balcony so we could sit outside, and enjoy fresh air and sunshine ( between the showers!). We looked out over the observatory rather than the harbour, but it was still a nice view that didn't feel too boxed in - perfect for two country kiwis in the BIg City! The Rocks is a lovely area of Sydney, with much character, and without the endless bustle of the CBD, and the observatory is very well located within wallking distance to many attractions, including the Circular quay ( which wasnt circular by the way!) The staff at the hotel were always friendly, courteous and helpful, without the toffee nosed attitude that one can get at some high class hotels! WE really felt like individuals and welcome guests, rather than just a "room number"! Only a few negative point - I would say that on the third floor, the water pressure is not great, so the huge opulent bath takes a long time to fill, and I didn't even attempt a shower! However, the facilities at the pool were great - lovely showers, and my hair loved the provided shampoo and conditioner! If you are using the pool though, there is no spinner to dry your swimming costume, and unfortunately our heated towel rail didn't work, so we had to fly home with wet things in our bag. I would suggest perhaps the hotel could invest in a costume spin dryer? Until then, check your heated towel rail, and give them time to fix it - we realised too late in the evening. The other real surprise was that the coffee provided in the hotel room was INSTANT! As a kiwi, I haven't even SEEN instant coffee in over a year! I drank tea! The minibar as to be expected for a luxury hotel was very expensive, but there is a shop nearby where water, chocolate etc can be purchased for much less. There is also an excellent local fish restaurant Fish on the rocks very nearby. The hotel dinner menu is really far to fussy/fancy. as agreed with other guests! However the hotel breakfast is lovely! I suggest trying the continental buffet, as even my cooked breakfast addict partner found that was plenty for him, and we only had the cooked breakfast once ( delicious but not needed!) Overall, I would like to thank the staff at the observatory for a lovely stay, and for making two kiwis so welcome. When we found the bustle of the city way to much, you were a perfect refuge for us, and we really enjoyed our stay. I only include the negative points as suggestions for further improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Redefined at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: rrathod
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks. A lovely view of the harbour from my room and lovely service. The staff was awesome and friendly. Centrally located in Sydney CBD, there was easy access to most of the attractions of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have wished for anything else”
Reviews.Author: andihoward
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - staff, especially the concierges, were welcoming and very knowledgeable about the area. Rooms were well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and impeccable service - a fabulous experience in great location”
Reviews.Author: mushins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for 3 wonderful nights while traveling in Australia. The room was large and beautifully appointed. This has to be one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever stayed at and the service could not have been better. They sent us on our way with good recommendations as we set out to explore, and offered us chilled bottles of water. The pool and spa is wonderful. Location is great, and although breakfast at the hotel is pricey, there are several great options just across the street or down the block. (Splendid Sandwich right next to the tennis courts across the street is wonderful!) They happily held our bags for us while we traveled up north for 6 days. Highly recommend the Observatory!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: vacancestoujour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the observatory for two nights to celebrate a special occasion. We stayed in a suite on the first floor and received a congratulatory plate of petit fours, all of which was arranged by Elodie and was so much appreciated by us. The suite was comfortable and large and I loved the separate bath tub. Service at this hotel (from the front desk, laundry to room service) is of a high level, impeccable, professional and efficient which is rare in the australian hospitality industry. Location of the hotel is great is you love the Rocks, Circular Quay but it is also quiet and peaceful. The daily turn down service, complimentary bottled water and toiletries (l'occitane) were nice touches too. Some of our extended family were staying at the hotel at the same time but in a superior room - it was small for sydney standards but had a cute balcony on which you could sit on to read or have a coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second of our stay - wish it was longer.”
Reviews.Author: thegirl5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the chance to escape from our toddler for one night (before a second baby arrives) and chose to travel to Sydney and stay at the Observatory. Because we were only staying for one night we splashed out and got a junior suite and chose the spa package. We had stayed at the Observatory once before (almost 5 years ago) and our stay this time was just as good. The hotel and our room was beautifully furnished. Although if you like minimalist modern styles then this hotel will not be for you. It was incredibly comfortable and quiet and I had a wonderful night's sleep. A couple of tiny niggles - the complimentary fruit plate was about 6 or 7 tired looking strawberries sitting on a plate, a couple of things we expected to be in the room when we arrived (a bathrobe that came with the spa package and a box of chocolates my husband ordered when booking) weren't there. Also, my very simple order at breakfast (just a bowl of porridge) was completely forgotten. But these small things didn't take away from the fantastic stay we had. We would definitely stay again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: SallyW5
Reviews.Content: a quality hotel, you are treated like a person and nothing was a bother to the staff. pool has to be seen to believed, very relaxing. great location for the rocks area only a ten minute walk with a good pub on the way, the lord nelson.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: AshfromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I tend to be very picky about where I stay. I've found that picking the right or wrong hotel can colour my experience of a city. I was blown away by The Observatory Hotel from the moment I was greeted in reception. The hotel is elegant and beautiful. It smells subtly like a day spa the moment you step into the huge reception - you immediately feel calm and incredibly relaxed in this oasis. I arrived at 9am and the lady at reception welcomed me and took my mobile number and said she would call me when my room was ready. In the meantime, I was invited to read the newspapers (The Australian, Sydney Morning Herald and The Financial Review) in the beautiful formal Drawing Room, or to go sightseeing. One other thing - we booked two nights on a special deal through wotif. In other words, we didn't pay "full price". Not at any time were we made to feel any less or different to a full paying guest. That was really great. The very helpful Concierge, Michael, gave me directions to the best shopping districts in the city and off I went. The location is great. It is an easy stroll to the CBD, or to the Rocks, which leads to Circular Quay. Reception telephoned me at 11am to say it was ready. The service is fantastic. They call you by name at all times (Mrs So and So, Mr So and So) - wish you a good day, welcome you back, open doors for you, call your taxi for you. Carry your bags to your room... Old fashioned, sincere and friendly service. And for no tips at all. We stayed in a Deluxe Room on level one. There is a small foyer that opens to your room, and your bathroom opens off that. While I was there, they changed the old fashioned "keys" to an electronic card that you wave in front of the sensor on your door. I didn't mind either. The welcome fruit plate was a nectarine, apple and a peach. Lovely. And nicely presented. The bathroom is beautiful with a deep tub (incredibly relaxing to soak in) and a separate shower which was also a rainshower. It was a pleasure to use that rainshower. The shampoo, conditioner and bath products smelt so nice, I took the extras home with me. I had a terrific Frangipani & Pomegranate wrap in the Day Spa (my therapist was Emma) that was relaxing and the wrap smelt amazing. I fully recommend it. The only downside was that it was too short (30mins). I booked a week ahead (wanted a massage initially but they couldn't facilitate this - I also overheard other people being turned away so I recommend you book your spa treatments as soon as you book your room). I'm not a steam room person but I liked the ones here. I found the complimentary cold lemon/lime water or hot ginger, lemongrass and berry tea to be a nice touch. We experienced some noise problems (like a subwoofery rumbling noise) that bothered us from 11pm to 2am at night. When I mentioned this to reception the next morning, they immediately arranged for us to move to another room on level 2 which they assured us would be a quiet room. They apologised profusely and arranged for a porter to help me move all bags. He didn't let me lift a finger even though some of my bags were heavy. When I mentioned this to him, he said, "if it's heavy, you certainly won't be carrying it, I will." Great service. The next room was perfect and we didn't experience any other problems. The comfort of the hotel was such that it was hard to leave to go sightseeing. And it was always such a pleasure to come back to the hotel. We didn't try Gailleo Restaurant but would like to next time. There is free internet and printing in the business center next to the reception desk. Before I booked here, I also considered the Westin or the Shangri-La but now I think I wouldn't stay anywhere in Sydney other than the Observatory Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: philosopherstone
Reviews.Content: Faultless hotel. Top Service, great rooms and fantastic location. Everything that a Grand Hotel should be

Reviews.Title: “There can't be anything better!”
Reviews.Author: TonyNorwich
Reviews.Content: There's no denying that this is an expensive hotel but on this occasion we got what we paid for and, in any event, Sydney is a very expensive city for Brits at the moment. We were there for a week and on balance this is the most comfortable hotel we have ever stayed in on fairly extensive travels (beating Oberoi hotels in India by a whisker). The room was great and the shower the best of a seven week trip. Concierge service extremely professional. Location is a real plus. On a quiet street in The Rocks area, ten minutes walk from Circular Quay and only a couple of minutes to an excellent fish restaurant (Fish at The Rocks) and a really buzzy pub - The Lord Nelson. Only thing we can criticise constructively is that service at breakfast was a bit patchy at times, interaction with guests got in the way of efficiency. Overall we can't believe there's a better hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for older people”
Reviews.Author: Firefly51
Reviews.Content: Loved the bathroom, which was huge and modern. The bedroom was very dated and chintzy.everything was clean and good service. Internet was expensive. Breakfast was a ridiculous extra cost at $45 per person, it was ok but def not worth that sort of money. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect anniversary/ birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: jk87
Reviews.Content: My wife and I frequent hotels almost every two weeks and we are usually regulars at the Shangrila, Park Hyatt or the Four seasons depending on availability. Two weeks ago as it was a special weekend, being our anniversary and her birthday i decided to check out The Observatory. We stayed in a junior suite with water views and had the staff arrange the romance package for us. From the time i made reservations to check out i could not be happier with the service here. Conrad who took my reservation and met me at check in is the most friendliest and accommodating hotel staff i have had the pleasure of meeting. Definitely will be returning here. The room was a decent size for a junior suite and had a massive balcony. Very clean and comfortable. Could not have been happier as we are very fussy when it comes to hotels. However Conrad and the staff at The Observatory definitely exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: CPH360
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to find a "stay 5 nights and get the last 2 nights free" offer on a superior waterview room at this marvelous hotel. That was indeed money spent well and worth every penny. Service was top notch. Room was immaculate and spacious with nice views of Darling Harbour. Nice quite street but very central and convenient location. Wouldn't hesitate a second if I got the chance to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: tripping_machine
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, quiet, nice view on the bay, luxurious and spacious rooms, we appreciated the old-fashioned style. Exceptional. The pool is magnificent !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. A small bugbear ... but I am an obsessive!”
Reviews.Author: Valiant2
Reviews.Content: Well I absolutely LOVED this place. Flawless check-in, directed by great Concierge, whose service throughout was excellent: chatty and friendly without ever being over-familiar. These guys are a credit to the hotel indeed! The room was large and comfortable. I had a "city view" ie not that much view really, just an outlook onto the street that the hotel is on, but not bad to look at. I don't usually eat in hotels but the breakfast here was great, and I took it 4 times. On the last day (Saturday) they were really over-booked and struggling a bit, but managed still carry it all off with good grace and humour. I really liked the fitness centre: pretty well-equipped and no stinting at all on the robes etc. It DID shut very early (9pm) though, which I found inconvenient on a couple of nights. Public areas quiet and beautifully-maintained. Reception perhaps not quite up to the Concierge standard but good enough. My one bugbear is one that most people will dismiss as a trifle - but it's REALLY important to me and, despite everything, probably means I won't stay here again. And that is, that the internet connection - for which I paid AUD$105 for 6 days - was incredibly slow, and pretty unreliable. I bought this up on the 2nd or 3rd day with Reception but was told that it's a 3rd party service and the hotel had no control over it. Well, the hotel is happy enough to take the money; surely it has SOME responsibility?! So, go and stay here. It's brilliant. But you probably won't see me there, because of my irrational need for fast and reliable internet!

Reviews.Title: “Quality without the snobbery”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: I'm not often one to spend more than $500 a night on hotel accomadation however on this occasion my artner and I chose to spoil ourselves for a couple of nights. Whilst the hotel offered everything that you would expect from a venue of this quality the thing that most stood out was the service that was offered from staff made me feel like a king and didn't have any of the snobbery sub text that other hotels in the price range offer.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: mantisalive
Reviews.Content: Located in a really pretty area of Sydney. Fantastic service, nice sized room with a view of the water, can open bedroom window for fresh air which is brilliant. Bathroom was very nice, huge shower head, bath, all spotless. Walking distance to great pubs and the rocks. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sydney hotel but there are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September using a last minute discount website which included a fruit platter and parking. Well...the fruit platter turned out to be 3 strawberries on a plate?! A little disappointing. Also the twin room we booked was quite small and plain. I haven't stayed at the Observatory for something like 5 or 6 years. We had always stayed in an executive suite for special occasions which was very nice, but for a quick whip in and out accommodation for a concert we were attending, thought a city view twin would suffice. Whilst there is nothing I can expressly pick on with the hotel, I have to say for the price paid, there are much better Sydney CBD options out there. The staff were quite courteous particularly the doorman was very friendly and warmly welcomes everyone as they come in-remembering if you are returning which is a nice touch. The bathroom is a good size, with good shower, however the bedroom is very plain, ordinary and almost dorm like. We paid for a water view room for the second night and this was quite laughable. You had a glimpse of the harbour above a lot of very old heritage housing and dock with grimy balconies and washing etc. all over. I have stayed in many a hotel set amongst heritage properties and ordinarily this adds to the quirkiness and charm...but not in this instance due to the quality of the housing and aspect. There are many other hotels with a lovely harbour aspect which are far superior. I had mentioned that the stay was for my birthday and thought perhaps that would be taken into account in terms of either a birthday card, special welcome or any other measure to make me feel a bit special, but nothing other than the bare minimum level of service was offered. We were even made to check in and out of our city view room according to scheduled time, to wait to check in and spend our second night in the alleged 'water' view room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Service,”
Reviews.Author: Tallandtired
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is an Orient-Express Hotel on Kent Street. It is a little out of the way in the Rocks area which is very hilly. We had to take a taxi everywhere. Some of the top hotels in Sydney are more centrally located and not so low rise as the Observatory and therefore have more dramatic views of the city and the harbour and the Opera House. The decor of the Observatory is beautiful and the restaurant/bar is first rate but expensive. The bathrooms are luxurious with everything one would need. The only flaw was a huge waterbug in our room one night running up the wall. The staff would have killed it (if my husband hadn't) as they are very accomodating and efficient about everything. We left two of our bags in storage at the hotel while we spent three nights up at the Great Barrier Reef. When we returned to the hotel, the stored bags were already in our suite when we arrived. The pictures of the rooms on the hotel website are accurate. We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, dirty”
Reviews.Author: whistlerCA
Reviews.Content: They didn't have the room I had booked. Instead of upgrading me, they downgraded me. Room was dirty, so was the pool area... To the extent that I didn't get into the water. Tried to order room service, but every single item I tried was not available. Ended up having to go eat elsewhere. Was supposed to stay a few days, checked out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: ManolisP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated to reach important spots in town, including the harbour and the Rocks, in walking distance. Elegant and comfortable hotel, a very friendly staff in combination with spacious rooms and comfy beds. All services were according to our expectations and more. This is an excellent place to live downtown and have a relaxing surrounding nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: benstef
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite for wife's birthday. Left my jacket behind (in the room) and upon my enquiry the following day I was told that item was not being found. Not being found??? I left it there!!! Spoke and wrote to Hotel Manager who refused to deal with the issue/acknowledge responsability. I was expecting a different treatment from a 5 star hotel costing me $300/night (and another $300 in lost jacket). I would not recommend anyone to stay in this establishment. Over-priced anyway for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, intimate establishment and great qualtiy service”
Reviews.Author: RnR_Report
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel a few times now and it never disappoints. The style of the building is in keeping with the surrounding heritage Rocks area, with cosy, wood panelled public rooms and select, quality furnishings and fittings etc. Easy stroll to the Rocks, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay and the main retail area is a 10-15 minute walk away. The restaurant 'Galileo' is one of the best in town and is sure to impress the best gourmets worldwide - would however like to see them promote Australian/ New Zealand wines a bit more. Regardless, it's an excellent restaurant - but do try some of the locals nearby (e.g. "Fish at the Rocks" just a short stroll up the street - turn left as you exit the main entry; a pub crawl at some of Australia's oldest pubs is also worth a try/look - ask the concierge). The biggest plus of this hotel for us though is the service - quick response time to requests; polite and not obtrusive - and for those overseas guests that are challenged by English - a number of the staff are multi-lingual. If you want a view of the harbour and are happy to settle for less in terms of service....go to the Quay Grand hotel. But if you want to eat well and feel like you're at home (away from home), we highly recommend the Observatory hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: mike1955092
Reviews.Content: Booked intp this hotel for a weekend treat in Sydney, based on outstanding recommendations from Trip Advisor. The location is wonderful, staff friendly, and our room was well appointed and stylish. Really, a very agreeable spot but we have two cavets. First and foremost, the room was too hot, and the air-conditioning could not be set lower that "19-20 degrees". In fact, there's no temperature control in the room, just the opportunity to press a "1", "2" or "3". Even the female half of the couple complained (which is very rare), but Reception told us there was nothing to do. Second, the hotels promotes its DVD library, but only when the typed list of titles appeared (around 40 titles only) did we discover that the fee of $13 applied per title. In a hotel with rooms costing $300+ per night, this seems petty and was disappointing. When will classy hotels learn not to penny pinch, and to stop charging for everything, from DVDs to internet? Bed was fairly comfortable but by no means outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant English manor house”
Reviews.Author: LosGatostraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom executive suite for 5 nights. So many things to like: the subdued,elegant decor. Chinese porcelain vases, etchings of Australian scenery and birds, blue silk curtains, the blue satin ribbon tied around the bathroom tissue roll, art work in the bathroom, 3 floor to ceiling curved windows in the living room with view of trees, tennis courts, town homes, brass and green marble lamps, So many luxurious conveniences: the nespresso machine in the room for making aromatic coffee,receiving a dry umbrella at the front entrance when returning with a wet one,being able to use the computer downstairs and send a fax at no charge, the huge pool with a starry southern cross ceiling. It was very pleasant to have a light supper in our room with our own wine. When I asked for ice it came in 60 seconds. The location was perfect for us. We walked several times a day to the Circular Quay in about 15 minutes and never tired of the attractions there. But it was fine to return to a quieter neighborhood . We sampled lunch at the Four Seasons and tried the lift. Service was uninspired and the lift wait was long. At the Observatory the lift came at once and was always unoccupied. Surprising since the hotel was completely full. What a grand start to our Australian and New Zealand adventure and totally worth it. The suite was $600 a night without breakfast. The staff were all gracious and helpful without being intrusive. So glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a once-in-a-while treat”
Reviews.Author: T_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at The Observatory Hotel. I've spent a lot of time in Sydney's CBD, but never imagined that there would be a street so close to the centre of everything and yet also so quiet and peaceful! The staff were extremely courteous and helpful, the decor was gorgeous, and the room was amazing. Expensive, but that comes with the territory with a hotel of this calibre. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful pool, expensive”
Reviews.Author: msa23_2000
Reviews.Content: Observatory Hotel is in a great location. The Hotel has a great pool, and a wonderful restaurant. Just felt it was a little expensive (then again, all of Sydney is).

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and stylish hotel - prime choice”
Reviews.Author: Utas2
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was greeted with special attention, and despite an early arrival after a long flight, my room was ready. Very elegant and stylish hotel with a special, a bit formal but charming atmosphere and friendly staff. The hotel is located in a quiet street, some walking distance from the Rocks, but that is just fine. Perfectly equipped rooms with all amenities, plenty of space, very good room servive and cleanliness. I had a room facing the street but that was no problem at all for the sleeping quality. The restaurant staff is very friendly, attentive and provided high level of classic service. The charge for Internet was a bit pricey, however, in such a high quality hotel this is normal. My stay in Sydney was a fantastic one - also thanks to staying in the Observatory Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: kw412
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for 2 nights upon our arrival in Sydney. Every staff person we encountered was very nice and accommodating. Our room was very lovely with beautiful colors, spacious bed and fantastic soap (which may seem silly, but it smells so good)! Our view was ok. I guess I expected more from a "water view" than what we saw (rooftops, an empty lot, then the water) but the hotel isn't directly on the harbour - it is a block or so away. We found the location nice. It was an easy walk to the BridgeClimb office and not terribly far from the Town Hall. I also enjoyed the beautiful pool and steam room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely colonial feel, but it's a long hike to get anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: jossler
Reviews.Content: Really liked the sense of the hotel. It had a charming, rather formal ambience that accorded well with the opulent decor. Our room was excellent: spacious, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. But the sea view was 'questionable', as between the hotel and sea is a series of rooflines and carparks - not at all pretty to look at. The hotel is a bit 'in the middle of nowhere' and opens up onto a busy vehicular street with litttle else of note within a 15 minute walk. Not a great choice if you want to be in the thick of it; moreover, we felt the location/area was a bit rough when returning to the hotel late at night after dinner. Only gripe was that the hotel did not offer complimentary wifi. This is now my pet hate as a frequent traveller. It's nothing more than petty exploitation of the guests and it's something the smarter/wiser establishments have cottoned on to. Come on Observatory - get with the programme and stop tarnishing an otherwise good package.

Reviews.Title: “Very special”
Reviews.Author: AA112233
Reviews.Content: Do you like to be well looked after? Do you like classic, beautiful decor? Do you like your food and wine? How about location in The Rocks and Sydney Harbour views? Well, The Observatory Hotel has it all! From the moment you walk in into the beautiful lobby you feel very special. You will be greated with a smile and the Front Desk staff will ask all the right questions to ensure you are well looked after. You can expect the best quality furnishings and classic decor in your room. The housekeeping staff is discrete and friendly. To top up your perfect day, visit the Galileo restaurant headed by chef Yomoda and try one of his spectacular French style dishes. The Observatory Hotel in Sydney is a unique boutique style luxurious hotel that you fall in love with and want to come back again and again. Thank you! Comments by Anna

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Matrelli
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th anniversary with a romantic dinner at Galileo's restaurant and a stay-over at this stylish hotel. The service was both warm and efficient and the accommodation was elegant and comfortable. We are sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “There's something special about the staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRaptor
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is practically perfect: - opening windows - the fruit on the welcoming platter was ripe (no mean feat in these days of cold stored fruit). - proper turn down service - huge rooms and comfort styling My only quibble would be that the pillows in our room were not the usual exquisite 'floating on air' type that I would expect. All the touches of a genuinely 5* hotel with staff that are genuinely warm and professional. This is a seriously classy joint.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoonlightingNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights of our honeymoon in Sydney, and our stay at the Observatory Hotel made it almost impossible to leave the city! Not only is the Observatory a wonderful hotel, with big, comfortable, beautiful rooms in a great location just a few blocks from the Rocks, but its service is some of the finest we have ever received at any hotel. The concierge staff -- and Michael in particular -- was exceptionally helpful, providing fantastic suggestions to experience their amazing city. My wife got ill right before we arrived in Sydney, and everything the hotel provided -- from exceptional room service food to arranging for a prompt doctor visit -- was first rate. We would not consider any other hotel in Sydney, and cannot wait to get back (even though it's halfway around the world).

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Classicman2512
Reviews.Content: I am always wary of large hotels owned by international companies as they can be rather impersonal, bland and similar. Not so, the Observatory, which manages be be individual, intimate and personal. Our room was perfect in every respect and spotlessly clean. It was so good that I purposely tried to find even the smallest thing wrong, I couldn't. The position is ideal as it is close to all the tourist attractions and also the city centre while at the same time is on a quiet road. We will definitley stay ther next year when we are back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “World class service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: phil_marla
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in a WORLD CLASS hotel this is your place! The service, from the Hotel Manager to the doormen, was fantastic. We were greeted by the manager, Patrick Griffin, who made us feel like family. He made sure we met his staff who took personal interest in our stay being worry free. They helped us select restaurants, wine tours, and sightseeing with outstanding services. Though their recommendation we had them booked a Hunter Valley wine tour with Richard Everett (Wine Country Tours) for an entire day. It proved to be the best wine education, tasting, and lunch my wife and I have ever experienced (we live in the heart of Northern California's wine area and visit several wineries each year) in our many years of vineyard visiting, wine tasting, and gourmet meals. Again, this points to the knowledge of the hotel concierges who offered us several tour companies and explained their differences. Our room, an Executive Suite, was extremely well furnished through out. It was immaculate! Their restaurant, The Galileo, is listed within the Wine Spectator's list of outstanding restaurants in Sydney. Its food was outstanding with many choices, even for the pickiest eater. Their wine list is extensive, the staff friendly and attentive. The location of the hotel is an easy walk to many restaurants, shopping, the wharf, etc. So, in closing, the Hotel Manager must take great pride in his staff who made our four day stay the highlight of our sixteen days in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Observatory Hotel”
Reviews.Author: troublenstrife
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is a low rise hotel in a residential area but only a short walk to the main attractions of the harbour bridge & Opera house. Service & ambiance is as you would expect for a 5* -exceptionally good The room we had was huge with slippers & bathrobes provided. Traditionally furnished & in excellent order. Large marble bathroom with separate bath & shower, his n hers basins & quality shampoos & soaps provided. Complimentary mineral water provided every day but no chocolate at turndown! We stayed room only & did not eat at the hotel - we ate in the nearby Rocks area (10 min walk) which was cheaper than the harbour areas & could not fault the food or service. You must visit the Botanic gardens (near Opera Hse) to see the fruit bats in the trees Would stay here again if ever in the beautiful (but expensive due to poor exchange rate) Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awful room service”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellor_7
Reviews.Content: I really do enjoy this hotel. The rooms are spacious (ask for Level 3 and get a balcony), and comfortable. Reception staff are generally great. I stay here often. However, I recomend that you think twice about ordering room service. The menu is now restricted to "comfort food" which the management advise is as a result of "guest preferences". I was served what was easlily the worst burger I have ever (partially) eaten. McDonalds and Burger King products are far superior! I have received an apology, but no explanation, and certainly no refund. They have offered the menu from one of their restaurants, and I have not yet tested their offerings.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Foxey2_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a special hotel in which to stay to celebrate our 41st wedding Anniversary. We were more than delighted with our choice. The service was excellent, staff were friendly and accommodating, and our room was spacious, elegantly furnished and clean. Attention to detail was impeccable in every way. We enjoyed the quieter location of the busyness of Sydney with easy and accessible walking in this historical part of Sydney close to The Rocks. Breakfast in the well appointed dining room was yet another experience of luxury to add to our memorable occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, attentive and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NandMCanberra
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Observatory several times and, as always, we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The concierge team assisted us to plan our stay, as well as various activities in and around Sydney. The food and beverage team in Galileo restaurant made us feel especially welcome - the food was also fabulous! The hotel and the suites are just lovely and the hotel is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: EgyptianJudge
Reviews.Content: I had enjoyed part of my honeymoon in this hotel. Old hotel with a very luxurious style. A bit expensive in comparison with others around. I upgraded to the sea/ocean view and it was good. Breakfast is great and the staff at the restaurant were excellent. On the other hand they knew it was my honeymoon and nothing additional, as promised, was prepared. The reception lady, at check in, tried to get us to upgrade to suit with additional 200 AUD, the room was more than enough for us. We also had a dinner at the hotel restaurant, which was really expensive....

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Observatory Hotel a number of occasions over the years, consistency is important to me. When you arrive you can be assured that Michael our one of his team will on hand to greet you. Mentioning Michael, he has been there from day one, he's unflappable and can appear to be a little intimidating with his resonant voice, the care factor across his team though is very high. My children find them highly entertaining. The rooms are beautiful, my tastes do favour old world charm though (I have stayed in to many generic modern hotels to enjoy them). I particularly like the deep baths. I love to ensconce myself in The Globe Bar (dry Martini with two olives please). Breakfast is a sumptuous affair and Ernesto is very attentive. The service here in general is second to none, I must also thank the lovely French lass with the melodic sounding name (for the life of me I can't remember it)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, all the extra touches make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maddisons
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our young 3 year old daughter. Although the hotel appears very elegant, and formal upon arrival, we were made to feel very welcome. After check-in we were escorted to our fabulous room (with nespresso coffee machine, sitting area etc). We returned to our room later, and a specially decorated gingerbread man arrived with our daughter's name written in chocolate, her own little person robe and bath toy. The pool area and spa were pure luxury. The location was fantastic for exploring the rocks area within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quiet hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Observatory because I was able to get a special deal on the internet - a harbour view room with valet parking for $240. The staff were extremely formal in an "old fashioned genteel" sort of way, but everyone we encountered was warm and friendly. It is worth noting that the hotel is pet friendly, an extremely rare thing in Australia, where we are so very backward in this regard compared to Europe. The cutest Maltese terrier was strutting around in the foyer, to the delight of many guests. The bedroom and bathroom were both spacious, spotlessly clean, and extremely comfortable. The hotel is extremely quiet, so a good night's sleep is guaranteed. We were in Sydney to attend a performance at the Opera House, and felt very safe walking down through the Rocks to Circular Quay after dark. While this hotel is deservedly 5 star, I would not stay here again unless I was able to nab a special deal. If one is paying the hotel's rack rate, a much better "value for money" option is the Quay Grand Apartments. We didn't eat at the Observatory. Their restaurant has an excellent reputation, but is very expensive compared with other great restaurants within walking distance. In summary - charming and quiet, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have already stated how good this hotel is so thereâ€™s not much I can add here. Everything is high quality but you certainly pay for it. The food and drink is very expensive, amongst the highest Iâ€™ve seen at any hotel. The evening menu at the Galileo restaurant is haute-cuisine so if your tastes are simpler, like mine, youâ€™ll probably eat from the bar menu, otherwise there are plenty of excellent restaurants a short walk or taxi ride away. All internet access is paid for and you must use a cable in the room while WiFi is available in the lobby and bar area. Service is outstanding â€“ itâ€™s one of the few hotels where Iâ€™m greeted by name and the staff remember your food and drink orders from previous days. There were a couple of minor problems â€“ a fault with my safe was fixed within 5 minutes and I was charged twice for internet access, again rectified with no fuss. Overall, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Every modern convenience with old-fashioned charm and courtesy”
Reviews.Author: Catherine186414
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with no previous knowledge of the hotel. It was lovely and the staff were delightful. The hotel was quiet and discreet, the location incredibly convenient for the harbour, and the gorgeous 20 metre swimming pool, with its starlit ceiling, was bliss. Was made to feel very welcome (not always the case as a middle-aged woman solo traveller). I would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion the best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: anna00747
Reviews.Content: The Hotel smells beautiful from the moment you walk in the door, lemon or verbena and its in all the common areas of the Hotel.
