The hotel has only three floors, many of the rooms have balconies, or opening windows which to me is a big plus. I have stayed here many times and regardless of room option they are all very comfortable. On this occasion I had a one bedroom suite which is truly incredible, wrap around terrace balcony which I would really recommend. Its more expensive but worth every cent, most especially if you are entertaining guests or travelling with colleagues. Breakfast is a real treat and make sure that the rate is inclusive of breakfast as its expensive as an added extra. The pool area and spa are outstanding. The restaurant staff specially in the morning at breakfast are excellent. I read a comment about a lady who had a problem with this Hotel and it prompted me to write a review which is long overdue. This Hotel is fabulous and it receives alot of recommendations from its guests; I count myself as one of those. I was a little concerned though at the way the lady who had a complaint was answered by management. There is no doubt in the saying that a customer is always right (even when they are not). In my opinion most of the staff at this Hotel are great, but there could be a valid point to the lady's comment that the Concierge may have been rude. It could be a case of the "Emperors New Clothes" , there is actually one quite rude concierge who is rather dictatorial. Having said that, I would not choose to stay at any other Hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful again.”
Reviews.Author: fivestarplease
Reviews.Content: Beautiful stay again, you cannot fault this place, the service is great, the rooms are lovely and the food is fantastic. We were upgraded on arrival that was lovely. Small error with the package that we booked (restaurant was closed), no shortage of fantastic restaurants in Sydney so Michael kindly organised a booking elsewhere. On return a bottle of bubbly in the room and a lovely apology note. This place is the ultimate in spoiling yourself and romance. Breakfast sensational. Service, staff and whole place is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in service”
Reviews.Author: auscantrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for one night in September. Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer. From the moment we arrived at the Hotel we were warmly greeted and made to feel very welcome. Konrad on check in took charge of us and showed us to our room, explaining all pleasantly. Michael as concierge answered all our questions, and greeted us each time we left or arrived back. We ate at the Globe Bar in the evening, and again could not fault the service we received. The water view room was comfortable and spacious. Location is perfect, as we were able to wander around the Rocks area,(10 mins) and walk into the city (15 mins). It is also just a few minutes walk to the Bridge Climb ( Our reason for staying). Being able to leave our car at the hotel after checkout was a real bonus. I almost forgot to mention the pool and spa area - just lovely - we had it to ourselves for a short while early in the morning. Overall, a delight from beginning to end, and we can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, fabulous swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: washing2nian
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Observatory Hotel in August. Staff very friendly, cozy bar for night time drinks, very nice indoor swimming pool for our 9-year old, welcoming cookie waiting for daughter at room upon arrival and a very nice breakfast which was a combo of A la carte and buffet included in our room rate. The hotel has an old gentlemans atmosphere. The location is in an old, charming residential area about 10 minutes walking distance to local attractions. The only complaint would be no free wi-fi in room, but free use of computer next to lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: mrsarty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a week in Sydney. The highlight by far was staying one night at The Observatory. My husband laughs at me but I describe my experience at The Observatory as living like a Princess. I loved it from the minute I walked in. The service was incredible - nothing was a problem! The room had every detail taken care of - even the spare toilet paper roll had a bow on it! I loved the bath salts on the side of the bath, the letter writing set in the drawer, the turn down service with hot chocolates and complimentary water, the bag the newspaper came in in the morning - and the pool was well - beautiful! The Restaurant was a little pricey for our budget - as was the Spa treatments unfortunately but everything else more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder travel magazines rank this hotel amongst the best!”
Reviews.Author: UndomesticGoddess
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel listed in a Travel Magazine as being among the top hotels in the South Pacific and desperately wanted to experience it! Cost was a bit of an initial factor ($$$) but if you prepay on-line in advance, stand on your head with mouth scrunched in a certain fashion, a more reasonable room rate can be obtained! (and you don't have to stay in the maid's closet!) The Observatory certainly ranks up there for a reason! It is an upscale boutique hotel on the outskirt of the Rocks area with friendly service oriented staff! Ensure that you have dinner in their restaurant Gallileo (Michelon Star Chef presents food to strike a fancy to all senses), have a drink in their bar (bar staff & Elody their pianist are priceless!) and swim in their pool! If you can find it in your budget (somewhere), you won't be disappointed. The location is fabulous as it is just far enough removed that the big city sounds don't reach you, but easy walking distance to the Quay, the Rocks, and even the Opera House!

Reviews.Title: “one of the finest hotels we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ByronandDawn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just spent a most wonderful weekend at the Observatory Hotel in Sydney - From the moment we arrived and left our car to be parked, through to checking in, room service, and departure, the staff could not have been more helpful, courteous or professional. While waiting to check out we spoke briefly to other guests who expressed the same high level of pleasure with their stay. Attention to detail throughout the hotel is immaculate and nothing is left to chance. Dinner at the Galileo Restaurant was superb with the same level of attention, friendliness and considerate assistance that we had experienced throughout our stay - The location of the hotel is excellent being within easy walking distance from some of the most interesting parts of Sydney including the Rocks Markets on the weekend. This was a stay we wished had not ended.

Reviews.Title: “A Star”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg188
Reviews.Content: With its old world charm. The high tea is a must, true ellegance. Stayed there many times and always return, its like home. Its out of the bustle of the city, the the concierge is excellent. This hotel has true charm elegance and fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “The Graciousness of a bygone era”
Reviews.Author: Abbey040
Reviews.Content: Dear Mr Griffin, May I take this opportunity to compliment on my stay at The Observatory. The Hotel of course is lovely, but my main expression of praise would be for all the delightful and competent staff. From your Cleaners to Reception, it was truly a pleasure to see such capable young people so eager to help and carrying out their tasks so passionately.............with a smile. Keep up the good work, I commend you on your training. I will be back, Sandra Laird.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GypsyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Good Wonderful pool, spa and sauna. Room was very good size and beautifully decorated. Lovely bathroom - great pressure in shower and good size bath. Very attentive service. There was a lovely artificial fire at end of public lounge but it was not on. It was a freezing night and it would have added so much atmosphere. We would even be happy to pay the $25 each for a cocktail to sit by this fire on the lovely cosy couches. Instead we went down the road to the Lord Nelson Hotel and sat in front of their huge roaring open fireplace and had great meal and drinks for a few hours for an inexpensive price. Not so good No turndown service for us. No "strawberry platter" on arrival (which was part of the package). I felt very embarrassed phoning to ask if we were meant to get the strawberry platter. The man I spoke to said he would check and ring back. Nobody phoned back but a knock on the door about half an hour later and there it was. A bit disappointing it was the size of a bread and butter plate with 6 strawberries (not even covered with plastic wrap). Good but not what I was expecting when it stated "strawberry platter" (not strawberry plate). No complimentary newspaper which was also part of the package. I think there should have been complimentary drinking water but there wasn't. Stains on carpet in entry passageway. Globe Bar and Galileo Restaurant very lovely rooms but very expensive. Breakfast very expensive for what you get. Have paid a lot less elsewhere and had such lovely food and good choices. Overall I really wanted this to be all I expected as we are in Sydney about 4 nights each month and am searching for "the" place to keep staying at instead of changing hotels all the time. It does have a lot of good points and I might stay there one more time to make up my mind. I might feel more comfortable next time and I will just ask for more breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel & great hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Boof03
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel showed us such wonderful hospitality. We had a lovely stay at this beautiful hotel and look forward to our next stay. I would also like to comment on the lovely extras that were left in our room for our Wedding Anniversary celebration, the champagne & strawberries and the plate of little deserts were a delicious and welcome suprise. All I can say is that my husband and I had a wonderful Wedding Anniversary at this beautiful hotel and will remember the hospitality shown by all we came in contact with there. Thank you to all the staff for such a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lezarb
Reviews.Content: My wife and stay at the Observatory Hotel whenever we visit Sydney and we did so again recently. We were again delighted with our stay. The food was superb and the staff across the board were excellent. It is the little things at the Observatory that set it apart from the other 5 star establishments in Sydney. Everyone goes out of their way to provide that â€œspecialâ€� touch that is synonymous with the Observatory. Simply Perfect

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: OyaTao
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky enough to stay here many times but want to comment on one of my stays last year. I needed three rooms over the course of a week for my mum, dad, sister, son and self. We were flying back and forth to sydney while my sister had surgery following a recent cancer diagnosis. My mum was the mainstay and needed daily transfers to and from the hotel to the hospital as she doesn't drive. The staff couldn't have been kinder, more sensitive or supportive and arranged an excellent driver, early breakfast so mum could get to the hospital by 6:30 am, and other treats like a special gift on mum's 70 th birthday which occurred during the week ( yes it was quite a week). Special mentions for Martin in concierge and unfortunately I can't remember her name but tall, blonde, gorgeous Nordic girl on reception was extremely helpful, and the booking guy on the phone did some decent rates that you normally only get on wotif. My sister spent a couple of days in the hotel after discharge and the teams in both restaurants were great about helping her with extra cushions and special food to meet her dietary requirements. The galileo restaurant is always superb with knowledgeable and unobtrusive staff, so splurge while you are there and then swim it off in the beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: 255060Bridgey
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my wife and I attended a Wedding at the Rocks and stayed overnight at the Observatory Hotel in Kent Street. What a pleasant surprise to find that "old fashioned" manners and courtesy still exists in this modern era. From our arrival to departure we were treated like VIP's, nothing was a problem and the Room was equipped with everything possible. We are both looking forward to finding an excuse to pay another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fergalfrog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during the first week of July having got a deal on wotif.com.au ($610 for 3 nights). All up the room was very nice as are the hotel facilities. The restaurant is very expensive but there is a very good Italian just down the road which is cheap and does great portions (out the door and turn right - think it's called Lucetta). One big improvement which I urge the Observatory to make is to consider their internet pricing. $10 an hour or $20 for 24 hours is ridiculous. I was on a 3 week trip (half business) and needed internet all the time. This was the only hotel NOT to provide free internet. Wireless internet is not a luxury and if 3 star hotels can offer it for free it makes no sense to be charging $50 for 3 days. When I got it I was expecting it to be lightning fast but it was only average and I ended up using free wifi at a nearby cafe. Another thing, our tv didn't have ABC. Since tv is incredibly poor in Australia and ABC is about the best of a bad lot I reported it to reception on the first day. It seemed to get forgotten and so I reported it again on the Friday only to get a letter through the door a while later to say it couldn't be fixed until the Monday. These were the only two negatives of our entire stay which are not at all significant. If could afford it I would stay there for longer and more frequently!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort, great service and sumptuous food”
Reviews.Author: daveevans22
Reviews.Content: If you want to be pampered, be greeted by name each time you enter the hotel, sleep in one of the MOST comfortable beds you have ever slept in and eat some of the finest food then this is the place for you. The public rooms are unashamedly luxurious with deep soft sofas, carpets up to your knees and have the atmosphere of a top London Club. If you like this type of opulence and the best service you could hope for, then this is the place for you. Being part of the Orient Express group you should expect, and will receive, the best of everything if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Service is what it is all about”
Reviews.Author: tamalicat
Reviews.Content: It's hard to add to what others have said - this place is all about the service and they do it so well. The rooms are comfortable and I was pleased to see they weren't twee. The staff at all levels go that little bit further than is standard in Australian establishments and make the stay a truly memorable one. We enjoyed the high tea, great room service, the pool and the lovely walks around the area. Little more to add really!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Harves11
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed the one night, we would definately reccomend this hotel to those who like the finer things in life along with the most courtious service I have encountered in a life of travel. From the initial booking, to the pre-stay telephone call that enquired as to any special needs (it was my wife's birthday), to check in/out and Conscierge service, nothing was a problem. It would be a better world if every person was treated with the courteous respect this staff displayed.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: wiggerl089
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel is located in the Rocks, an old part of Sydney. You can walk into town in about 10 to 15 minutes. It has the charm of an old world british hotel, but the rooms are very clean and not worn out as in other old style hotels. The bathroom is spacious and features a bath and shower separately. I felt very comfortable during my stay and enjoyed the walks into the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Orient Express Experience”
Reviews.Author: phill1958
Reviews.Content: From reception to departure the experience is second to none, The attention to detail and the execution of service is perfect. The knowledgeable and friendly front of house team offer a personal and unrivalled service. The rooms are well appointed and the housekeeping impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Meal”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I only had lunch at their Globe Bar in early July, 2010 and have not stayed in the hotel yet. The food was of a high standard and very filling. I had a beef burger and also a cappuccino. The coffee was one of the best I've tasted. The ambience was nice and the setting very pleasing to the eye. The staff member came across as being quite helpful and attentive. The prices were quite reasonable given the surroundings and food standard. We were given a tour of the hotel rooms after lunch by a member of reception. The staff member seemed a little on the formal side. It should be noted that the Observatory hotel is under the Orient Express, which also manages the Lilianfels Hotel and Resort in the Blue Mountains west of Sydney and my review of that property discusses the complex nature of the level of formality associated with these properties. The rooms appeared nice and my rating for the rooms is purely based on appearance. I may stay here in the future on the basis of my lunch experience. However, given that our extended group would include children, I'm still not completely sure whether the hotel would be suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury”
Reviews.Author: HawkesBayPfamily
Reviews.Content: Treated like royalty, wanted for nothing, It was the mystery Hotel on www.wotif.com for Sydney and cost a pitance compared to the ambience/luxury. Was the best completion to the three weeks holiday on the east coast of Australia that any one could ask for. We walked only 5 minutes down Argyle Street to the Rocks and circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “An occasion my husband and I will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: LG290610
Reviews.Content: Our room was absolutely gorgeous; the dinner at Galileo truly magnificent with divine food, amazing wines and impeccable service; and the breakfast the following morning was delicious. It was also delightful to notice all the simple touches made to make guests feel so comfortable during their stay. I have attended a lot of hotel inspections in my time, but having now stayed at the Observatory, I know why our clients always return, and why The Observatory is one of our Companyâ€™s preferred. I will certainly be recommending any future clients travelling to Sydney to stay at the Observatory Hotel, not to mention any colleagues or clients to dine at Galileo. The pool and Day Spa are also experiences not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy boutique luxury at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: robynjmay
Reviews.Content: After only our 5th stay it is very special to walk in the door to be greeted by the words "welcome back". The spectacular arrangement of flowers and sumptuous decor makes you feel you are definitely where you want to be! Upon stepping our onto our Juliet balcony and taking in the sites of water views and lovely Sydney you take a deep breath and know you can enjoy the next few days of relaxing and enjoying the friendly service, perfect location (right in the heart of the not so touristy Rocks) and all the other wonderful things that go towards making this the perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug070
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a wonderful night at this lovely hotel. I had heard from others that it was one of Sydney's finest however was yet to find out for myself. From the moment we checked in, the entire experience was perfect. The hotel is quite small (only 3 floors) & this only adds to it's charm & makes it more personal. The staff were all extremely polite, friendly & courteous. The room was tastefully decorated, comfortable & joy oh joy - it had a door that opened to a small balcony letting in the fresh air (something I personally love in a hotel room). We had an excellent breakfast in the hotel dining room & also enjoyed some r & r in the pool/spa/steam room/sauna etc located in the very nice day spa. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better service!”
Reviews.Author: JustStarting2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 8am after almost 24 hours of traveling. Our room wasn't ready yet, but the hotel was more than accomodating. They let us use the showers in the hotel spa/gym to freshen-up before we went out for the day. When we came back around lunch, our luggage was already waiting for us inside our room. The hotel room was beautiful and very comfortable. The location was wonderful as well, less than a ten minute walk from Circular Quay and a five minute walk to Darling Harbor. The service at the reception desk and the concierge were amazing. They recommended wonderful restraurants and great tours to take. The most impressive servise was when we inquired about surfing lessons. When we returned to the hotel a reservation had been booked in our names for the next day and all the details about surfing had been placed in our room. I felt like we received very personal service. Unlike some much larger luxury hotels, it seemed like the staff really went out of their way to ensure that every part of our stay was perfect. We had such a wonderful time at the Obervatory Hotel we will definately stay there again when we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to give yourself a treat - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: barbmccormack
Reviews.Content: I knew our stay at the Observatory Hotel was going to to great the moment we arrived.We were greeted so warmly as if old friends & then shown to our room which was luxurious with a gorgeous balcony & all accessories taken into account. The bar stocked my favourite wine & a short walk to the city centre capped off a wonderful evening in the city. Breakfast is a treat & the staff were so attentive we didnt want to leave.A walk from Bondi to Coogee along the coast saw us retire to the spa for a recovery!The only good thing about leaving is the ease of getting back onto the Harbour Bridge for our journey back to the country!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accomodation and service”
Reviews.Author: sunnycoast10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for a weekend away. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The service here is impeccable, the rooms are super clean and very comfortable. The rooms also have opening windows. Room service is fast and the food is always hot when it arrives (not so for some other hotels we have stayed in). Beautiful indoor swimming pool and good gymnasium with several up market treadmills and a good range of free weights, fit balls etc. We havnt tried any of the treatments yet at the spa but they sound like they have a varied range of treatments and packages available. We hope to stay here again when we return to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alwaysflyin41
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to the boutique hotel as the reviews on Trip Advisor were all very positive.......... Positives: Good location, nicely decorated, breakfast was well done, concierge was good. 3rd Floor room was quite big with a nice balcony. Negatives: Spa is fully booked 6-8 weeks ahead of time. There is no time reserved for paying hotel guests, thereby even on a cancellation list, we were unable to have a massage during our one week booking. Pool is nice but the hot tub is in bad repair, my foot was cut on the broken drain and many tiles are missing and in bad repair. View from third floor (top floor of the hotel) is limited and average. The bed in our room sagged badly and needs to be replaced. Musty smell throughout the hotel, especially on the third floor. The hotel hallways look worn and the carpets are stained and in need of cleaning, especially in the elevators. Note: We flew over from North America and booked our room arrival one day early in error. When we asked for that night to be removed from our bill, the manager offered 50% off. When we reminded him that we were staying for a week, the offer to remove the room was accommodated, but ONLY if we stayed at the hotel for the entire week. Due to the bed, lack of spa availability and poor conditions of the hot tub we decided to cut our losses and checked out early after three days anyway and paid the 50% for the room night we booked in error. We then moved to another hotel nearby in Sydney (Four Seasons). In the last six months, we have stayed at La Samana (St Martin) and Hotel Europe (Russia) both members of the Orient Express. Based on our experience at the Observatory, we will be avoiding the Orient Express chain as it was perfectly obvious that there is no loyalty or consideration given for repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning establishment and an exceptional Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorGN
Reviews.Content: Have visited this marvellous hotel on a number of occasions for both business meetings and for pleasure with my wife. The entire experience has always been exceptional and in particular must mention the Concierge (who we have discovered is a senior member of Les Clefs D'Or) and who has always gone out of his way to accommodate special requests with grace and kindness and with successful results on each occasion. The restaurant and the service are outstanding as are the rooms, all creating a superb package.

Reviews.Title: “We coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Out0ft0wner
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a junior suite with water views and it was spectacular. We arrived and were met by a lovely man with an umbrella since it was raining and we booked in immediately, the girls on the front desk being delightful. We were shown to the suite and given a tour and everything was pristine. Lovely, comfortable bed, spacious and out-of-this-world bathroom. The rain shower is not to be missed and the bath is huge and deep. There is turn-down service in the evening, which is wonderful. We never managed breakfast (too comfortable a bed!) but we had room service which was amazing. A table is set up, the staff are tremendous and the food is delicious and there is plenty of it. Nothing is too much trouble for anyone working here. From the people who service the rooms to the front-of-desk people to the restaurant staff, everyone is terrific. Had meals at both the Globe Bar and the Galileo Restaurant and the staff, the food and the atmosphere were wonderful. Do have High Tea, because it is not to be missed. And book for it in plenty of time, since people come from all over to experience it. I did leave it late, but the wonderful host took the time to make room for us and it was lovely. Everyone was professional and very, very kind. Will I stay anywhere else when next in Sydney? No, never again. It's going to be The Observatory Hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury! The most wonderful hotel we've ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: wildchild33
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel in Kent Street is far and away the most luxurious hotel my husband and I have ever encountered! Wonderful service from the moment the valet greeted us at the door, handled our luggage and whisked away the car to secure parking to the attentiveness of staff at breakfast the next morning. Lots of charming little details, gorgeous furnishings - very well appointed. Marvellous food and wine selection - try the Pirie sparkling! Friendly, cheerful, helpful staff made us feel well and truly pampered!

Reviews.Title: “AN ABSOLUTE MUST”
Reviews.Author: Natasha79
Reviews.Content: A fabulous experience. The rooms a just lovely....very spacious and in pristine condition. Absolutely loved the pool, spa and sauna, something everyone should do if staying at the hotel. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was delicious and great coffee! And all staff were very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jamjol
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in one of the hotels rooms for the disabled with my elderly Mother . Due to her limited mobility she was nervous about travelling and staying overnight but her mind was instantly put at ease when she saw the set up of the room and bathroom. She was also concerned that she would be a "burden" to hotel staff but everyone was so helpful and accommodating. It was a pleasure for me to see her concerns and worries lift with every minute of our stay. It is a beautiful hotel but I feel that the part that really made our short stay even more memorable was the attentive, friendly and professional staff. I cannot speak highly enough of our experience. It was truly memorable and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The very best”
Reviews.Author: amyl_b
Reviews.Content: Its expensive, but well worth the price. It is the only hotel in Sydney that we will ever stay at ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: jeffOnTheRoad2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Observatory last month for the second time to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel is elegantly decorated, and the bar, restaurant, swimming pool and other public areas are especially noteworthy. The location is in the Rocks, convenient for walking to the Harbor Bridge, Circular Quay, and downtown Sydney. But what sets the hotel apart is the impeccable and friendly service. Examples: Reception and concierge service recommended and arranged restaurant bookings (on a holiday when many where closed), held baggage for us while traveling to the Outback, and other services. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when visiting Sydney. Charming and top drawer in every regard.

Reviews.Title: “second to none in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AhP5
Reviews.Content: You just can't go past this hotel. We've stayed twice now, and the service at the observatory is second to none. Keep up the good work. Expensive, but worth every last cent. You get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “All Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: Taniwan
Reviews.Content: My partner, cockerspaniel and I stayed at the Observatory Hotel for a mini getaway and everything about the hotel surpassed our expectations. No I didnâ€™t smuggle my cockerspaniel into the hotel in my suitcase, the hotel actually allows animals (dogs to be 20kgs or under) which is amazing for a hotel of its caliber. The junior suite we stayed in was stunning and the photos on the hotel website donâ€™t seem to do it justice. We were also upgraded from a city view to water view suite when checking in which was a great surprise. Two double glass doors open onto a large balcony which give the room a fantastic airy feel. The service was outstanding in every way including the valet parking, luggage person, concierge, reception, bar staff and the waiter who delivered our morning coffee. Our dog was a little vocal in the lobby however the hotel staff were very understanding and accommodating. My partner and I plan to return sometime soon (without the furry friend) to enjoy the pool, spa, restaurant and all other amenities the Observatory Hotel has to offer. We did manage to have a couple of drinks in the Globe Bar while our dog was looked after by a dog-sitter (organized through the hotel) which was an experience to remember â€“ the dÃ©cor was stunning. There were little surprises and attention to detail throughout our stay which set the hotel apart from other 5 star hotels I have stayed at. Examples include bottled water, tranquility tea and hot chocolate brought up to the room at night, fancy dog cakes and biscuits for the dog and an abundance of high quality soaps/shampoos etc. The Hotel is also conveniently located in The Rocks precinct in easy walking distance to the Harbour Bridge and other famous Sydney landmarks. Observatory Park is also a 5 minute stroll which serves as a great place for photos and a picnic.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGNSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Observatory Hotel and once again, it was a sublime experience. The luxuriously appointed rooms and public areas, exquisite dining (including the hotel's justly famous High Teas), the relaxed club-like atmosphere, and most importantly, the wonderful staff, guarantees any stay here will be an absolute joy. The spa and health club, complete with a star-domed indoor pool, further enhanced the experience. Having stayed at a number of Sydney's premier hotels (all of which have been great experiences), we are of the firm belief that The Observatory is the city's and indeed Australia's finest hotel - a deserved member of the Orient Express group. RGN, Sydney

Reviews.Title: “cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: castlecrest
Reviews.Content: pleasantly surprised. staff (and especially concierge) couldnt do enough for us. room was extremely comfortable and location in the Rocks area is excellent for getting around sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: M1311
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Observatory. The staff were, to a person, wonderful and the property itself was well presented, the rooms spacious, clean and immaculately decorated (I especially liked the print of the voyages of Captain Cook on the wall - I managed to have a great stay and learn something as well.) We had room service which was very tasty, promptly and courteously delivered. The location is nice - equi-distant from the historical Rocks district with the Harbour Bridge and views of the Opera House and King Street Wharf which houses some lively restaurants and the Aquarium (a favorite of our son). The pool area is excellent although being indoors its probably note the best place to take a boisterous 3 year old as evidenced by the looks of some of my fellow guests. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone looking for a hotel with old world charm and service in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl50
Reviews.Content: Once again, Orient Express has shown me another fabulous hotel in a great location. The service, staff, rooms, restaurant, and other facilities are all top notch. It was my first trip to Sydney and after passing by numerous other hotels, I knew that my experience would have been a let down if I had not been at the Observatory. The location in the Rocks district is perfect to get the feel of Sydney and it's history. It is also a great location to sightsee and be able to come back to luxury to relax. We had one of the best meals in Australia at the reaturant. This is the only place to stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel and ammenities surpassed only by it's staff.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOrchestra
Reviews.Content: Last week I had the to stay at The Observatory Hotel, Sydney. Upon arrival I was greeted by friendly Concierge staff who set the tone for my stay. The courtesy and professionalism continued at reception where I was "welcomed back", upgraded and escorted to my beautiful, immaculately clean room. The Observatory Hotel is rightly famous for its beauty, impeccibly maintained and luxurious ammenities, but my stay was set apart by the staff who are friendly, interested and professional. It is rare to find such a complete package in a 5 star hotel. But The Observatory has it all. Thank you for an amazing room, and above all, thank you to the staff who made my stay so memorable and pleasant. Mr Walsh

Reviews.Title: “perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: frenchabroadFrance
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Observatory after staying in their sister hotel in the Blue Mountains we have stayed in excellent hotels before and after - but this one - just goes the extra mile- they got us seats at the Opera house at short notice - knew every restaurant - concierge was brilliant - every member of staff was friendly helpful and professional - it remains our favourite hotel - anywhere - we often laugh and compare other hotels to the Observatory - we have never found one hotel that has quite matched that comfortable - yet perfect experience

Reviews.Title: “Glorious splurge in luxury”
Reviews.Author: DJBNSW
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my 50th birthday, we splurged on a suite at the Observatory. It wasn't cheap, but it was worth it. Beautifully furnished, quiet, fabulous service (thanks Jennifer at breakfast !) and a delicious High tea to cap it off.

Reviews.Title: “The Observatory Hotel will spoil you!”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: We received a genuine warm welcome when we arrived at 10am, four hours before official check-in. Without delay, we were escorted to Room 219 and shown the features of the room. Seconds later, our bags were delivered. The bedroom is separated from the bathroom and dressing area by a door. The bathroom is enormous. The tub is deep and big enough for two. You have a choice of a hand held shower wand or a rain shower. The sink and vanity are generous in size. Everything is beautiful marble. The amenities are labeled Serenity and live up to the brand. The towels are soft, fluffy and huge. The dressing area has everything you could possibly need; bathrobes, an iron, plenty of hangers, lots of space for clothes/shoes, a loaner tote bag and umbrella and a safe. The king sized bed has a high quality mattress and very high thread count sheets. The bed was made with only two pillows. I like more pillows and asked for extras. The pillows were swiftly delivered. The room service staff gladly delivered buckets of ice every time I called, which was daily! Turn down service is special. Your slippers are laid out. And complimentary bottles of water are placed on the bedside tables. The TV is tuned to relaxing music and the lights are dimmed. The first night of our stay my husband had a bout with food poisoning. He was very ill, but agreed that if you have to get sick, why not while staying at Sydneyâ€™s finest five star hotel! It was Easter weekend and I knew it would be tricky to find some help if it came to that. So, I checked with Simon, the Concierge. He could not have been more helpful and really made us feel better. I was feeling pretty scared, as my husband was quite sick and we were far, far from home. Simon checked around for an open urgent care office and also had the restaurant Chef prepare a remedy of bland chicken soup and dry toast. The tray was promptly delivered by another caring staff member. There is a little convenience store just down the street. I walked there and bought Gatorade, which was recommended to keep him from being dehydrated. All of this worked and he was fine by the very next day. From the Observatory Hotel, itâ€™s a five or ten minute walk under the Sydney Harbor bridge to the Rocks main street and another five minute walk to Circular Quay. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that the front desk staff told us that we couldnâ€™t get on the Airport Link train at the Circular Quay platform. So, we walked over to Wynyard Station, which is a little bit more challenging of a walk with luggage than the relatively flat walk to Circular Quay. We got on the train for the airport and the first stop was Circular Quay! No worriesâ€¦ Our five night stay at the Observatory Hotel spoiled me for the rest of my life. I donâ€™t know how I will survive without a caring concierge, a rain shower and twice daily maid service!

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortably welcoming hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Icarus70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many 5 star hotels across many countries and i have not stayed at the equal of The Observatory. It isnt so much the room which is very nicely appointed, nor the location which we found handy to all major attractions (for us), it is by far and away the staff of this hotel which make it a great hotel. Attention to detail and friendliness like i have never experienced, a truly wonderful and welcoming stay. My thanks to all the staff at the Observatory for making our stay the best!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault hotel, or its staff”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I have long wanted to try this hotel, but the prices and its location had prevented me from doing so. I recently had a three night stay. The hotel is stunning. The staff are exceptional. I arrived and my reservation was quickly and professionally dealt with. No "just you?" comment, which as a regular female solo traveller always annoys me when checking in at a hotel. The room overlooking Kent Street was fine. I tried to find a shortcoming but couldn't. The only surprise was the older TV, not a new high def style TV. But of course it was fine, as were the selection of cable channels. The bathroom is huge, the shower (choice of rain or power shower) was fabulous, towels were massive and so soft, the bathroom had everything you would need including a generous sewing kit and shampoos etc are of a high quality. The bed was fabulous, on arrival, I lay down and promptly fell asleep for 2 hours, and I wasnt tired! Now the topper. Room service meals are HUGE. Each meal I ordered (around the $AUD35 mark) came with lashings of salad AND vegies. Never in any hotel I have stayed at, have I experienced such generosity of servings - and yes, the food was delicious. The room staff were prompt and efficient, no boring conversations struck up. Turn down service is offered, including a free bottle of water, tea and hot chocolate packets. The hotel is a good 10 min walk from the CBD and Circular Quay, this is only a bother at the end of a long day. I took a cab back once and it cost $10. The surrounding area is so nice, a residential area of The Rocks. The famous swimming pool is stunning also. I highly recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - brillant staff”
Reviews.Author: MerlinPotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed over for a Saturday night and had tickets to the opera that were delivered to the hotel. The checkin staff didn't have the tickets when I checked in but the concierge was fantastic and went out of his way to track down the tickets and have them delivered to my room. The rest of the staff was just brillant for the whole stay and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were beautiful with lovely views, and the bed was super comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine893
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to finish off our holiday in Australia - we only stayed for one night, our last night! But what a hotel! The service from the moment they open the door for you was superb!! Never have I had better! Even down to them passing you an umbrella on your way out as there was rain forecast later in the day. The rooms were very clean and huge, with a seperate bath and walk in shower & 2 sinks! One thing you must do, is use the pool and spa - again the staff were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: FreqAussieTraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at The Observatory and will do so again. The staff were excellent - from the front desk to the waiters in the restaurant. Our room was spacious and the marble bathroom spectacular. People were staying in the room next to ours but the only time we heard them was when we were both on our balconies. The day spa and the Galileo restaurant are very busy and I'd recommend booking early to ensure you can get in. We ate in The Globe Bar and I'd recommend it. The garlic prawns were so good we ordered them a second time via room service. The breakfast buffet was delicious and good value for what was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer101Sydney
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is a well known hotel in Sydney for its day spa. I went with my girlfriends and we ate at the restaurant and went to the spa. You can do high tea there too and also have it in the day spa. For a massage you will pay $165+ for 60 mins. We actually had upset tummies the next morning after the restaurant. The spa can get very busy on the weekends and sometimes there are no loungers available and you are forced to put your robe etc on stone benches. Not very relaxing. You can drink champagne but they ran out of plastic glasses so we had to sit on upright chairs in the dry area. Not too fun. The changing rooms are very small and people leave their rubbish and when it is busy staff get bogged down and dont clean the changing rooms. The sauna and steam room are single sex. The jacuzzi is in the swimming pool area. We thought staff should approach couples who are making it uncomfortable for other people and also set rules for the spa. The swimming pool is lovely. The lights on the ceiling are like looking at the galaxy. The rooms were fantastic but the walls are thin. we could here the men next door talking all night. The bathroom is deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Make you feel like you are their only guest”
Reviews.Author: Cath009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Observatory for my wedding. The night before with my bridesmaids and the wedding night with my groom. We all got ready the morning of the wedding in the suite, and the manager opened up an adjoining room so we could have a separate wing for hair and a wing for make-up! Nothing was too much trouble, we were able to order breakfast from the resturant and have it brought to our room (rather than room service menu), everyone had a blissful spa treatment, they helped us with cards to write the speeces on and after the wedding, I came back with my husband and the room was immaculate again and covered in rose petals. I was floored by the level of service and genuine enthusiam of staff. I wouldn't stay anywhere else for such an important occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, very well appointed rooms and excellent location, great hotel .”
Reviews.Author: DingDingHongKong
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and pleasure , this was both . The hotel staff were attentive not in your face and the hotel is quiet and well appointed,its a classic. Its warm ,its friendly and as a hotel should be, not over modernized. I really enjoyed staying at the Observatory Hotel. Sue Nichols Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MEMIndiana
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough about the staff and their assistance in every aspect of our stay. We traveled over 20 hours and arrived early so our room was not quite ready. The hotel offered to allow us use of the Spa/Pool/Shower area and kept our luggage so we could go out and about until our room was ready. Our room was very spacious and the bathroom was absolutely fantastic. The balcony was very nice to be able to sit outside and view the park or traffic or just the sky in the morning or evening. If there was any down side to the hotel it was that the room smelt a little stale and maybe it was just that the carpet may need to be replaced. The only other thing we found to be a little disappointing was that for the price of staying at this hotel it really did not offer much for complimentary food or drink even water was quite pricing. We would have loved to have ate at the hotel but found that the selections were very limited and very pricing. There really wasn't much for close by places to eat at either. I would give this hotel 4 stars but not 5.

Reviews.Title: “When visiting Sydney, I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRW
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, we felt totally at home. Our room was perfect, the bathroom spacious and the staff welcoming and extremely helpful. The hotel itself had a relaxed and friendly atmosphere, whilest retaining all the five star touches. From last-minute opera tickets to a repairing the wheel on one of our suitcases, nothing was too much trouble - and everything was done with a smile. I can't recommend the Hotel too highly - we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, international standard”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Nerkos
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend while our toddler was being babysat by the grandparentals; this was the perfect place. Check in and other dealings with the staff were smooth and pleasant, the reception staff offered us the concession rate for breakfast which was very reasonable (about $20); we had a late supper at the bar which was great - bartender was friendly, drinks were good and food was hot. This is not the most modern place in Sydney, however I believe the service makes up for it and it has the bones of a real luxury hotel, while not taking itself overly seriously. I would recommend the Obs over some of the newer so-called 5 star hotels. It also has a beautiful spa and pool area that we checked out. I haven't checked out Galileo Restaurant yet but my brother in law says it has great food at good prices, and am keen to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and out of time”
Reviews.Author: jBigoo
Reviews.Content: A real 5 star hotel ! We loved it. Based on our experience of Sydney hotels the overall experience makes it the most beautiful hotel in Sydney. Stayed during 3 nights at the Obs. Rooms are luxurious. Pick those with the sea view. Indoor pool is lovely with the stars. Service is faultless with a friendly staff. Special thanks to Elodie who went the extra mile for us. Main drawback, everything is a little pricey (the spa is out of reach). My only real concern is the breakfast. Value for price is very bad. For 40AUD you expect a little more of everything. Some important things were missing (cold cuts, cheeseâ€¦) and if you like Capuccino you gonna pay it extra. Very disappointing. Far below the hotel standard. They should fix this! This apart, was a very good experience though. I likely recommend the hotel but not the breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “A 5-star hotel of character, old-fashioned refinement and attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: TwitcherSydney_NSW
Reviews.Content: A wonderful welcome from the doorman greeted us on arrival (sorry, as it was raining we didn't get his name but the perfect welcome; and with an umbrella!). The young guy that showed us the room was an enthusiastic yacht racer so we spent 20 minutes discussing racing (including the fact that, a few years ago, he'd raced with the owner of the boat that we now own) and 2 minutes covering the room! Our check-in surprised us with an up-grade to a suite and what a beautiful room it was. Nothing missing nor out of place. The bed, pillows and air-conditioning were great and there was good protection from the sounds of Kent Street below us, even at 8:00 on Monday morning. The breakfast (included) was good and check-out was seamless and friendly. If we were "picky" we would suggest the $10:00 "Compulsory Gratuity" on our bar bill (for 2 glasses of wine, impeccably served) was a surprise and there was no Sydney Morning Herald available in the restaraunt, the following morning. Hey-ho, all in all,it is a fabulous spot for a luxurious night away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb attention to detail...”
Reviews.Author: DesiT
Reviews.Content: It's not glitz; it's not the latest, greatest, hip and trendy whiz-bang hotel with all the high-tech add-ons....but the Observatory Hotel is classic, sophisticated and stylish. I've just returned from a trip to Sydney where I stayed in 3 different 5 Star hotels over 6 nights (Sydney was heavily booked). At the Observatory Hotel the team look you in the eye when they speak to you and have mastered the art of making you feel special. They also realise it's the little detail things that make the difference. Well done team! Both the Sheraton on the Park and the 4 Seasons were "just another hotel". PS And the indoor pool at the Observatory is a fantastic way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service, the Best Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: tbjr
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Observatory for a 2nd time. Service was again top notch. Rooms are great. Pool is amazing. Good location for access to Rocks, downtown shopping, Darling Harbour, etc. I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Observatory Hotel - a thoroughly Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bella1Canberra
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write this review after experiencing the excellant service at the Observatory Hotel over the Australia Day long weekend. Upon checking in we asked for ajoining rooms for our 11 and 14 year olds. The staff politely explained there were none available at that time. No big issue. After a walk around the Rocks while our ropoms were being prepared, we returned to ajoinin rooms with water views slightly more expensive than those we had booked. On these occasions you'd expect the staff to make reference to th fact they had 'upgraded' our room. Not so here, just an understated pleasant surprise as if this type of service is th norm, an indeed as it transpired it was. The Gym, sauna, steam room were clean, odourless very well appointed, but the pool is outstanding. At no stage did we feel our two energetic boys were less than welcome. In fact their father tripped on a half fastened sandle walking down the stairs and in doing so liberally distributing the contents of a large cinema box of popcorn across the entire width of the entry atrium. Needless to say I was embarrassed but immediately put at ease and shuffled on my way as if it was their pleasure to clean up my mess. The rooms are likewise welcoming, tasteful and spaceous, without being kitch. The location is great. A walk over Observaory Hill to the centre of the rocks. However, the highlight for us was the level of staff interaction. While the standard of service from all staff was high, attentive, friendly and helpful, the Concierge, Simon, was outstanding. If he didn't know the answer, which was rare, he'd find out. My wife commented after we checked out that 'that level of service sets up the day and puts a spring in your step'. During our stay he clearly went the extra yard without being in any way over bearing. He and the other staff are a credit to the establishment. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “If only we could live here permanently - a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: familyof4Canberra
Reviews.Content: I should have reviewed this hotel long ago as we have stayed about 3 times a year for many years whenever we have traveled to Sydney for a weekend. It's like our children have grown up there. The staff has remained consistent over the years and are always helpful and friendly. Familiar faces everywhere year after year- a sign of a good hotel. The rooms are spacious and decorated in a heritage style. The restaurant, bar and public areas are cosy, comfortable and relaxing. As it is a smaller hotel, it never feels crowded. We've stayed at all the five star Sydney hotels and this is still our favourite. We still think it has the best hotel pool in Sydney. Note - this is a boutique hotel and does not have modern decor or harbour views. It is close to the Rocks area but further away from shopping precinct.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, brilliant staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: CountrymanLincoln
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in early December and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Having stayed a few weeks earlier in a room on the 17th floor at the Shangri-la, the Observatory had a much more welcoming feel with its 3 floors of luxury. The staff were always highly professional yet in no way 'pushy'. Our room had a small balcony overlooking Darling Harbour, with so much to see. A lovely spa and pool and tennis courts just across the road - surely the best hotel in Sydney !

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with the service beyond any expectations”
Reviews.Author: XentriX
Reviews.Content: Brilliant spa facilities - cleanest swimming pool we've seen, sapphire-turquoise-colored reflections in the water, eucalyptus oil in sauna, rain showers, excellent herbal tea and friendly people all around made for a very pleasant experience. Even though we are fond of modern style when it comes to the interior design, we found junior executive suite we stayed in to be magnificent and with lots of character, reminding us of The Tzar's Palace rooms (The Hermitage) in St-Petersburg. Room service was beyond expectations. We ordered main course with an entrÃ©e. And, unlike in many hotels, where you find yourself hungry after eating small portions out of big plates - to our complete satisfaction, both portions were huge and tasty! Ceaser salad (with anchovies and the crispiest bacon) is highly recommended! As well as the creme brulee and chocolate mousse, which you can order at any hour of the day or night. To conclude, The Observatory Hotel is a fantastic place to relax and unwind in the heart of the city, whether you are a Sydney-sider or traveled from far.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: farside8
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my son and his partner as a gift. From the moment my call was taken to organise and pay for their stay until the moment they left the hotel the experience was wonderful. Exceptional customer service - by phone and in person. The room (they stayed in a junior suite with water views) was beautifully appointed, spotlessly clean and everything had been thought of. Breakfast was superb. Congratulations to the management and staff - my thanks for making their stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is purely and simply the best in Sydney (and I have travelled extensively throughout the world). From it's impeccably elegantly furnished interiors you are immediately transported to an oasis of absolute luxury and beauty. It's five star accolades are very well deserved indeed! We treated ourselves to a superb Traditional Afternoon Tea at "Galileo's" and from the moment our taxi arrived at the hotel, we were ushered into the hotel with the upmost courtesy by staff. This high level of service continued right up to the time of our departure. The service we received inside "Galileo's" was even more impressive and the delicious treats and beverages on offer was just to die for!!! It is, without doubt, one of the best places I have ever visited in Sydney and a perfect way to enjoy a leisurely afternoon with friends. It is now on my "wish list" to actually sleep at this glorious hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update-expensive for less than 5 star”
Reviews.Author: VanessaAustralia
Reviews.Content: The SPA and gym need an update as does the rooms. The restaurant is no longer open for lunch. However, the staff are good and very accommodating. Location is also wonderful for visiting the Rock area. Would recommend other Circular Quay Hotels to visit the area until this one is updated.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location and genuine service”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Family008
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Observatory, both humans and our two westies alike. It was made all the more special by the exceptional location and genuine service. It's been some time since our last visit to that part of Sydney town but it won't be so until the next.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RetiredearlyLondon
Reviews.Content: I should start this off by saying I'm not a 'picky' person (most of my reviews on tripadvisor are very positive) and I'd spent the previous 3 days at Lilianfels - a similar style of hotel which I thought was outstanding. However, The Observatory Hotel left me cold. Breakfast was awful - my partner had poached eggs which were still raw and my scrambled eggs had the consistency of rubber (clearly hadn't been cooked to order and not acceptable at 40 dollars for breakfast). Had to wait 15 minutes for the bill and eventually had to call the waiter over who had perfected the art of avoiding eye contact. We never ate there again but there were clearly issues - having drinks at the bar I heard two separate couples complaining and then had to listen to two of the staff having a 'heated discussion' (it was all a bit Fawlty Towers - not 5 star establishment). The hotel does a look a bit tired - the carpets need a good clean, the lavatory stopped flushing (admittedly the hotel promptly fixed it) and then the tv started to switch itself off (I didn't report this but was surprised two things went awry). On the plus side the concierge is very good and the bar staff are superb (I don't recall the name of the tall guy who seems to manage it in the evenings but he really knew what hospitality should be about). I realise I seem to be in the minority on this one but I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “staff (1 of them) need to have manners”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspector1960
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a mix of repro asian euro furnishings and it does not work. This is a personal taste so really should be disregarded to an extent, however the following was infuriating. I checked out and left my luggage at the hotel for 3 hours. I returned to the hotel and waited by the reception while the porter brought my bag to me. In the meantime, one of the receptionists was making small talk with me. The other receptionist butted in and asked "have youy paid your bill" I was utterly shocked and did not react other than saying yes I have paid. The receptionist I was talking with and 1 other member of staff looked as shocked as I was. They will never have the opportunity to ask such a rude question again as i would never stay here again. What a pity that 1 person can ruin everything with her lack of class and rudeness. Actually, it would have been excellent PR if she was told off in front of me and an apology given. Apart from that,the service is perfect but not always obviously.

Reviews.Title: “Already the best and even better this time”
Reviews.Author: Martyn28
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the best of the best service from checking in to checking out, this is the hotel to stay at. Virtually perfect from breakfast to dinner or supper. The staff really make this hotel one of the very finest in the world. It may only be small, but it is perfectly formed, the pool and gym are great for relaxing and working off some of the amazing food offered night and day. We stayed on the 3rd floor; the suite was stunning, the view looking towards Glebe, just beautiful.... 5 Star accommodation, that is truly accommodating whether you are "the rich and famous" or "just an ordinary Joe" everyone is treated beautifully. A real treat and one of the best gems in a city full of jewels

Reviews.Title: “Amaxing, Brilliant, Incredible - don't bother with anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: nowtudor
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes across when you first see their website and photos as a posh, gorgeous inner city hotel. It is certainly that, but the beauty we found was that we had the most wonderful experience with every aspect over our 2 night stay. We had 3 rooms with little children, mothers and grandmothers, friends and family for our wedding. Honestly, there was nothing that was too much trouble for any of the staff. They were friendly, helpful and so sweet and accomodating of everything we needed. Whilst the hotel provides everything you expect and more from a boutique 5 star hotel, they are also down to earth, know how to smile. The rooms are so much bigger than ANY hotel I have stayed in across Sydney and we have stayed at the majority of hotels, so children and trundle bed are easily accomdated. The, gym, day spa and pool are fabulous and you are right in the heart of the Rocks, great pubs close by and the Opera House just down the road. Seriously, i don't right reviews on this site because I don't normally feel like saying anything unless it was perfect and unless I think the hotel etc can live up to expectation. The Observatory I think will make anyone's stay perfect, whatever the occassion! Don't waste your time looking for anywhere else, this is where you should be staying if you are planning a trip to Sydney or looking for somewhere different to spend a night in town in your home city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TZADZIKI
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Have stayed in many 5* but this outshines all. Service excellent and personal. Pool large 25m+ and wide for laps with sauna and steam rooms plus spa. Gym professionally equipped and managed. Interior decor sumptious with extra large room and bed kingsize but not two mattresses plied together...one whole mattress. Excellent extra privacy with room door. Marbled bathroom with separate bath and very large shower with wall and overhead shower roses plus marlbe seat in corner. Airconditioner a little strained but adequate even on very hot days. Take up the offer of the room tour. It is well worth knowing how to use everything. Good free movie channels. Not just stuck with news and sport. Breakfast a little stiff atmosphere and one orders off a menu re the hot food altho buffet cereals, fruit,cheeses and deli meats as well as sweet pastries. Location a good 20min walk down to the Rocks. Didnt use any local restaurant as quite happy to use Room Service. The Trout was succulent. Not massive helpings however with mains $30+. Distracting aircon lights near bedhead so wore my eye mask all night. Block out curtains.Door to bedroom separate to hallway [bathroom off hall] and exit door. View of another building and a distant view of the harbour. Michael, the doorman will remember your name and addresses you have needed a taxi. Free bottled water at night turn down. In room water with flowered essences bar price. Room rate: used the 21 Day Advance rate of approx $275/nt but was told later that there was a special with WOTIF for $99/nt. Missed that one, lol

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Experience - Romantic, luxurious and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Scottie1802
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in - and the service was so friendly, attentive and welcoming. I felt like a Hollywood movie star as we sipped cocktails in the bar. The Day Spa was amazing - we had a couple's treatment which was really special - and then relaxed by the pool that had the most beautiful paintings on the walls and star lit ceiling. The rooms were very luxurious - 4 poster bed and the most exquisite bathroom - marble with a huge, deep bath - perfect. We never left the hotel during our stay - dinner in the restaurant was really special. We thought about heading into Sydney for breakfast the following morning - but we were so glad we didn't, as the restaurant was equally romantic for breakfast as dinner - the attentive service we received during our stay throughout the hotel was amazing. Certainly a place to go for a little romance - and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel loved the ambience”
Reviews.Author: flyingcloggie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel room was spacious and very comfortable would certainly recommend it but we hired a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service -- we agree too!”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in our home city for a birthday celebration. We had heard great things about it which mirrored the Tripadvisor reviews and it did not let us down. Everyone we met there were friendly, helpful and keen to make sure we enjoyed our stay. The suite we had was very comfortable and well furnished. The paintings downstairs are a good touch and the bar was a comfortable place to unwind. It is not in the middle of the city if you are there for business but it is not too far away and for tourists/ leisure market, its location near the Rocks and the converted wharves is very good. If we were being picky, perhaps it may be the fact that the TV was on the small side (to fit the cabinet I guess) so that even the promotional channel had its writing cut off. But really, I doubt many people are going to spend too much time there watching TV and it didn't cause us a problem. In summary we found it very good and look forward to another chance to get back there.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgetable experience...”
Reviews.Author: ManneSydney
Reviews.Content: So often we are quick to criticise, and slow to praise... so, today, I want to heap praise on the Observatory Hotel Sydney. Having stayed in many hotels around the world, I can honestly say I have had one of the most pleasant experiences in all my travels, right here at home. The wonderful staff could not do enough for us over the period of my daughterâ€™s wedding stay... nothing was too much trouble for them at any time. No matter how small the request they acquiesced, with grace and good humour, at all times of the day or night. It was such a pleasant experience â€“ my daughter and son-in-law SMSâ€™d from their honeymoon in Europe to say they are still thinking about how fantastic everyone was and how it made all the minutiae of a wedding so much easier to deal with. I offer a big thank you to the Management and Staff â€“ from the very gracious Samantha, Martin and all the others we came in contact with â€“ this lovely hotel can certainly be proud of its wonderful people. An unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best motel you could EVER stay in”
Reviews.Author: ChristineWollongong
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i went to The Observatory Motel for my birthday, from the time we pulled up out the front to the time we stepped back into the car to go home the service and care showed to us was beyond words. It was so pleasant to be spoken to with dignity and respect and to have a chat to your staff along the way made the stay that much more enjoyable, could not recommend this motel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler825
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Sydney, I booked this hotel largely based on favorable TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed. We had a very nice top floor room with a small but usable (and very welcome) balcony. The room was comfortable although the bathroom was smallish (considerably smaller than that shown in the pictures) and a bit old fashioned in furniture, or perhaps traditional would be a better word. The location was great, less than a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay and in a quiet place that had a neighborhood feeling. Be aware, however, that it is quite a walk to downtown or restaurants, the area is not well served by buses, and taxis in Sydney are very expensive. The best part of the hotel was the wonderful service from all of the staff, especially concierge Simon who helped make this a home away from home and made us feel very welcome. The pool and spa area was wonderful and a late afternoon swim helped refresh us from long hours of travel and considerable jet lag. The only real negative was the very high charge for internet access...$10 per hour and $30 per day which is the most I have seen anywhere and which seems a bit egregious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay- Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: monkey24
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Observatory Hotel I was blown away. The service was excellent, the rooms were impeccable, and the pool was magnificent! The rooms were gorgeous and luxurious. There was a soaking tub, rain shower head and a heated towel bar in the bathroom. The service was excellent. They were even able to provide gold fish in your room if you requested. Basil and Cybil were the fishes that became our roommates for the duration of our trip. The hotel isnâ€™t near the subway, so if youâ€™re taking it in from the airport, the walk is kind of long and uphill. The hotel is near a couple of bus stops which was helpful and a couple of blocks away from the famous Lord Nelson Brewery. Overall I would definitely come back and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow68NewZealand
Reviews.Content: Afternoon, We recently stayed at your hotel in Rm 210 in Sydney from the 19-23rd October. We were resting after playing softball for Masters. We were welcomed right from when we got out of our shuttle to the time we departed. David, Brett, Ernesto,Martin and all the other staff members made our stay very comfortable and the hotel had more than enough style and room to suit us. We asked many questions and were shown immense patience and respect which I am sure is standard for your staff. The accomodation was amazing, all needs catered for, roomy, comfortable with extra touchs making a great impression. We really enjoyed the swimming pool, the sauna and beautiful fluffy gowns also. The gym had all the latest equipment and staff on hand answered all my annoying questions patiently. I am sure you receive praise all the time but we felt we needed to just say thanks, David for his great advice of around the town, Martin for his humourous anecdotes on Sydney life, the staff who kept bringing us ice, housekeeping, Ernesto for his fantastic service and commentary at breakfast and all the rest for making our stay very memorable. So if ever asked where is a great hotel to stay in where service is priority and staff are welcoming, your hotel will be on the top of my recommendation list. Thanks again Ann - Oddsox Softball Team member, New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem”
Reviews.Author: jenCALI
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviewers say. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service is excellent. I only have one major complaint. The bed in our room was terribly uncomfortable; hard as a rock. So even though the hotel was very upscale, it really didn't matter since every morning I woke up with an aching back! If you like hard beds you'll be okay.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place, I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Caf69
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed at. From the reception area to the bathroom, everything is just beautifully decorated. Our room was huge, with full marble bathroom, seperate deep bath with lavender bath crystals, strawberry plate in the afternoon, and turn down and slippers at night, with hot chocolate and water bottle. The staff were most polite and obliging, helpful in every way possible. Great location close to the rocks and harbour bridge, with plenty of restaurants nearby. Can't wait to go back again .... wish I could live there!

Reviews.Title: “going a cruise with friends”
Reviews.Author: RachaelB14
Reviews.Content: the hotel was so beautiful.i would so stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people - Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: minuit1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Observatory Hotel August 19th to the 24th and again from September 6th to the 8th. The staff made us feel welcome, comfortable and very well taken care throughout our visit. Upon our return for our second stay, it was like a home coming. This hotel is very special and it is all due to the management, staff, superb customer service and a beautifully cared for property. Everyone was professional, friendly and attentive. A special word about Ernesto and Simon. Every morning Ernesto welcomed us with a happy smile and chatted with us like an old friend while escorting our group to â€œourâ€� table. He remembered our preferences and we never had to ask for anything. Ernesto has that extraordinary gift of making everyone he encounters feel very special. The same can be said about Simon of the concierge staff who ensured that we had a very well coordinated visit to Sydney. He responded promptly to our requests and made wonderful suggestions about places to visit, places to eat and the best way to get there. He was extremely personable and sincere in his dedication to quality and customer service. We particularly enjoyed both Simon and Ernestoâ€™s wonderful sense of humor. While Iwe have singled out these two extraordinary people, I am not intending to slight the rest of the hotel staff. Everyone we encountered had a friendly smile and a helpful (â€œcan-doâ€�) attitude. When everything goes as perfectly as our stay did, it is always because the management allows the staff to grow to their full potential. Hats off to the Observatory Hotel. They provide customer service at its very best. Australia is a wonderous place and we plan to visit the country and the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: karh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for our wedding night, then just returned for our Anniversary. All I can say is i've never been to a better hotel. Both times we stayed there the staff were exceptionally friendly and polite, nothing was ever a problem. I absolutely love staying here. I would recomend it to anyone wanting a great place to stay in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class...once again!”
Reviews.Author: julieanne
Reviews.Content: First stayed here 2 years ago, and am delighted to say The Observatory is still an oasis of elegance, friendliness and charm. This hotel really impresses with its almost obsessive attention to the little things in your trip: the umbrella in your room for your use, the divine soaps and toiletries, the turn down service with its hot chocolate, slippers, bottles of water in velvet pouches and dim lighting -- oh, and the super helpful concierge who conjured up restaurant reservations out of thin air. The rooms are lovely, and the underground spa with its night sky ceiling is a real treat. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - A Bit Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mcfandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Initial problem with booking as we accidently booked for the night before we arrived. We were told that because we booked though a third party, they could not refund or move our booking to the next night. Annoying but fair enough. We were told that they could charge the full rate (almost an extra $200 higher than the original price), or the price that the website was changing as at that day (An extra $100). It was very annoying that they would not charge at the same rate we originally booked. Anyway. The staff were kind enough. The check in staff were a little arrogant - they need to remember that they just work in a hotel. The bellhop was very helpful and friendly, however we later hard his manager yelling at him for all guests to see - not really the professional standard you would expect from a 5 star hotel The room was nice - a little outdated but a fantastic bathroom. The pool was huge and lovely and very well decorated - the gym was also quite nice. The area the hotel is in is a bit yuk, with rubbish on the streets, however is a reasonably pleasant walk (about 20 minutes) from the Rocks The hotel is ok, but I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: leonielozza
Reviews.Content: OMG.......from the minute our car pulled up at the kerbside...to the minute we left twe have got to say this was the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff were most polite, helpful and fantastic we have ever dealty with. The room was to die for......exquisite and beautiful. The pool area - although we didnt swim - was amazing. I want to re-book just so I can go for a swim. The attention to detail and the room service was nothing short of impeccable.
