A huge thanks to all the staff and management at the Observatory Hotel......cant wait to come back....... Tony and Leonie Hanley

Reviews.Title: “everything a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: greenrock7
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Observatory Hotel for an overnight stay recently and had forgotten the beauty, size and comfort of the rooms, the professionalism and friendliness of the staff, the presentation and quality of the food, and the general relaxed but luxurious surroundings. Someone has got it very right with this hotel ! It continues to put the others to shame. In addition, I had the most relaxing enjoyable swim of my life and the temperature was surprisingly perfect. This hotel is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: jwrig08
Reviews.Content: Any quality hotel in a world-class city is going to be a bit pricey for the average vacationer. Having stated that, it is worthy to note what the expected return is on your investment. The Observatory Hotel is listed at the best hotel in Sydney. You won't find it towering 30 floors above the central touristic areas, though. It is unassumingly located on the West end of the city, closest to The Rocks, but near Darling Harbor -- well within walking distance to some must-see areas. It stands only three floors off of ground level. It has a nice view of the harbor, and has a very cozy, home-like feel within the guest suites. Most of all, the guest services are impeccable. I had a few unexpected needs arise, in addition to the usual touristy questions. The staff came through incredibly. From the front desk to the restaurant, everyone was only too eager and substantially qualified to make our stay thoroughly enjoyable. Most notable was the concierge staff. I spoke regularly with Michael, Simon & David; each of whom was extraordinary in his effort to assist me with needs regarding luggage, dinner advice (& bookings), as well as other information needed for our journey. I'm certain that each member of the entire concierge staff is equally good at such assistance; but these three men were always present whenever I called or visited their desk. They handled my dinner reservations while I was away during the daytime. They made recommendations. When I inquired about restaurant cuisines, they located, reserved, and printed updated menus for me...then booked a taxi to take me there, without my even having ask. I mentioned seafood. The next thing I know, I had reservations at Pier (Sydney's #1 seafood restaurant) for 9 pm, with a cab to take me there at 8:45 pm! This is merely one example. I'm not sure that there's anything more that they could have done to improve our stay. We were definitely cared for from beginning to end!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Observatory Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sirius57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory Hotel for five days in late August and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The rooms are very spacious, everything is new and impeccably clean and the hotel is decorated in a wonderful "old world" style. The service was truly 5 star with the concierge helping us with dozens of questions - from picking the best tour to the best pre-opera restaurant (thank you Simon!). Everyone was incredibly friendly. The breakfasts were delicious - while we love having breakfasts in a small cafes around the city we could no resist temptation and kept coming to Observatory for breakfasts ;-) The location is great as well - the hotel is in a very quite area but close to Circular Quay (just 10 minute walk). Overall, a wonderful stay at a wonderful hotel. We would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomad08
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Observatory as "locals' on a four-night winter break having chosen the hotel because of Tripadvisor reviews. Our room we found to be ample in size with "antiquey" furniture which was a pleasant change. The bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom with double sinks and a shower separate from the bath. There were huge towels in abundance and bathrobes provided, even a choice of shower heads! The most pleasant surprise came from the staff who were unfailingly pleasant, courteous and always aware of the needs of their guests. The service was oustanding. Whilst much of Sydney is easily accessible from the hotel, and especially the Rocks area, the immediate surrounds of the hotel are somewhat rundown. I do have one gripe which is more to do with the current fashion in cuisine and which is exemplified by the hotel restaurant. This style of cuisine is obsessed with presentation and is often encountered as a relatively small pile of food in the centre of a huge plate with a price to match the plate's size. On our first night my wife and I dined at the hotel restaurant and had one or two surprises. I ordered a seafood platter which when it arrived was indeed on a huge plate and consisted of an oyster, a prawn, a dab of salmon, a 2cm rectangle of fish pate and 3 miniscule slices of fish on a piece of tomato. Even the waiter remarked the I might like some dessert to make up for the platter. And, oh yes, it cost cost $36. We did manage to find a bottle of wine for $52. Needless to say, on subsequent nights we ate elsewhere at some excellent restaurants which are within two hundred metres of the hotel, serve excellent food and charge a reasonable price for what you get. On the flip side, we ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every day but avoided the expensive buffet and opted for what we wanted which was bircher muesli, porridge and coffee which was ample and a very reasonable $22 all up. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely, one of the best we've ever stayed in. The hotel staff are the best. Would I have dinner in the restaurant? Only if I had money to throw away and needed to go on a diet..

Reviews.Title: “The Bench Mark in Hospitality Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bkurtzSydney
Reviews.Content: What can i say. From the moment we arrived the level of service was spot on. All the staff from the door men to reception etc were nice, polite and most of all more than helpful. The rooms were clean tidy and more than comfortable. When leaving for dinner we were out the front waiting for a cab to come by, not at the Observatory a driver was organized within seconds to take us to dinner at a very reasonable cost. Once returning to the hotel we decided to have a quick drink before retiring for the night & before closing the Waitress asked if we would like a last drink. These little things make the service top notch. I myself take pride in providing my clients with an above board service which sets your business above others. I will be referring The Observatory Hotel to all of my Clients, Friends and Family. Thank You to all The Observatory Staff for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Hank83
Reviews.Content: I will never stay anywhere else in Sydney. The Managing Director, Mr. Griffin went out of his way to ensure we had a very enjoyable stay in Sydney. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellerm68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for our anniversary. Staff very friendly and helpful. A lovely surprise in our room on arrival- probably the most delicious strawberries I have ever tasted and dusted with icing sugar!. The rooms are very spacious and well presented, we had a water view which looked over the older port channel- not too pretty but no problem really, probably wouldn't pay extra for this view. Great shower. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better, just a 10 minute walk to the harbour bridge and city centre. No problem with any noise levels as on a quiet road. Would definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Galileo is currently the best restaurant in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Macca187
Reviews.Content: The staff are one of the best assets in this hotel - helpful and have the ability to anticipate Rooms are large and well decorated.There was no flat screen TV. We booked Galileo to celebrate my daughters graduation. The food and service exceeded our expectations. I have dined at many of the fine Sydney restaurants but this is in a class of its own. The Franco Japanese fusion works well and the wine list is comprehensive. Talking to the sommelier Christian about my recent trip to South America and being pleasantly surprised with the choice of Argentinean and Chilean wines, he recommended we try a malbec and a camere ( this is cultivar wiped by Phylloxera in Bordeaux and used for blending but survived in Chile ) His recommendations were excellent and great compliment to superb food. Our family felt that our daughters special moment was suitably complemented by a wonderful night of good food and wine and excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Total Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: SydneyLadyM
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and have stayed a few times and just know when we arrive it will all be taken care of. The rooms are glorious, the restaurant more than top class. We have hosted a couple of family functions here and they have been handled beautifully. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Dougeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel's best asset is its service, very warm and personal; it has a very relaxing and homely vibe. Its location is a little out of the way but it is very quiet and boasts huge rooms with quality furniture and luxurious bathrooms. All this comes at a cost though, but all in all The Observatory presents good value for the service and quality you receive. The only thing I was a little disappointed about was the lack of a quality flat screen TV , although I am sure these will come soon enough. I would definitely stay here again- only longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the range”
Reviews.Author: Jumbo01
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy our stay at the Observatory Hotel and look forward to staying with you again soon. Our compliments to all your staff and your cappuccino was the best I've seen and tasted anywhere. It was a work of art.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: eagle19
Reviews.Content: Great service and luxury surroundings. Couldn't fault the room as it was more like a private bedroom than a hotel room. Excellent service and the food was up with the best i have had although don't expect economical prices on the menu. Breakfast was a delight and even my cappuccino had a picture drawn on the top of it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Australia without a doubt, with an unblemished reputation over the last 15 years for a quality and dep”
Reviews.Author: Well_Travelled_19
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel in Sydneyâ€™s famous Rocks District is an absolute masterpiece. The architectural style, along with the furniture, fittings and fitout create a truly wonderful ambience. The service provision across all aspects of the hotelâ€™s operations, including accommodation, food and beverage, functions, fitness centre and day spa, is both incredibly consistent and highly responsive. The Hotel is popular with both domestic and international corporate travellers, and also upscale FIT clientele. The hotel does not cater to large tour groups and hence you donâ€™t experience the bottle necks often associated with large five star hotel chains at peak periods in the mornings and evenings. There is a wonderful old worldliness, sophistication and charm that emulates staying in a friendâ€™s home. Having stayed at the hotel regularly for the last 15 years, for both business and pleasure with family, I would rate the Observatory Hotel as the number one property in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Observatory, quiet bliss in the middle of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: tenrab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after finding a great deal through netflights.com, which included a free night, and we are so glad we did. From the moment we checked in the service was polite, friendly but without being intrusive.During our 5 nights we had a few queries from getting about to how to use a phonecard and both the concierge and the front desk staff were only too happy to help. The room was large, with a very comfortable bed, with very ornate individual fittings, which although mite not be to everyones taste, fitted in with the overall ambience of the hotel.Also the bathroom had both a seperate shower and bath, and his and her sinks,with lovely toiletries to match. We did not eat in the hotel at any point, but did note that most nights the restaurant looked busy, and these were weeknights in the middle of May not ones you would expect to be as busy, an indication of how good it must be. Location wise, the Observatory was brilliant only a 5 minute walk from the little cafes, bars and restaurants of the main Rocks area, thus plenty of choice for breakfast, lunch or dinner to suit any pocket. Dont be put off by the traditional Sydney style houses that suround the hotel going the one way along Kent St, i know some reviewers have commented on this and the safety of the area, but we found this no problem whatsoever and walked about each night without incident. Also it is only about 10 minutes from circular quay with its variety of restaurants and the main hub for Sydneys ferry system. This was truly a 5 star hotel, but one which has retained the personal touch thus making it one we would return to again and again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “"Ditto" the previous reviews. Extraordinary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dhuds
Reviews.Content: We stayed last month for 4 nights at the Observatory with our 14-year old daughter, during our first trip to Australia. What an introduction to this wonderful country! We echo the sentiments registered by other recent TA contributors: this hotel's personal service, in particular, is extraordinary. From the planning help of Yvonne to the super ideas on a zoo visit and rental car to the Blue Mountains from concierge Michael, to the gracious breakfast service each morning from Ernesto (what a way to start the day!), to the personalized cookies and hot chocolate for our daughter... Wow! we were so impressed. The consistently attentive, cheerful, and helpful attitude demonstrated throughout our stay was pretty remarkable. And I haven't even started on the hotel furnishings and accommodations! As noted by other guests, the pool and spa are lovely as are the guest rooms and lobby. Although this hotel doesn't have the views and nightlife of bigger hotels by the water, its intimate, comfortable, and neighborhood feel more than makes up for this and was perfect for us. In fact, we especially loved the neighborhood-style restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel. The only suggestion I have is to re-think the wireless access fees. They are exhorbitant and we ended up having to go to an Internet Cafe. Overall, however, we thought the price/value of the Observatory stay was excellent (particularly with breakfast as part of the package)... and we will have lasting memories of our stay in Syndey. (By the way, I have written a thank you to a hotel manager and I have attached this note).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: rebelmali
Reviews.Content: The staff from when we arrived we fantastic. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The meals from the dining room - we had dinner and breakfast - were delicious, and the staff were helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “This is classy”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLad
Reviews.Content: I want this hotel to be my official residence in Sydney - a hotel should look and feel this good. The rooms are large and stately with lovely colonial prints and beautiful furniture and decor that gives the hotel a distinctive Australiana feel. It has an old world, Sydney rocks charm of a bygone era. The hotel is quiet and peaceful, the hustle and bustle of Sydney seems miles away yet are within a short stroll. The drawing rooms, foyer and bar areas are charming and the staff are exceptional. The gym and pool area are first class. I loved everything about this hotel. It is more expensive but you get what you pay for. You don't get the stunning views some other hotels offer but staying at a place like this, who cares? I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “quaint and expensive”
Reviews.Author: roserandom
Reviews.Content: This six star Orient Express Hotel is not for the faint hearted when it comes to prices. While I understand you pay a certain premium for "name" and the agreeable location (it's not the best location in Sydney for a hotel but it's not too bad either) a hotel is pushing it by charging $13.50 AUD for a gin and tonic (Gordon's mind you) and $45 AUD for breakfast (and it wasn't a buffet. It was one hot selection from a set menu and a coffee. If I'd wanted a second coffee I'd have to pay extra.) Don't get me wrong, this is a very comfortable hotel with extremely helpful staff who, if anything, smiled a little too much. However, there is nothing to warrant completely ignoring the concept of a fair price for hotel staples (yes I think gin and tonic is a staple!) The other downfall was getting a taxi from the hotel. This is where it was a little too quaint. A hotel staffer with a lava lamp (well it looked like a lava lamp) stood in the street and waited for a cab. Being a quiet street he waited. And waited. And waited. I got the impression taxi's don't venture down the Harbour Bridge end of Kent Street all that often. And the hotel must have thought it was beneath then to call a cab. That aside, The Observatory is a little faded. It's a little bit quaint (I'd send my grandmother here to stay and know she'd feel comfortable amongst the wood panelling and the chintz) and it's a little bit boring. Stay here if you want quiet and you don't care about cost. Stay here if you want hotel staff at your beck and call (there seemed to be more staff than guests).

Reviews.Title: “Huge luxurious bedroom but at a price!”
Reviews.Author: Camilli
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel is in a good location and is an elegant, comfortable hotel. It is a little bit pretentious but the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was enormous. Views were not as nice as i'd hoped. The breakfast, which was included with our room, was fabulous. If it's not included it's very expensive. The high speed internet was also very expensive and mini bar quite a rip-off. The swimming pool is large and quite a cool relaxing place. And the gym is pretty good too. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Orient-Express at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler01
Reviews.Content: When traveling world-wide, I always try to stay at Orient-Express hotels, as I have never been disappointed with the product and service that they offer, and the Observatory Hotel certianly carries on this tradition! The service is fantastic; professional, courteous, and genuine without being over the top. It's the genuineness of the service that makes a hotel what it is. A robotic, monotone "my pleasure" is never heard here ... the smiles are real! You can tell the staff take great pride in their hotel and their city and they genuinely want you to have a good time. As others have said, the Globe is a fantastic space for pre or post dinner cocktails, and a nice retreat from a day of activities. We used room service several times, and found the food to be delicious and the delivery was always prompt. Although we didn't have the time to book any Spa appointments, we did use the pool extensively. Absolutely amazing experience, swimming with the southern sky above your head! Rooms are beautifully decorated in traditional style. As an OE hotel, I wouldn't expect anything less and is right in line with what you would find at the Mt. Nelson Hotel in Cape Town, and the Hotel Ritz in Madrid. Rooms are immaculate as are all the public areas. The bathrooms are huge, with seperate shower and large tub and plenty of vanity space which is always a huge plus. In-room Internet access is easy to understand and use and not overly expensive. If you're visiting Sydney and looking for personalized and genuine service, in a beautiful setting, you should look no further than the Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “The Observatory continues to maintain the highest standards”
Reviews.Author: TQ3
Reviews.Content: My family and I (5 adults) stayed at the Observatory for a week during the Easter holiday. It was a return visit to the hotel for my wife and I and we were interested to see if the hotel had maintained its previous high standards. We were not disappointed. We like The Observatory because of its location (quiet but only a 5 minute walk to the Rocks), itâ€™s not a high rise complex of rooms, plus itâ€™s furnished to a high standard (no minimalism here). You expect high standards in a luxury hotel but more often than not itâ€™s the people that work there who make the difference. The Observatory obviously trains its staff to be customer focussed because there is a constant and positive attitude which helps you to enjoy being a guest! The guys working on the concierge desk (Michael must be a permanent fixture and the team are a great asset if you want to get that all important table for dinner) were superb, reception were always willing to help and the staff working in the restaurant were a joy to see each morning. I'd read some previous comments about breakfast being expensive. Most mornings we used the buffet and had a hot breakfast, based on the current special inclusive 'offer'. The hot dish was freshly cooked (so no scrambled eggs that had been sat in a dish for several hours) and it was always as much as we could eat. Look out for some wonderful designs if you have a cappuccino! I thought it was good value. The only fault I could find was the cost of the Internet connection in your room - expensive in my experience, although if you buy-in that does allow you wifi in the main areas of the hotel. Personal taste and experience will of course vary from person to person. We stay in some wonderful hotels around the world and in my opinion the Observatory is up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “I felt as if nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: johnfryer
Reviews.Content: Check in was friendly and promptly handled and the porter showed us to our suite and carried our luggage. The suite was clean, well equipped (although the TV sets were a little old but quite adequate) and very comfortable. The Globe Bar remains one of the nicest places to sit and have a drink that I have ever been in. The Drawing Room is beautiful. Continental breakfast was excellent The best thing about the Observatory is the staff - they are unfailingly cheerful, helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: Sondra W
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival by rental car, my husband and I were greeted promptly and courteously. Our bags were brought inside and we were escorted to the front desk. We were checked in promptly and courteously by â€œElodie,â€� who wished us â€œhappy anniversary.â€� The bellman escorted us to our room and that is when the service started to deteriorate. When we entered the room it reeked of cigarette smoke. It was obvious to all of us including the bellman. The bellman apologized and escorted us back downstairs, whereupon I explained to Elodie what happened. We stood there waiting for her to change our room. We assumed, erroneously as it turned out, that it would be done quickly. After standing there a few minutes, she asked us to take a seat in the lobby, which we did. After waiting another ten minutes or so, the bellman came over to us and asked if we would like to wait and have a drink in the bar. Again we complied. We ordered drinks and had plenty of time to enjoy them. By this time, more than 30 minutes had passed. Finally, the bellman returned to escort us to our new room. Before entering the room he told us we had been given â€œa bit of an upgradeâ€�. We entered the room to see that it was significantly smaller than the â€œdeluxe king water viewâ€� and without â€œan oversize bath, double vanities and separate showerâ€� that I had reserved. By this time, it was too late for us to try and change rooms again as we had a commitment to meet someone for dinner. We freshened up and went out for the evening. Upon returning around midnight we saw that our bed had not been turned down nor our room readied for the evening. Therefore, we had to â€œdigâ€� our pillows out of the bedspread and do it ourselves. We pulled back the bedspread and saw that the mattress pad was a good 30 centimeters short on both sides and the bottom sheet was just hanging out of the mattress on one side of the bed. Additionally, there was no order card for breakfast to hang on the door. The next morning I awoke and opened the door to get the â€œcomplimentary daily newspaperâ€� mentioned in our reservation. It wasnâ€™t there. My husband and I then went out sightseeing. When we returned our room was making an intermittent tapping sound that wouldnâ€™t stop. We called the front desk and they promptly sent maintenance. The gentlemen heard the tapping and we left him to fix it. Upon returning to our room for the evening, the sound had been fixed, but the message light was flashing on the phone. The message on the phone was that there was a message downstairs for us. I went downstairs to get the message. As it turned out, the message was simply to tell us that the tapping had been fixed. I found that absurd. If that had been the phone message, I would have been able to avoid the inconvenience of going down to the lobby. By this time, I had had enough. I asked the receptionist why we were being treated this way. She was very apologetic but by this time it was too late. I told her there was no turndown service on our first night. Her explanation was that housekeeping didnâ€™t know the room was occupied. Was that supposed to make me feel better? I told her about the newspaper, or lack thereof. Her explanation was that I didnâ€™t tell her I wanted a paper. I told her about the reduction in room size. Her explanation was that the balcony counted for the lost space from the other room. I have never heard such logic. Can I put my luggage on the balcony? I think not! I wanted and needed a bigger room. This was our last hotel stay on an around the world trip celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We had a lot of luggage and wound up tripping over it. In addition, the lack of vanity space in the bathroom proved to be a major inconvenience. After my complaining, we did receive a fruit plate and were comped for parking and the minibar charge. But in our minds, that did not make up for our profound disappointment. It was supposed to be a special weekend and it was not. I wrote a letter to the regional manager and got no response. Then I emailed through Orient-Express website and got no response from them either.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Observatory”
Reviews.Author: scotty0910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatory for 4 nights at the beginning of March with our 4 year old and I had been slightly concerned it may be a little stuffy to take our child too. I was very wrong as the staff couldn't have been more welcoming with a welcome plate of a gingerbread man and strawberries on our arrival right down to the 'mini' bathrobe and plastic boat in the bathroom. The rooms are fantastic with a lovely comfortable bed and make sure you use the pool with its gorgeous ceiling of stars. We were alone in the pool at about 7 at night and even with our child it felt very tranquil. The position of the Hotel is also ideal for both Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Would highly recommend this Hotel and would love to revisit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay â€“ but have breakfast elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Olympick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a birthday and we specifically booked The Observatory to make it a special and unforgettable experience. As such, we booked a water-view Junior Suite. Although our overall experience was wonderful, Iâ€™m not sure the hotel is living up to its 5 stars. Check-in: We live in Sydney, so drove up to the hotel and had it valet parked â€“ the service was great, they took our details and escorted us to the front desk. Check-in was great and the staff very friendly. We were escorted to our room â€“ even though we were staying only one night, we still had a couple of bags with us and had to carry them to the rooms ourselves! No one offered to take them for us â€“ I thought taking bags to the room was fairly standard for 5 star hotels? I guess not in this one. In-room dining / service: We hadnâ€™t eaten since breakfast as it was a busy day getting ready for the birthday, so I couldnâ€™t wait to order and eat something asap. I called and ordered and was told it would take 25-30 min for the food. I called about 20 min after it was meant to arrive, turned out that whoever took our order had forgotten all about it. The person actually called us back and personally apologised, letting us know the meals would be complementary. I appreciated that touch as it would be very embarrassing to admit to a mistake and having to personally apologise for it. I thought the in-room dining menu and quality of food was good. We had also arranged for some finger foods (sandwiches) to be delivered to the room as we were having a small gathering for a group of friends before going out. We tried to arrange this in advance and were surprised how limited our choices were and how unaccommodating / inflexible the hotel was with our ideas. It was either a canapÃ© selection for $30 a head or mixed sandwiches for $8, with nothing in between and no flexibility to arrange mixed food platters. We wanted a selection of small desserts as well, but the hotel would only do them as individual portions, which we didnâ€™t want. Iâ€™ve never encountered this anywhere else that the hotel wasnâ€™t able to think outside the square to accommodate their guests. In any case, all went smoothly and we had a great time in the room entertaining our guests â€“ the water views are West and it was a magnificent view of the sunset (see photo). Upon going out for the night to celebrate, I requested that all the dishes and glasses be cleaned up from our room for our return. Our request was ignored as we came back to the room as we left it. Breakfast: We read some negative reviews so we werenâ€™t expecting much. The breakfast wasnâ€™t too bad however and the staff were just wonderful. We had pre-booked full breakfast and you actually get to pick the dish from the menu and it is made fresh for you (Iâ€™ve only had this at a couple of hotels). For anyone off the street or not pre-booking breakfast, donâ€™t bother with this one. It is extremely expensive and a â€œfullâ€� breakfast gives you only one hot dish, one freshly squeezed juice and one coffee/tea â€¦ if you want more, you pay for it â€¦ you do have unlimited access to the continental breakfast buffet though. Should you wish sides such as hashbrowns, bacon, etc thatâ€™s an extra $8! In addition to the $50 or $60 a full hot breakfast costs. Iâ€™ve never had this anywhere else before so was extremely disappointed by this. My recommendation for EVERYONE wishing to stay at this hotel â€“ donâ€™t book breakfast and either walk or get a taxi to the Hilton, which isnâ€™t too far (might seem like it if youâ€™re walking). The full breakfast there is $35 (from memory, but whatever it is, itâ€™s well worth it). The hot food there is also made to order and there is no limit on how many meals you have â€“ get fresh pancakes, eggs Benedict, waffles, eggs of any kind etc etc â€“ your stomach is your limit. There is a juice station and you can have all the freshly squeezed juice (pick your own combination) that you want. There is also a cold buffet and the usual pastries, toast etc. You can eat as much as you like at the Hilton and the quality of breakfast there is FAR superior! Accommodation: I donâ€™t want to end on a bad note as we did have a great time at the Observatory and it is certainly a great experience. The hotel was very clean and it is beautiful. Our suite was luxurious and although the dÃ©cor may not be to everyoneâ€™s taste, we chose it intentionally to get that touch of old-world elegance. The bathroom was great and we really loved the rain shower (that the Savoy in London is so famous for). The TV is really old, but itâ€™s tucked away and we had no interest in it anyway. Suggestions: I think some reviews mentioned that the hotel needs a renovation. I can see what they mean, but I think itâ€™s been very well looked after and is very clean so itâ€™s still good. To keep its reputation and stay top class, they should consider upgrading or renovating it soon as well as look after their guests a little better. Someone needs to revamp the entire breakfast arrangement, otherwise â€“ intending guests â€“ try the Hilton (you wonâ€™t regret it), or go somewhere locally.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best in Sydney, likely one of the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: astropoeia
Reviews.Content: I must first qualify that I'm not exaggerating when I say that this hotel is definitely the best in Sydney and one of the best in the world. My husband and I both travel frequently and have stayed at many leading hotels of the world. But many a time, even though the hotel is a highly rated five star establishment, we still get disappointed with some aspect of our stay. But for Observatory, this hotel has far exceeded my expectations in all aspects. Most of all, its the excellent service attitude that no request (reasonable of course!) is too much for them, and that they would go the extra mile just to make your stay a pleasant one. You're made to feel that you can rely on them to get everything done right. This is something very much lacking in most other hotels. Someone somehow will miss out something, be it the concierge or the receptionist. But at Observatory, you know you'll get what you ask for. We stayed at this hotel on the last day of our three day trip to the Blue Mountains and Sydney to celebrate my husband's birthday. At Blue Mountains, we were already extremely impressed with our stay at Lilianfels, the sister hotel of Observatory. (See my other review for Lilianfels). So it was to my surprise that the Observatory was able to do even better. I will now provide a breakdown for why I rate this hotel so highly. 1. Reservations The reservations staff was not only polite but he made sure that all our requests for our room were met. In particular, he made sure we had a room on the third floor (the highest) with a lovely harbour view. 2. Reception The reception was most efficient. Check-in and out was extremely fast. Most notably, the receptionist, Robert, was extremely friendly and managed to accommodate my last minute request for a birthday cake for my husband. He arranged for a really delicious and beautiful chocolate cake to be delivered at exactly the time I requested. And upon check-out, Robert also provided good advice when I could not decide which Observatory teddy bear to purchase. 3. Room Elegant, beautiful and most charming is how I would describe the room. Its much bigger than most hotel rooms and the decor is so sophisticated. There is no issue with noises at all as there are two doors to the room. One when you enter, with the closet and bathroom within reach and another for your bedroom. The room was also immaculate. I am quite a cleanliness freak and for me to find the room clean to my standards is rare. Even the linen was spotlessly clean. You know how sometimes while the linen looks clean, after you sleep in it, you start to itch a little. But here at Observatory, there was no such issue at all. The toiletries provided were also lovely, especially the body balm which kept my skin moisturised despite the hour long swim. 4. Pool The Observatory has a most beautiful pool with a ceiling made to resemble a thousand stars in the sky. The pool was extremely well-maintained and clean. The whole atmosphere was most serene. 4. The Globe Bar After our opera, we went to the Globe Bar for a light snack as it was already 10.30pm. The waitress very politely informed us that we will need to make our food orders soon as the chef was leaving. But she joked that they'll keep the chef in the kitchen until we're satisfied with our orders. The homemade carrot soup was a gem. The decor of the Globe Bar was also very classic, like an old English drawing room. 6. Service This is the main reason why I rate this hotel as exceptional. Everyone from the receptionist to the bar staff, to the concierge, to the housekeeping staff, never once failed to meet expectations. They were all extremely professional, friendly and efficient. Everyone did their job with pride and its just so truely impressive. I hope that I've given a good picture of why this hotel is exceptional. For a hotel with all these attributes, the price is totally acceptable and resonable. I look forward to returning soon and hope that more people will discover what a gem this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussietoday
Reviews.Content: I stayed here late last week before leaving Sydney. It was my last 2 days there--friday and saturday.I would like to say that it is one of the best hotels to stay at in Sydney. There was almost nothing that could be considered negative except it is not close to a beach! as location is the city. I would highly reccomend it to anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Biggles68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights here on our whirlwind second visit to Sydney. We loved the hotel from the moment we walked in. The check in staff were friendly and efficient and our room was beautiful. Full of character which made a change from the usual hotel room formula. We were attending a 2 day wedding for a friend and this was the perfect place to be based. The hotel is in a quite part of the Rocks bit within easy walking distance of every must-see bit of Sydney. We have done a fair bit of traveling over the years and this is our 2nd favourite hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Best of its class”
Reviews.Author: gullilverct
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 wonderful, relaxing nights in this modestly sized luxury property in the Rocks area of Sydney. Near great restaurants, Opera Hous and the harbors, it was a terrific value booked directly with the property via advance payment on the web. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the concierge exceptionally helpful. Casual dining in the plush clublike bar room area was a delight. Good food, great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “We were made to feel special from the moment we walked in the door”
Reviews.Author: tofs
Reviews.Content: Without exception, from the Concierge, Reception, and the Housekeeping, through to the Restaurant and the Day Spa, the staff were a credit to the organisation. They really seemed to enjoy their jobs and were always friendly and courteous even when they weren't specifically looking after us. But that friendliness never descended into frivolity or flippancy and the courtesy was never condescending. They were always thoroughly professional but were never patronising. The balance was just right and they made our brief holiday one that we will never forget. The chef and staff of Galileo's deserve a special mention as the meals were superb, the wine list was the best we have ever seen and again the service at both dinner and breakfast was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed luxury”
Reviews.Author: LindaNZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Sydney recently to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We arrived very early after an international flight, and although our room wasn't ready, reception took my cellphone number and called us when it was ready. Our room was on the third floor, with a balcony, which meant we had a nice view to the west, with cruise ships, boats, yachts etc buzzing around the harbour all day. The room was large, clean, immaculate. The decor is not to my taste, but I knew that when I booked. Our package included breakfast, otherwise we might have baulked at the $49 price, but the food was excellent, service friendly and relaxed. We stayed there partly to indulge in the degustation menu offered at the restaurant. It was very very good - an elegant and comfortable dining room, excellent service, a sommelier who knew his stuff, and a perfect way to celebrate a special occasion. The food was divine - my favourite was the ocean trout dusted in five spice powder, served with a blini filled with wasabi cream. Fantastic! The only downside was that the tea/coffee offered at the end was not part of the degustation menu, and extra was charged. It would be more reasonable to include the price of this in the degustation menu, making it all a little more seamless. The pool is definitely worth trying, summer or winter. It was very romantic the first day we visited, but Saturday saw the arrival of families (it was hard to tell if they were hotel guests or members of the health club) and spoiled the the atmosphere a bit. The location is good. After our first day of walking everywhere, we had sore feet and blisters, but found it easy and cheap to take taxis for the rest of our stay. Only about 9 (according to one of the very precise concierge staff) minutes walk down to Circular Quay, a bit further to the city but very easy to navigate around. We had a problem with the bill, due to miscommunication between the reception and restaurant (twice), but this was sorted out eventually, although it did put a slight dampener on the end of our stay. I would recommend staying there, and particularly booking for the degustation meal.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying”
Reviews.Author: Splishsplash
Reviews.Content: My husband I am had a brief stay over in Sydney - just 2 nights - before heading to a wedding and at late notice I looked online and found the Observatory. We were offered a great rate by contacting the hotel directly - probably due to the late notice - but made it a most affordable indulgence. I arrived on an earlier flight to my husband which I sometimes find intimidating and not knowing the hotel was concerned but as soon as I stepped out of the taxi the concierge were there to greet me, and I was checked in effortlessly - even asking if I would like to go to the room and allow my husband to do the formalities when he arrived. The rooms are large, luxuriously fitted and you get a true luxury experience. Don't miss the food in the hotel - the breakfasts are out of this world. Any questions or obscure requests are so well taken care of by the concierge it's almost a mission to find anything that they cannot do or find for you and they should be credited for their efforts. Pack your bathers - you would not want to miss the pool and the gym, although small, is superbly fitted out. The location is good for Sydney and with the service you receive, even if you don't have a spectacular view of the harbour, you actually don't seem to notice. We've stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in Sydney and without doubt will now be sticking with The Observatory. Even if the price tag next time could be double, it is absolutely worth it! Do yourself a favour, give them a go but please don't book the place out for when I am next in town...

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!!! 6 Stars from us!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAustralia
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two sons, 9 & 15) have just enjoyed a great 10-day holiday in Sydney made possible by the perfect base of The Observatory Hotel, The Rocks which I found through Tripadvisor. We could not have had a more enjoyable holiday. The service in all areas was top notch: most especially from the concierges, Michael (cannot praise too highly), Simon and their team; also from room service and the turndown service; and the front desk was good too. The concierges and overall service, combined with very pleasant largish room and bed, and lovely bathroom - great shower too - plus the location were why we changed our itinerary and extended our stay, twice, from the original 3 days to 10 days. The goldish for the young one to look after were exceptional ... the gingerbread men and personalised plate ... again, appreciated. We loved the location ... a most pleasant few minutes walk from The Rocks, Circular Quay and around to the Opera House etc I read ALL the reviews here, and management replies - well worth doing to get the most out of your stay - they were all pretty well spot on. I would congratulate the Manager on running a first-rate "show". Opportunities for improved service which some reviewers identified years ago would seem to have been most successsfully achieved! We had two large 1st floor "deluxe" interconnecting rooms with large bathrooms. You don't go for the view. Next time we would request a room with a balcony ... maybe one with a large balcony (depending on the cost) overlooking the street. It's in a great area to walk around - great pubs on the way to The Rocks itself. They have a very pretty swimming pool downstairs, and lovely bar and restaurant. All-in-all a wonderful time was had by us all - and its very rare for all 4 of us to agree on anything! Oh! I nearly forgot ... if you want to take your dog with you, as we did ... they will pamper him/her too!!!

Reviews.Title: “No wonder it's rated one of the best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: cornishtim
Reviews.Content: The whole experience with The Observatory was exemplary - from the reminder e-mails through to the final moment checking out. On arrival we were early checking in (11am due to flights), but Simon (the concierge) welcomed us immediately as we exited our taxi, and seemed to be expecting us which was a very nice touch. Our room wasn't ready, but the reception offered us the use of the spa/gym and showers to freshen up. We chose to explore the Rocks a little bit as they are only just down the street (5-10 mins walk). Within 30 mins they had phoned us to let us know the room was ready, and our bags were already in the room with a nice welcome note and plate of strawberries (another nice touch). The room was lovely and spacious and overlooked the harbour, and also had a large bath and wet-room shower (with one of those big heads). Breakfast was absolutely lovely and the fresh fruits were incredible. The food was brilliant for all meals - we ate in the bar one night (restaurant not open on Mondays) and also had room service. It was expensive but then that's what you get in a 5-star hotel with exceptional quality and service. The spa/pool/sauna/steam room are all very nice and they have useful toiletries in the changing rooms. The staff were more than helpful and knew our names and room number every time we spoke to them - yet another nice touch. This is the sort of class that you can only get at a smaller hotel - I can't quite believe they have 100 rooms as you would never realise it. The only, and I mean ONLY, drawback to The Observatory is that they don't have any outside space such as a garden or patio, but other than that I could not fault the hotel in any other way. Except possibly the expensive internet access. Location-wise it's ideally located. 5-10 mins walk to The Rocks, 15 mins to Circular Quay, 5-10 mins to CBD and Darling Harbour is about 15-20 mins away. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to "splash out" on a great hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Rnsco
Reviews.Content: The Observatory is just blocks from the Sydney Harbor scene, yet a world away. On a quiet semi-residential street, the hotel is small and I must say charming. A few block walk to the harbor opposite the Opera House. Views from the rooms are OK but not spectacular. Rooms are comfortable in size, very well furnished and fitted with just about anything you've ever found in a room, including a sewing kit with pre-threaded needles! Service is quiet and efficient. For a first time Sydney visitor, the concierge is most helpful with local ideas not from guide books. We did not use the spa and have only eaten in the restaurant once on a prior visit and it was good. Bar is very cozy. Didn't see many children and the hotel does host meetings on the ground floor, however the lobby area was always quiet. While boutique is over-used, The Observatory certainly fits in the category. If you book direct, make sure to look at packages and special offers on their website. We also stayed at a sister property, Liianfels in the Blue Mountains and it is of equal caliber to The Observatory. This was our second stay at The Observatory and it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Observatory”
Reviews.Author: OlympiaCremina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Observatory hotel in November and loved it. The room was lovely and the concierge was terrific, they were able to help us get tickets to a musical, reservations at Est. and were overall very helpful. We also thought the location in the Rocks was perfect, very cute neighborhood with character. It is close to Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens and I recommend going to the Lord Nelson down the street for a beer one afternoon. We had the breakfast twice during our stay, and while it was expensive, it was great. The food was always fresh and they have a great selection of fruits, cereals, smoked salmon, meats, etc. The service was also spot-on. If we ever make it back to Sydney we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Stay”
Reviews.Author: 73Duck
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding hotel! If you are visiting Sydney as a tourist, this is where you should stay. The Observatory is just a short walk to "The Rocks" district and the Circular Quay ferries that take you across the harbor to the Toranga Zoo and beyond; note: the ferries give you the best photo ops for the opera house and the bridge. It is located in a quiet residential neighborhood, with good restaurants only a block or so away, and the famous Lord Nelson brewpub is just right down the street (be sure to try their "Three Sheets Ale"). Grant, Simon, and the rest of the staff really deserve kudos; they are cheerful, helpful, and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel has 100 rooms spread out on three floors, the top two floors are set aside as non-smoking rooms. We stayed in room 314, a water- view room overlooking Darling Harbor and loved it; note: the standard rooms on the back side are slightly smaller than the city-view rooms, but the view of Darling Harbor and the large walk-out balcony (with teak table, chairs, and chaise lounge) more than offset the slight difference in size. Our room was also incredibly quiet; we never heard a passing vehicle or any other guests in the hallway, for that matter. Attention to detail is the hallmark of this hotel; turn-down service was over the top and exceeded anything we have experienced in a similar 5-star hotel. Like some other reviewers, we felt the breakfast options were a little steep, so we walked down the street to to one of the local coffee shops for breakfast each morning. That said, do not let this minor detail stand in your way. This is THE place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, luxury hotel, fab staff, go elsewhere for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LondonScott
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for sightseeing in Sydney, we spent six nights at the hotel but avoided breakfast which was expensive for the quality and choice you got. Try RD's down the road which is run by a couple from the UK who welcome tourists and happy to chat to you and offer a great choice of breakfast at a good price. The hotel overall had excellent staff - our rooms were always so clean and tidy and everyone we spoke to was very helpful. Check in was quick and easy and the concierge was the best we have ever had the pleasure to deal with. Simon was particularly helpful and was always on hand to make recommendations from blue mountain tours to hairdressers! He always made sure we got a taxi and the driver was instructed carefully. Be warned that not all taxi drivers know where they are going!! overall an excellent stay in a five star hotel - my only criticism was the sharp price of phone calls from the room and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Divine”
Reviews.Author: froggie79
Reviews.Content: What a truly pleasurable night away from the children!!! Staff are superb - not an ounce of "superiorism" in such a classy establishment. Restaurant is world class and everything is simply superb!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkExeterNSW
Reviews.Content: We once again had the pleasure of dining and staying over. Maybe it is maturity enhancing one's appreciation but I'd swear that The Observatory Hotel just gets better and better.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfection”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our honeymoon and were blown away. It was beautiful, well maintained, modern yet very, very cozy. It's also in a lovely location - so close to the attractions, but in more of a residential area and right near the Observatory, which we found preferable to being among the impersonal, high-rise buildings of downtown Sydney. The staff was incredibly helpful and made us feel so comfortable. Highly, highly recommend - I wish we'd stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this one. It is for sure a nice - old style hotel. Once the concierge warmed up to me - he was great too. However, I stayed there for a week and staff only greeted me in a "welcome back" way the last couple of days - so the personal touch was missing and I found that really dissappointing. Internet access is far too expensive. The best thing is the location. You can walk around easily and there are nice bars and restaurants in the area. Would I return...maybe.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding boutique hotel with impecable service”
Reviews.Author: travelmika
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It is only a 10 minute walk to the harbor, etc. The concierge service was impecable. We mailed a package back to the us; however it was not signed for at home and it was mailed back to australia. Due to the incredible service of the concierge, they were able to trace and get it back to us and kept us up to date the entire time. Every restaurant tour they recommended was absolutely perfect. loved it and made our trip to sydney special as it was one of 9 stops as we went around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: annanewzealand
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in sydney. It is in a great location, has really comfortable rooms, a spa area with a beautiful pool that is just spectacular. What really makes the hotel special to me is the staff. They are very attentive and friendly and without exception go out of their way to give great service.. During this stay I was in a spectacular one bedroom suite with a wrap around terrace with lovely views. On my other visits I have had their ordinary rooms, on both sides of the hotel, (street and harbour side) and they were really good value for money. Although if one looks at the location on a map it may seem out of the central area, its just a short walk to the rocks and equally a few blocks to the cbd. The plus is all rooms have opening windows, some have balconies and some terraces. That is a rare find in a city hotel. It is a really classy hotel but very causal and relaxed and an ideal place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Gatsby”
Reviews.Author: Daxidel
Reviews.Content: Highlight: Observatory hotel I am sitting at a redwood desk writing out my thoughts with a pen, something I have not done in more than two decades. On an academicianâ€™s salary, I cannot live a life of quiet luxury, but I can steal it for a day, and I have. My hotel has a roaring 20â€™s decor and looks like it was frequented by the Great Gatsby. My room has curved ceilings and is upholstered in thick multivaried materials. The red, olive and cream drapes line a spectacular full wall view of Sydneyâ€™s bay. I see both boats and birds sailing by, and below are rustic-roofed brick tenements. It is very quiet. And â€“ oh my goodness, there is now a full rainbow in my view! The bed is soft with goose down and the room service coffee is a delicious French roast . I mean to swim in the Observatoryâ€™s famous planetarium pool , but I donâ€™t want to leave my room. [A sidenote: The Observatory was the ONLY hotel to provide an American style â€œpotâ€� of coffee. Everywhere else, I had to order double cappuccinos.] I did finally go to the pool and spa. The steam in the steam-room was heavily scented with lemongrass. The Asian influenced food (vegetable curry, rice soup with shrimp and calamari) at the Observatory was perfect. When asked how spicy I wanted it, I replied â€œAmerican-mediumâ€�, and the server nodded as if this were a perfectly reasonable response. My choice of table, one in front of the window by the piano and antique book-shelves, was reserved for me for the duration of my stay. ps â€“the books were all original editions from the 1800â€™s, but they were too boring to read.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: discerningtraveler11
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the Observatory hotel for a weekend for her birthday and the overall experience was sensational. The hotel does not have the views of the bigger 5 star hotels however what it lacks in views it more than makes up for in service and professionalism. The SPA/health facilities are fantastic and the service is awsome. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone vsiting Sydney. Giev the others a miss and make the Observatory your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Observatory was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dad_loves_golf
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children) just stayed at The Observatory Hotel in Sydney and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is well located in "The Rocks" area of Sydney. The rooms we stayed in were well appointed and spacious. The many hotel staff were consistently nice and helpful at all times of the day and more importantly, very efficient. It was a pleasure to stay at The Observatory. We recommend the hotel to anyone, whether traveling for pleasure or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hen-nyTN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our cozy comfortable and very spacious room in this beautiful old building. Breakfast was delicious and beautifully served. Best of al was the service, especially by the concierge staff, led by Michael Anderson. They were friendly, knowledgeable and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the espresso!”
Reviews.Author: SAGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Observatory hotel in July. I certainly have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to those looking for a very comfortable place to stay in Sydney. The location is convenient and within easy walking distance of the centre of the city and the Rocks. We found the staff to be extremely helpful at all times. The rooms are of a high standard - furnished with antique style furniture and with very large bathrooms. The indoor pool is quite spectacular. Our only concern was with the breakfast provided by the hotel. We arranged a package inclusive of full buffet breakfast each day. On the first morning, I was approached by the waiter and asked if I would like coffee with breakfast. I accepted. After finishing the coffee, I was offered another which I again accepted. It disappointed me that I was given a $14 bill at the end of breakfast (each coffee cost $7!) There was no alternative in terms of self serve coffee. I have stayed at many inferior hotels to the Observatory both in terms of price and overall service around the world and have never found coffee not to be included with a full breakfast. By charging for what is a routine part of breakfast, the hotel does itself a disservice.

Reviews.Title: “Top place to visit”
Reviews.Author: WizardCanberra
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place to stay, within walking distance of The Rocks district and the weekend market, within walking distance to the Queen Victoria bld. and great shopping. It had been recommended to us by good friends who visit top accommodation spots regularly. It was quiet, beautifully appointed in an old world Engish charm way, we had a jnior suite which was really lovely, lots of room, great bathroom and very attentive staff. The breakfast was excellent and apart from the restaurant in the Hotel there were many up market or inexpensive other restaurants in the same street. We had a great time, the staff on the front door and concierge were just lovely - friendly and very helpful - the Head Person on at the Breakfast Restaurant was just charming - and all staff could not be more helpful.. Really good service. I would recommend it to my friends - so I recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service; a real paradise that we will always remember”
Reviews.Author: PaulFinchley
Reviews.Content: Not the best of locations, but the hotel's charm more than makes up for this.... Genuinely pleasant staff welcome you like you are royalty - and everyone deserves that treatment. Unlike other five star hotels The Observatory realises that just because someone may be wearing jeans it doesn't mean they aren't 'worthy' of the same attention as a middle aged business man in a suit. In fact, The Observatory staff probably realise that the person in jeans may just earn more than the business man, or may even be a slightly younger business man on vacation.....either way this is the only hotel I've ever been to where hey treat everyone the same. It's a refreshing change.... The rooms are to die for - pure luxury. We stayed in a junior suite and were suitably impressed at the size of the room (we usualy stay in full suites but this more than matched any we have stayed in for quite some years). The indoor pool is pure relaxation, the restaurant food is bliss.... I could go on but it's important people considering Sydney as a holiday destination be told the truth: this is truly the most luxurious hotel in Australia, do not consider the chains at all - the Shangri La, in particular, isn't a patch on this. You haven't holidayed until you have stayed at The Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, refined hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromBris
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after 2 awful nights in a serviced apartment in McMahons Point. Sydney was busy at the time and it took us a while to find last minute accomodation...a junior suite at the Observatory was pretty much all we could find, and while quite expensive, was worth every penny! The hotel itself is just beautiful with a lovely, calm lobby and a gorgeous ground level bar/cafe with beautiful artwork and lovely, refined service. Our room was quite amazing, very old world, which is such a nice change from the modern hotels and the serivce was spectacular. Our two young boys were allowed to babysit the hotel's pet fish for their stay. They were spoiled by concierge and were sent up beautiful plates of chocolates and gingerbread men, each with their name inscribed in chocolate. Just lovely! The pool is lovely, and just perfect for relaxing. It's an inside pool, but one of the better ones ive seen. Would definitely recommend the hotel, though as its not in the heart of the cbd, and without any neighbouring shoppin areas, you should probably avail yourself of the morning limo that takes you into the city.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid place in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: alkira_roaming
Reviews.Content: It had been several years between visits, but we found The Observatory Hotel as lovely as ever. The service was highly personal and helpful, and our wedding anniversary was very thoughtfully acknowledged. When booking we were worried, as some reviews have suggested that the hotel is 'tired'. This was not our experience at all. It is certainly not a modern design hotel - it is a traditional establishment furnished in tasteful, classic style. The room was fresh with clotted cream carpets and walls, and beds and windows generously swathed with elegant floral prints and silks. Our executive suite featured a pretty dressing table, a deliciously long and deep bath, and l'occitane products. TVs still live in mahogony armoires, rather than the latest flat screen, but there was a bose i-pod docking station. It is very much the kind of room you would find in a fine European hotel, and offers something quite different from other 5 star Sydney hotels. If it is spectacular harbour views that you seek, The Observatory is not for you. We don't mind this at all, as we have visited Sydney many times, and we enjoyed our 'water view' room, looking out the large window, over some of Sydney's oldest houses and a shipping dock, to the ferries and other harbour traffic tootling to and from Darling Harbour, and the Balmain Peninsula. I also think that the streetscape from the rooms along the front of the hotel is quite pleasant - the street is relatively quiet, tree-lined, and a taste of authentic inner-city Sydney life. Actually, it is lovely to stroll around the neighbourhood - The Rocks is Sydney's historic centre, with a jumble of terrace houses, stone pubs, and the nether regions of the city's famous bridge. It is not exactly in the thick of the CBD, but handy enough, and only a short cab ride or leisurely stroll from the city's commercial heart. I have stayed at lots of Sydney hotels, and The Observatory stands out for its charm and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge ever”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTT
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel whilst in a lounge awaiting to fly to Sydney. We asked for a car to collect us but on arrival to Sydney there was not one there. I called and went through 3 people before I got told there was not one coming. I was annoyed as the queue for cabs was long. At the hotel the reception staff were poor to be honest. Did not really get why I was cross or apologise. I wanted to walk out there and then but Michael one of the concierge's came over and took control of the situation and took us to the breakfast room and we had breakfast on the house. The room (Junior suite with water view)was ok. It was not luxurious but clean and comfortable. It is a 5* but quite old. The location is perfect for the Opera house etc and on a quiet road. Michael and his team are top notch. He was so very very helpful in getting us reservations, car hire, directions etc. Ask him for any help. He makes this hotel! We also went up to the Blue mountains to their sister property for lunch. Terrific! Overall, a high standard hotel which is ready to be modernised. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab spa”
Reviews.Author: Karina709
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Observatory for a night before flying home on a very early morning flight and had mixed experiences with the service received!! On checking in around 2pm we were given a smoking room even though a non smoking had been requested and then when we asked to be changed we had to wait about 40 mins in the bar before this was possible even though this meant that a prebooked spa treatment had to be pushed back and the check in area was very quiet. Also, having paid extra and booked a harbour view room I was disappointed with the actual view we had as we overlooked an industrial area which was in front of the harbour and really it wasn't a very attractive view and certainly wasn't worth spending extra money on. Our meal in the Galileo restaurant was pleasant enough as the service was good and the wine selection very extensive, however I was disappointed with the vegetarian selection on the menu. There was only one choice for the vegetarian main course and I found this to be very bland and unappetizing when it arrived. In contrast our breakfast which was booked as part of a romance package was lovely. The night porter was very accommodating with our breakfast selection and russled up a nice selection even though the kitchen was technically still closed as the chef didn't arrive until 6am meaning no croissants or pastries, and the receptionist in the moring was efficient and friendly when we checked out. Finally.....the treatment in the Spa was fab and well worth the expense!! My treatment was professionally administered by a friendly but not over intrusive member of staff, and the lotions and massage left me feeling very pampered and relaxed. It almost made up for some small niggles about other aspects of our stay that in my opinion shouldn't really be there for a hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Computerwhizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently to celebrate our anniversary. I checked various offers & prices on other sites before calling hotel. Although the package I booked was more expensive than what most other 5 star hotels were offering I was convinced after speaking to the hotel that I would not be disappointed in my choice to stay there. I am so glad that we did because it really was "the best". The hotel has a relaxed informality about it compared to some of the big brand names and despite being very busy that weekend they somehow managed to make us feel like we were the only people that mattered. They even knew we were staying for our anniversary at check-in which is something that I must have mentioned when calling. And in our room was a personal welcome card just for the occasion. I really can't remember when I last saw such attention to detail. We felt so very special and that is something you cannot put a price on.

Reviews.Title: “No better Concierges”
Reviews.Author: ernestantonia
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, relaxing, excellent food and service but the two main Concierges took this hotel to top status; nothing was too much trouble. The hotel has no outside seating area (except over the road by the tennis court) and the bar, although luxurious, lacked atmosphere but these are minor quibbles in the overall five-star picture.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gooroux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for New Year, after researching on Tripadvisor and found the service excellent, food on New Years Eve superb and so different from the usual sky scraper, minimalist type hotels you get these days. Concierge very helpful, not only in recommending where to eat but also producing menu's for relevant restaurants. If ever had the opportunity to visit Sydney again the Observatory would be first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pure attentive luxury!”
Reviews.Author: JKSPaloAltoCA
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Observatory for a business trip to Sydney. Initially, I asked for one of the nicer chain hotels I am familiar with. Thank goodness, co-workers in Sydney alterted me to The Observatory. The moment I entered the hotel after our 14+ hour flight, I was taken care of attentively yet without any snobbery. The hotel is lovely, elegant and personal. The work out room/spa was an oasis. However the best part of my stay was the service. Jerome at the front desk took it upon himself to call Verizon in the US to try to help me get my Blackberry to work internationally. Jerome went above and beyond, as did everyone at the Observatory to make my stay just perfect. I can' t wait to come back, maybe even for a vacation with my family. Thanks for a great stay. Julia

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: rags2riches00
Reviews.Content: I've stayed everywhere in Sydney (not to name names but literally everywhere) and The Observatory was one of the very few hotels I have yet to try. So when I found out that another high end client was coming in and I had to make another trip up, I decided to give it ago. When I checked it I was greeted not only by the receptionist but the hotel manager came out to personally welcome me with a hand shake and spent a few minutes with me just before I was taken to my room. This is the first time any GM or HM has ever taken the time out to introduce himself and I was taken back by the attention to detail he and his team has shown. My room was impressive (can't remember the room number but it was a corner room with a nice balcony that gave me both city views and harbor views). It was perfectly sized and beautifully furnished with little note from the GM along with a few sugar coated strawberries at its side. Mind you, it take a hell of a lot to impress me and by this my mouth was getting sore because everywhere I looked it always seemed to drop to the floor. By far the best rooms in Sydney. I wanted to freshen up before my meeting and I was told by the lad who brought my luggage up that their was a spa downstairs so I decided to check it out. I didn't have any spa treatments (although I was tempted) but I did have a sauna and a steam along with a quick dip in their beautiful pool. All in all, very pleased with the spa and the service the spa provide I took my client to their main restaurant, and we were both very pleased. A bit rich in taste but still very good. Again, service was spot on. If you are to experience The Observatory Hotel, make sure you take some time and enjoy your room. In my mind, the best thing about their property. Their spa. restaurants and service are all just added bonuses. I left feeling better than I arrived and I can't wait to come back and do it all over again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: travelmetender
Reviews.Content: Over the past 10 years, I've been lucky enough to travel the world through and through and I always end up coming back to Sydney. Because I'm in love with the city so much, I've had the pleasure to stay in array of different hotels throughout the CBD. My favorite is and forever will be the Hilton however recently I had a chance to stay at The Observatory Hotel and I was extremely impressed with the overall product. What made the Observatory Hotel stand out from the others including the Hilton was the attention to detail. When I arrived and saw my room, I was greeted with a lovely little personalized card from the Hotel Manager along with strawberries which were covered in sugar and chocolate. The room was nice, 5 star without question, however it was the bathroom in which I was most impressed with. Out of all the places I've stayed in the world let alone Sydney, I was grinning from ear to ear when I was the bathroom. Well done! The food was great but yet again it was the service that made the experience wonderful. I wasn't crazy about the eggs benedict and when I told the waiter who served me that it wasn't to my liking he happily replaced it with an more traditional option. The waiter treated me as if I was the only person in the restaurant when in fact the restaurant was nearly completely full. The spa was just the icing on the cake. In my mind, by far the best spa in Australia. I wasn't even in the spa mood when I arrived however after spending 5 minutes checking the place out, I suddenly felt as if I needed a facial. (Funny that) I am a big fan of La Prairie and receive their facials when I stay at the Ritz in Hong Kong so I was happy to see that they too offer their services. Before I had my treatment I went for a quick dip in the pool which is really a spa treatment amongst itself. If you've never been to their spa before, just go to check out the pool. The spa treatment was beautiful and again, it all came down to detail. Nothing was forgotten or left undone and I can honestly say that it was one of the best facials I have ever had. (Thanks Malthi.. sorry if Ive miss spelled your name but you were an angel) Again, my heart loves the Hilton as its served as a home for me for so man years however my soul loves The Observatory Hotel. I'm not due back for until August 08 and I'm seriosuly torn between the two. If I'd had to decided right now, I'd pick the Observatory. Hope you find this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendly Civilised Observatory”
Reviews.Author: nistock
Reviews.Content: There are some hotels which can be recommended, and then there is the Observatory Sydney. I can not adequately express my thanks to the Observatory for rescuing my Antipodean holiday. On day 8 of a 28 day holiday to NZ and OZ I sustained a badly broken left leg going down a mountain too quickly thanks to a defective (non-existent!) brake on a luge in New Zealand. Two days later I arrived in Sydney in a wheelchair, feeling rather sorry for myself, and looking forward to 6 days in Sydney on crutches, or in a wheelchair. My plight was immediately recognised at reception. Although the hotel was full, I was assigned a room close to the lift. That room was spacious and extremely comfortable. In the morning I was allowed to have an excellent breakfast in the bar, rather than the restaurant, as it was closer to the lobby. It was, however, the concierges, who excelled themselves. David and Simon could not have been more friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Indeed they went out of their way to provide a wheelchair, obtain a rental car for a day trip, and when a taxi was needed they insisted that I use the hotel limo gratis. This is a smaller hotel in a great location. Thanks to the staff it is also a great hotel. I have stayed in other 5 star hotels in Sydney. This, unquestionably, is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toabster
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed here at the start of our Honeymoon for 4 nights. Overall we found the accommodation, staff, facilities and location to be excellent. Upon an early arrival at the hotel, they were able to allocate us an upgraded room, several hours before our due check-in time. We made use of the spa, restaurant and bar, as well as taking advantage of the expertise of the concierge, as recommended by a previous review, during our stay and were more than happy with all of these aspects of the hotel. The rooms are of a good size with excellent bathrooms. We were not able to detect any need for improvement in the decoration of our room as some previous reviews have noted and can only assume that they were unfortunate in their experiences. The bed was extremely comfortable, and we especially appreciated that each night the bed was turned down, and cold bottles of water were left on each bed-side table with clean glasses. A nice touch. Additional nice touches came in the form of a welcome plate of fruit and a note from the hotel manager wishing us a pleasant stay on our honeymoon. The location of the hotel is great for access to both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay, both about a 5 minute walk away. Whilst breakfast was by no means a cheap affair, the overall value of the hotel that we experienced was high and we would certainly stay here on our next visit and would happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a boutique style, well located hotel in Sydney with excellent customer service levels.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: prah001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Observatory Hotel (Kent Street) on 16th December 2007 for our one year wedding anniversary.
