Although we have stayed at other hotels in Europe (5*) but we were very impressed by The Observatory Hotel and we think it was the best service and facilities we have seen. Our stay was very enjoyable and comfortable. We mainly liked the personal touches that the hotel provided. The staff in the restaurant and particularly the bar were wonderful, we also used the day spa facilities and the level of professionalism was second to none. Thank you for the great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation in some sections, Also Theft an Issue”
Reviews.Author: DublinGemologist
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler. You would be hard pressed to find someone who has stayed in more properties around the world. This is stated simply as a reference. I have stayed at this hotel in the past. The decor has never changed. It's overdue. It is obvious that some rooms have been redecorated and some have not. Additionally, there was a roach in the room (I personally took care of it). The staff is terrific, friendly, etc. We chose to pay our bill (Over US$3,000.) with travelers checks. The front desk clerks were Really put out by the inconvenience this created compared to a Credit Card transaction. We did have a theft issue while storing bags with the concierge. We were discouraged from reporting it to the police by the management. We did it anyway. It is our opinion that someone, with access to the luggage storage room, went through our luggage with the thought that we would only be stopping by to pick up our luggage after travelling through the outback, instead we stayed an additional night. This led to our discovery of the items stolen from our bags while stored at the hotel. We would be happy to provide the Police report # as it is public record to confirm this problem. The most discouraging issue regarding the theft was the inability of the staff to acknowledge they have a security issue. ("We have only the most trusted and dedicated staff members", we kept hearing over and over----no apologies) We spent our last day in Sydney worrying about getting the police report completed. Although we have half a day to spend sightseeing around Sydney, we chose to go to the airport because----who would we entrust our luggage to? Not this hotel. We will vote with our wallet next time and choose to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: sour_dour
Reviews.Content: We have travelled world wide a number of times and this is the best Hotel we have ever stayed in. The service is exemplary, everyone from Valet parking through to dinner service and checkin/out were fantastic. The decor is divine; pure luxury and the Day Spa is pure indulgence. I especially loved the piped music in the bathroom. Dinner at Gallileo's (Observatory Hotel restuarant) was amazing. Our sommelier gave us exceptional wine service during dinner. A lot of trouble was taken to explain the various wines and he obviously had in- depth knowledge of all the wines. He even went to the trouble of writing down the name of one of the French wines I took a particular fancy to and where I could purchase it from. He clearly does his homework and his dialogue was one of expertise rather than just 'marketing'. It is so refreshing to have such top service without the quick-sell mentality for a change. Our waitresses that evening were both highly informative with the food service and again their product knowledge was outstanding. We felt at ease and as though none of our queries were too much for the staff. The cooked breakfast was the best we have had anywhere. I am coming back for the Hollandaise sauce alone!! We will be back again next year and look forward to re-living the wonderful experience all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Smiles58
Reviews.Content: We started a 3 week trip with 3 nights here. I had high expectations, but this hotel exceeded them. We have stayed at some of the best city hotels in the world - Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong, Raffles Singapore, Copacabana Palace Rio, etc. This was small but beautifully decorated and extremely personal. Service was outstanding from everyone. Yuhi, the night manager greeted us early in the morning as we arrived and showed us to the room with lots of recommendations. The room was great and the views of the harbour weren't the best, but we didn't expect to see the big sights from where this hotel is. The breakfast was splendid, and served with real style. We didn't have dinner in the hotel due to the choice in Sydney, but the restaurant is worth a try on a longer trip. The pool is the best indoor city hotel pool we've ever seen. Very relaxing with the starry ceiling. Make the most of Michael, the senior concierge. He was so helpful, booked us the best table at Cafe Sydney (you must go for the food and the view), and was full of thoughtful suggestions which made a big difference to our trip. Close to the Rocks (5 mins walk), but slightly off the busy beaten track, this hotel is a great choice. It's also close enough to walk to the bars and restaurants in Darling Harbour and King Street Wharf, so a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip around Australia back in April 2005. I've been meaning to review it ever since - it remains one of my favorite hotel experiences of all times. I'm not usually someone who cares very much about service, and I also tend to like more modern (hip? artsy?) hotels. But everything about the Observatory was perfect. The staff knew who you were, but weren't obtrusive in any way. The room was beautiful, the location excellent... all in all, the epitome of a 5* experience!

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely exceptional”
Reviews.Author: wipeout75
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and it was just as good as we remembered. Obviously a brilliant location and service was understated efficiency at its best. Make use of the concierge - I think they are the best Ive ever used anywhere. Superb Spa. Cracking rooms - super comfy beds (huge) and amazing bathrooms. Not really sure what else they can do to make it any better! Brilliant - and justifiably expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Observatory”
Reviews.Author: SydneyConcertGoer
Reviews.Content: I booked a city-view room at the Observatory hotel after weeks of weighing up the pros and cons of various nice hotels around Sydney, reading reviews, checking prices, etc. As it was a special occasion, I wanted to find a hotel that could pretty much guarantee a perfect stay, so my expectations were fairly high. The Observatory allows small pets in some of its rooms, so I initially got in contact with them via email to see if there are any rooms that have not had animals in them, due to allergies. Luckily only select rooms are pet-friendly, so this was fine. The customer service via email was so good (the girl was very helpful and friendly) that I ended up booking a room this way. As my budget was low, I could only afford the cheapest room - a city-view room - and breakfast (valued at $45 per person) at the restaurant was included for no extra charge, which was great. Booking the lowest-priced room, I expected that it would be pretty small, but the photos on the site looked very nice, and it's sort of old-fashioned, and just a bit prettier than some of the more modern hotels. To my surprise, the room was actually very large. By "city-view", it's more a view across the street of houses, but this was quite nice, and the street wasn't at all busy. Being able to open a window (in addition to air-condioning, of course) is a bit of a novelty after staying in high-rise hotels. The bathroom was fairly large as well, and as beautiful as the rest of our room. The staff were extremely efficient, polite, welcoming and professional at all times, and we were even taken to our room by a staff member. Despite my high expectations, the Observatory Hotel and its staff managed to exceed these expectations. The strawberries waiting for us in our room were unexpected and a nice touch. We thought the batteries in the remote-control for the television might have been flat, and within moments of us giving them a call, they were at our door with replacements (turns out we were just having trouble figuring out how to use it!). Breakfast in the restaurant the following morning was very impressive. The staff were great, and the food was fantastic. The general atmosphere was sophisticated, yet almost old-fashioned in the best possible way. We were really treated like royalty! Check-out was as quick and easy as check-in, and staff didn't neglect to ask if we needed any help with bags, taxis, etc. All in all it was as perfect a stay, and as far as five-star hotels in its price-range go, I doubt that there could be anything better in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “5 star? Yeah Right.”
Reviews.Author: Pab_G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Observatory Hotel in Sydney with my fiance in Feb of this year. We booked a romantic weekend getaway. First off, reception couldnt find our booking and were not apologetic for having us wait 20 minutes until they found it. They then told us the room wasn't ready, even though we were checking in 3 hours after check in time. We had to wait a further 40 minutes to get into our room. We were not offered any refreshments while we waited and when we finally got to our room, our luggage wasnt even there yet! We thought that would be the last of our problems! It wasnt! We ordered room service which didn't arrive for an hour which would have been fine if the order wasn't cold and, alas, wrong. Throughout our stay, staff did NOT make us feel welcome and also stuffed up a request from my fiance. He ordered chocolates and flowers to the room for 8pm the Saturday evening. By 9pm they still hasnt arrived so when he asked staff about it, they had no clue and could only organise a plate of strawberries - three of them and 2 were old. Upon leaving, there were several problems with the bill and check out took over 15 minutes. A few days after arriving home, we received a late charge of $120AUD for the minibar which we did not consume. The hotels manager tried to tell us that we had when in fact it was his staff's incompetance. I wouldnt bother with this "5 star" dump. Try the Intercon Sydney instead if you want a slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “The Observatory is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: amkaplan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The rooms were amongst the nicest we have ever stayed in. It is very luxurious. The staff at the hotel was excellent, friendly and very knowledgeable. Room service was very fast and the food wonderful. The indoor pool is amazing. The location is a bit out of the way if you want to walk around downtown Sydney. We had a wonderful experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Best we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: PNPathman
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem of a hotel. We've stayed in many hotels, in many countries, and this has got to be the best yet, and we only had a "basic" room. The room was superb and very roomy with huge bed TV cabinet, desk, table for two and lounge chair with ottoman. Our room faced the street but noise was not a problem. Bathroom was lovely and the whole room immaculate. What made the hotel particularly special was the staff and the attention to detail. A lot of thought had gone into making our stay enjoyable. All the staff were extraordinary in their approach. We had one meal at the hotel and this was a lovely 7 course degustation amply complemented by wine selected with the help of an excellent sommelier. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “very nice, neighborhood location”
Reviews.Author: lilirishstar
Reviews.Content: The Observatory Hotel is an Oriental Express property and it truly does have the highest attention to detail I have ever witnessed. The personal service was outstanding. They provided everything we asked for and more (although I guess they don't use curling irons in Sydney as they could not come up with one of those) Being only a couple of stories high there was a very small amount of street noise coming in. It is indeed located near Sydney's historic Rocks district, although somewhat off the beaten path. It is locating in a little neighborhood with a view of a working port. We made the walk to Circular Quay many times which was not bad at all. It's coming back up that hill at the end of a long day that gets you. In conclusion, if you are looking to be pampered in a luxurious accommodation, and you want to dine and shop in the Rocks, this is your place. If you plan on using the ferry a lot, spending a lot of time at the Opera house and Botanical Gardens, then stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay--with one dining caveat”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently visited Australia for almost 3 weeks; we began and ended our time there in Sydney and stayed at the Observatory Hotel. (For comparison purposes, we also stayed at the Empire Retreat in the Margaret River area, the Park Hyatt in Melbourne, and Lizard Island.) As frequent world travelers for both business and pleasure, and as travelers who often stay at Four Seasons level hotels and boutique properties, we must say that the Observatory most often lived up to its reputation as a world-class hotel Our iniitial and most significant visit was for 3 nights in a Water View Executive Suite (A$624). We arrived very early on a Friday morning from the USA, and were delighted that our suite was available at such an early hour (possibly helped by the fact that we visited out of season). The suite was spacious, 2 large slightly oval shaped rooms with an adjoining spacious hallway between them with a nicely-sized bathroom. It was certainly well-appointed in a more traditional European fashion as expected. Our water view looked out onto the harbour--not the opera house or bridge view, but onto another section of the harbour with a more working port view. We knew that, already. Still, we enjoyed the view. (My partner is an engineer, and was fascinated watching the ships load and unload). Also, as someone who requires it to be quite cool to sleep, the room easily cooled to the chilly 16-17 degrees C (or 58-60 degrees F) that I need. Service at the hotel was flawless, and our breakfasts were absolutely charming. The server, whose name I cannot recall, was wonderful. He remembered our orders and preferences after our first breakfast--to our immense surprise. Service does take a bit longer than Americans are accustomed to experiencing, but that isn't unusual in more European settings, of course. The hotel is located in a very pleasant residential area not far from the tourist center. It was a very simple 10 minute walk to the Rocks area where the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge are located. I must confess surprise at how close they were, as I'd read so many complaints about the fact that the Observatory isn't well located. We liked being a little bit out of the way while needing only a short walk to get to the center of things. If you prefer to be in the heart of things, perhaps the Observatory isn't for you. However, we did stop by the Park Hyatt since we had also considered that property. Thankfully, we chose the Observatory. Though the Park Hyatt is certainly a nice hotel, it is quite ugly from the outside. Its interior is a contemporary sleekness, though a bit manufactured for our tastes (which also turned out to be true for the Park Hyatt in Melbourne). Service seemed nice at the Park Hyatt, as someone was more than willing to show us an Opera House View Deluxe Room there. We were unimpressed. It was a spacious single room looking directly onto the Opera House--but it cost significantly more (A$950) than our 2 room far-more spacious suite at the Observatory--not to mention the fact that any 1st floor level hotel rooms look out immediately onto a public walk area, giving you very little privacy. Personally, I had enough view of the Opera House from just hanging out at the Rocks area a few times! In any case, we were thrilled that we had chosen the Observatory and that we would be returning after the rest of our Australian adventure...for one night before returning to the USA. Our second stay for just the single night was a refreshing return. We again had a Water View Executive Suite (A$724), a little more expensive this time for reasons we were never sure about, but so it goes--besides, we only had it for one night this time around. It was a diffrerent configuration, with a squarish living room and a short hallway with bathroom connecting to the squarish bedroom. It also offered the same harbour view as before. We must say we preferred the original configuration, but this one did offer a small balcony off the bedroom. Your choice, I suppose, as to which you might prefer. The first was more spacious, but the second offered a balcony onto the harbour view. This room took a little more time to cool down to my liking, but it did eventually get cold, fortunately. The only caveat we had with either of our stays was dinner on our last evening during our second stay. We had arranged to have dinner at the hotel restaurant, Galileo, with 5 of our friends in Sydney for our last night. Since we arrived on a later flight from Lizard Island and Cairns, we had a reservation for 7 people at 9:30 pm. Upon being seated, the server informed us that we needed to hurry because the kitchen was closing at 10 pm. This was quite irritating, since we definitely like to dine--and dinner was a prefixe cost that was quite substantial (A$130 per person, if I recall correctly, for 3 courses). No one warned us when we made the reservation that the kitchen closed at 10, nor do I believe that should matter. If a restaurant takes a reservation, especially for its own guests, then it should honor that and give us the same culinary and service experience, period. Unfortunately, in this case, the courses felt quite rushed, and we suspect that the meal quality suffered as a result. None of our meals really were that great, and for such a hefty pricetag we all were quite disappointed. At the end, the server almost threw a fit because we wanted to split the check between 4 credit cards. Not exactly the service on which the hotel or restaurant's reputation are to be based, I expect. Still, my partner and I will gladly return to the Observatory Hotel. We recommend it highly, though we are not so enthusiastic about their restaurant for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing start”
Reviews.Author: LikesALittleLuxury
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Observatory Hotel in Sydney for 2 nights. We booked well in advance and also spent quite a bit on spa treatments. Once checked in, we were really disappointed to find food stains all over the carpet. After trying to decide whether or not it was appropriate to complain we concluded that considering the amount of money we were paying it wasn't good enough. First reception sent up a cleaner, armed with carpet cleaner, to fix the problem (with us still in the room). He took one look and decided it would be easier for us to shift and later have the carpets steam cleaned. So, after some wait and several more phone calls, we were moved to a smaller, older room on a lower level floor (first floor, much louder and no security set-up in the lift as with the other levels). We had also paid for a water view, so the lower level wasn't as good in this regard either. When we entered, there was a dirty food plate on the table and the ironing board was left out and set-up for use. It was obvious the room hadn't been properly cleaned after the last guest! After several more phone calls we were moved AGAIN. This time same level, different up-graded room with a bottle of champagne waiting for us. All up I think we had spend close to 1 hour being moved around so as nice as the champagne was we had still wasted time and were late for a dinner date. I am also 7 1/2 months pregnant so the champagne wasn't much use. On a positive note, the hotel restaurant is very keen to please and will cook you just about anything on request. The staff were also very nice and helpful through-out the whole hotel and besides our carpet everything is very clean and beautiful. Our only other complaint was in regards to the parking arrangements. We had a hire car and were told upon arrival that it would be parked for us BUT no-one told us that this would cost $40 and another $40 everytime we wanted to use it. There is no other option besides don't bring a car. I am sure there might be 100 other better options in Sydney if you are prepared to spend this kind of money but I would probably give the Observatory another shot next time. I just hope we weren't mucked around because we didn't look quite the part (a bit hard after travel and pregnancy). Maybe not...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wannabetravellerliz
Reviews.Content: Quote from letter to manager of the hotel: I've now just returned to the UK but would like to thank you and your staff. I had a wonderful trip to New Zealand and Australia, and my visit to the Observatory certainly stands out as a highlight. The hotel is so superbly located but at the same time away from the main area of hotels and thus feels much more of a "home". It was a pleasure to come back to at the end of each day - I was usually very weary and footsore from sightseeing! I would also like to compliment all your staff but in particular Simon the concierge who was so helpful to me in sorting out arrangements that I had made for a tour which didn't actually take place! I also loved the swimming pool! I am a regular swimmer and used most of the hotel pools on my 6 week trip, but yours really was by far the best - an absolute delight

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: howardgraham
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful presentation of this superb hotel. staff rooms facilities were all great. the position is just 10 min walk from the centre of town or the harbour and nothing is to much trouble for the very profeesional staff. we loved it

Reviews.Title: “A Faultless Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: misshelen
Reviews.Content: If you crave the slimline, high design anonymity of a corporate 5 star, don't bother with this place. However, if you're looking for a timeless haven staffed entirely by personable, but not familiar, people who seem to delight in recalling your name, your coffee preference and the kind of day you had, don't bother with anywhere else. It reminded me of nothing so much, in terms of service and impeccable taste, as the Halekulani in Waikiki. Staff will engage as much or as little as you wish and an overall service ethic seems designed to calculate your needs even before you have identified them. "You need an invigorating juice this morning," said the breakfast Maitre D. He was perfectly right. Unlike many hotel restaurants, Galileo actually delivers intriguing, fresh fusion cuisine with a genuine emphasis on fresh produce. The pool is heaven. Even for an habitually picky traveller, there was nothing to merit complaint in this mecca of subtly hued luxury. If I'm to complain about anythig it is simply that a world outside of The Observatory exists at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - for Certain Travelers”
Reviews.Author: ObservantGuest
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly a great hotel, but there are some issues to consider before booking. We stayed for four nights just before Christmas, for a strictly tourist visit. We received extremely professional and friendly service. When the business center computer was in use, the concierge set up a laptop. The breakfast staff was especially friendly and efficient despite the many guests at this time. Quality and variety of food at breakfast was also excellent. This hotel avoided the overly huge and opulent lobby of most hotels - and put the money into nice rooms instead. The bedroom and bathroom are both large, with all modern amenities. Separate shower and bathtub was nice. We especially loved the indoor pool and spa area - for us a real plus. The light jazz music in the friendly bar was perfect after returning from a night out. Here are things to consider: I had trouble changing my online reservation, so I called and received very friendly service from the reservation clerk - and AUD$20 per day lower price than the online booking offered for the exact same room. The waterview rooms are indeed waterview, but over some industrial docks. If you're looking for the iconic view of Sydney Opera House from your room, this hotel does not have it. The walk to "The Rocks" tourist area is 10-15 minutes - not bad if you're only doing it once or twice, but if you want to visit there many times. . . . All in all, a great hotel, but at this price, some of these things - most related to location - may make you think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Second class treatment”
Reviews.Author: jen16m
Reviews.Content: While The Observatory is an impressive property, the level of service falls far below the standard of the amenities. After reading the hotel website's claims about its superior standards, we booked an internet weekend package on another website to celebrate our wedding anniversary. After making advance arrangements for babysitting and all the other logistics that come with a weekend away once children arrive, we arrived shortly after check-in to be told that there were no double rooms, as described on the website. Instead, we were being "upgraded" to a room with two King singles. We politely declined the upgrade pointing out that it was our wedding anniversary and we would prefer a double bed. Reception told us that there was nothing they could do, as the hotel reserved the right to reallocate rooms booked over the internet. There was no attempt at service recovery - not even an offer to make up the singles as a double - and to add insult to injury, the platter of strawberries which made up part of the internet "deal" never arrived. We made the best of our stay but didn't witness any of the superior service or attention to guests' needs which the hotel's publicity promised. All in all, a disappointing stay - clearly those who book over the internet are second-class citizens at The Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel We've Been To”
Reviews.Author: rachelnycsyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Observatory for 6 nights over two weeks (it was our home base as we travelled throughout Australia and NZ). The hotel is stunning, the service is warm and helpful and the location - even though slightly off the beat and path was perfect for us. We arranged our restaurant reservations with the concierge via email from the U.S. They were there to hold our bags and to make sure everything was perfect. As we got back to Sydney from our other destinations - we looked forward to coming back to the Observatory as they made it feel like home. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Engagement”
Reviews.Author: djr76
Reviews.Content: My husband proposed to me at this beautiful hotel last year. The entire staff was absolutely wonderful, accommodating and truly excited for us during our stay. The room was beautiful; we stayed in a suite overlooking the water and enjoyed amazing sunsets from our balcony. The bathroom was large and luxurious and the canopy bed was very comfortable. We had breakfast in the lobby restaurant every morning which was large and delicious. My favorites were the excellent banana bread and every juice you could possibly imagine. We also had the chance to enjoy the spa. The ceiling of the indoor pool is made to look like a night sky and was a wonderful place to relax. I can't wait to go back some day to celebrate our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scarletchez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Observatory on the first leg of our honeymoon in Australia. We couldn't have been more impressed with the service and welcome that we received. The Concierge was more than helpful whenever we needed him. Had some great excursions while we were in Sydney, including climbing the bridge and visiting the Blue Mountains. We ate in the hotel restaurant - expensive, but a fabulous meal and had full room service one night. The only down side was we arrived on a very early flight from Singapore and had to wait for a hour or so for our room to be ready - but that is all I can say bad - and they looked after us whilst we waited.

Reviews.Title: “A London Style Hotel in a wonderful location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lizzydoc
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 4 days, November 8, 2006. The location is in a British-Australian colonial neighborhood of wrought ironed terrace houses and historic pubs and hotels, an exact 10 minute walk to the "rocks" area of shops, ferries and restaurants, and another 10 minutes to the steps of the magnificent opera house. It is a miracle that this charming neighborhood has survived the rampant development of Sydney.The rooms were large, bathrooms also large with showers with "rain shower" heads as well as needle point. The Spa was wonderful, and the swimming pool and jacuzzi area like Hearst Castle. complete with a starry ceiling of twinkling lights. The management and staff are excellent, and helpful, without being patronizing. The only down side why I would give it 4 and one half circles instead of 5, is that smoking is allowed at the far side of the lobby, but the smell permeates into the beautiful antique book library and restaurant area. They should give the smokers their own room with a door, insulating the smoking smell from the rest of the public areas. With that said, it would be te only hotel that we would stay in Sydney. If you get a city view room facing the street, the noise was not a problem. Get a room with a French door, where you can open it, look at the leafy view of the houses and feel the warmth of the air and sun while eating porridge.

Reviews.Title: “somewhere special”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAussie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Observatory Hotel in Sydney. We wanted somewhere special to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Including the staff in Galilleo Restaurant. When we arrived at our room late in the afternoon we were pleasantly surprised to see the management had arranged for a bowl of delicious strawberries and another plate with Happy Anniversary written on it in chocolate with delicious petit fours and a lovely card wishing us a Happy Anniversary. We have stayed at other hotels in Sydney before for various special occasions and have never had any special attention. The room as was the hotel is beautifully decorated and once you pass through the front door it's like entering another world. The attention to detail makes this hotel a cut above the rest in Sydney and one you would definitely want to return to. We didn't get to use the pool on this occasion but did go and have a quick look and it's everything we expected. Yes I would have to agree with other reviews we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Observatory Hotel in The Rocks was first class”
Reviews.Author: mastertkd
Reviews.Content: Hotel was first class! We booked in for our 17th wedding anniversary and casually mentioned it at check in. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into our room that the reception manager had arranged for strawberries and a selection of small cakes with a Happy Anniversary in chocolate on the platter for us. Most Impressed! Room was great and absolutely no complaints about service. The hotel was in easy walking distance from the rocks and circular quay. All round great stay:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Observatory!”
Reviews.Author: Markandlindsey
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault our stay at the Observatory hotel - and we would have to say that this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The rooms are fantastic and we couldn't think of anything that they didn't have which you would need.The beds are so comfortable that you simply wont want to get out of bed in the morning! The room service/housekeeping are excellent and if you ever call for anything it arrives within minutes. The concierge desk (particularly David and Michael) were excellent with dinner bookings and even getting my boots re-heeled twice at short notice. You can't put a value on service as good as this and it makes your holiday go a lot smoother. We didn't try the restaurant as there didn't seem to be many vegetarian options but i am sure that if we had asked they could have done something for us - our friends that live in the area have told us that it is very good. The breakfast which we had was good and even came with its own toaster - which was good as it meant your toast was hot when you wanted it rather than the normal room service breakfast when the toast turns up cold. My husband used the pool downstairs and said that the facilities were excellent. The choice of spa treatments available was also extensive. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and wouldn't hesitiate to recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: benbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the observatory hotel in april 2005 as a single traveller. The staff were extremely helpful, my room was available to me when I arrived from London in the early morning. The room was very comfortable and spotless, food was very good as were the spa facilities. I was so impressedwith the hotel I revisited in october and november 2005 with one of my daughters and booked my other daughter in to stay after a buisness trip. I plan to stay at the hotel on areturn trip in 2007

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, off-the-beaten-track”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: Sydney is a heart-stoppingly beautiful city, with its sweeping harbor, temperate climate, and iconic Opera House. The Observatory Hotel is gracious, reserved, and boasts efficacious, courteous service. Our room was handsomely appointed, even if its fussy antiques, beige walls and floral lamps were more reminiscent of Grandmother's taste than our own. Cutting edge it ain't; but it has admirable, old world flair. Our room service waiter Adam was especially cordial and amusing, dropping useful sightseeing tips in a disarming, unobtrusive fashion. The food at the hotel's restaurant Galileo was indicative of Sydney's rising star on the gastronomy scene; truly scrumptious. On the whole, our stay was a gratifying success. But the hotel's location was a bit of a drawback; it's about a fifteen minute work from Circular Quay and the Harbor; and as we passed some of the behemoth hotels with more desirable addresses--like the Four Seasons and the Shangri-La--I couldn't help but wonder if they'd afford better views, and accessibility to the major attractions. (And I'm sure it would be easier to wrangle cabs at either of these rival hotels; some nights, it took almost twenty minutes, in spite of the valiant efforts of our very attentive doorman.) That said--for people who prefer classy, boutique hotels to the corporate chains (however luxe), the Observatory is an elegant option.

Reviews.Title: “service slower than public transport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five star prices and 1 star service. We ate at their restaurant, choosing a 7 course degustation. We had to wait over 20 minutes for each course to arrive. Even the coffee took this long. No attempt was made to improve this when I commented on it half-way through our 3 1/2 hour ordeal. Their excuse was that they were busy as they were fully booked. This is not an acceptable reason. And honestly, the food was nothing worth waiting for anyway. I have since spoken to someone else who had the same experience there. I did politely put my feedback in a letter to them but have not received a reply. My conclusion - they do not give one iota about their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “great service, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this smallish, but charming hotel for 7 nights in total on our recent trip to Australia. The hotel's address is a little misleading, you are a brisk 10 minute walk from the area tourists really call "the Rocks", but don't let that put you off - we found that the location was nice and quiet and gave you good access to another area of interest, - Kings Wharf which is just 15 mins walk in the opposite direction to the Rocks. Also don't be misled by the offer of rooms with "Harbour views" - the harbour in question is Darling Harbour - so you won't get the classic Bridge and Opera House view of Sydney Harbour! All that said this is a very nice hotel - we stayed in junior suites (City view - which means a view over Kent Street and the Observatory Hill opposite the hotel). The rooms (large bedrooms with dining table and chairs and lounge type areas) were very nicely appointed with all the amenities you'd expect from a top class hotel. Room service food and breakfast were both very good, but the International / Japanese fusion menu in the main restaurant was not to our taste and we only dined in one evening. The spa is nice, treatments are well priced and a good standard. The hotel service is excellent - staff were always very helpful with nothing too much trouble . Our stay was split into a 5 night stay followed by 2 nights a week later - the hotel held the bulk of our luggage, provided some services like laundry and dry cleaning while we were away and welcomed us back like old friends - they really were very nice people! I would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to people who don't mind paying a bit extra for good service and perhaps prefer peace and quiet and don't really want to be in the heart of the all the downtown Sydney action!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing visit at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozmouse
Reviews.Content: We were able to spend 4 nights at the Observatory over the Anzac long weekend. Everything met my VERY high expectations for this hotel. (had heard so much about it...). Staff were very congenial and professional. Room was more than comfortable and very much above any ordinary hotel room with furnishings, lighting and amenities. Bathroom was very luxurious. We were on the third story facing the street. Really enjoyed the balcony in the mornings, as the street is quiet and the sun plentiful (loved the padded outdoor teak furniture. or more to the point how much I had the plastic/metal options usually at hand.) Also in the evening, we enjoyed watching the fruit bats glide along the length of the street, (below our balcony) into the trees. It was so unique to be in the centre of Sydney, in a hotel with windows that opened, located in a quiet street, 5 min walk from the quay. This was a new experience for Sydney and the Rocks for me. While we did not book spa treatments, we attended the pool/gym daily. I too found the staff less than helpful. Indeed the foyer of the spa area, just off the elevator, is one part of the hotel that is compromised - very small/crowded. But the pool, saunas and spa were all very much above average. Gym small but very well equipped. We did not eat at the restaurant (as we had a long list of other destinations), but did enjoy drinks in the bar. Very comfortable surroundings. It was nice to find a small luxury hotel, with many unique features in the centre of town. No more high-rise modern towers for me! I enjoyed my stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Restful Observatory”
Reviews.Author: Travelhobbyist
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our hotel very much. This was our first visit to Sydney and the Observatory Hotel. We found the hotel staff to be very helpful from the time we booked our trip though our departure. We arrived totally exhausted and the hotel managed to fit us in with early arrival. The room was well appointed. The beds were comfortable and we especially liked the little balcony with the ability to open the window to get fresh air. The restaurant provided a wonderful breakfast and a nice place to lounge later in the day. This hotel has an amazing collection of books about fishing, natural studies and sailing. The inside pool is one of the best ever -- and well kept - amazing design. If you like to swim and want to see something special -- then this hotel - is it. The desk staff at the spa were a different story. They were not helpful or inviting or even polite. It seemed an imposition to interrupt their personal chatter to have them answer simple questions. - such as "How do I get to the changing room?" Do you have towels?" Having visited many spas I found this service very disconcerting and unprofessional. Hopefully by my next visit they will have straighted this out and trained the spa desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & Romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first for our wedding anniversary, We found this place perfect with a great spa rooms wonderful, we had an executive suite with water views and a wonderful Juliet Balcony. The resturant was great and all service impeccable. I have stayed at many hotels in Sydney with views of the Habour Bridge and Opera House but if this is not what you are looking for the Observatory out does them all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: favioladg31
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews the hotel was wonderful. The staff were so attentive. We arrived before the check in time so they took our luggage and offered their spa service for us to refreshen. The airline lost one of our bags so they let us know where to get some clothes for the day. Our room had a city view. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was great, the tub was a treat specially after all the walking. The hotel is close to the Rocks area and about 10-20 minutes walking distance from Pitt Street shopping arcades and darling harbour. Every night they will come in and turn our bed, put bottle water in each nighstand and the slippers right next to the bed. The breakfast was delicious with a good variety of fruits, meat and cereal. The buttermilk panckaes were delicious. The staff called us to find out our departing time and they schedule transport to and from the airport. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A home from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Observatory before, ten years ago, and this time enjoyed it just as much. The staff are intelligent and friendly without being obsequious, leaving you alone but being aware if you need them. No request is a surprise and all are happy to help find an answer. The Galileo restaurant is very good and is booked well in advance. The Spa services are also in high demand and need booking. Local walks and plentiful restaurants abound nearby. We needed peace and quiet after moving house and it was a perfect venue for rest and recuperation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What more can one say. My wife and I stayed on the Name a Star package on our 18th anniversary and I tell you from the fantastic meal in Galileo to the unique naming of a Star for my wife to the room and Pool and massage, we had a stay that will be with us for the rest of our lives - we will most certainly shout out the praises of this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High Tea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I attended the advertised high tea with 6 friends, it was celebrating my daughter's birthday. The staff at the front desk were very friendly however, the head waiter was very unfriendly, never smiled once, made our group feel unwelcome as if we were beneath the establishment. There was no explanation of the teas available, we were served well after later arrivals and had to try and get his attention to have a top up of tea as only one 5 cup teapot was served. The surroundings were very very pleasant but spoiled by the head waiter's attitude. If this was a taste of what the rest of the hotel was like I will certainly not recommend high tea or the hotel to anyone. Very very disappointed in the service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Observatory”
Reviews.Author: Vixen
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Lovely rooms, nice bar, and good location - close to everything but quiet too. We loved it - the Concierge was especially good. Would definately recommend it - we also stayed at the Four Seasons in Sydney - the Observatory is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Hype but still pleasant”
Reviews.Author: The_Hotel_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to catch up with an old mate and share some really special Scotch I had bought back from the last trip to the UK. As I wanted to have a really great weekend I decided to get a hotel room that would complement the rare Scotch I was going to crack open and, having looked at the recommendations of TripAdvisor and Conde Naste it looked like The Observatory was the top pick in Sydney. Looking at their website I found a great sounding â€œTo Dine Forâ€� package which consisted of a overnight stay in a Executive Suite room, a eight course degustation dinner at Galileoâ€™s for two, cocktails for two at the Globe Bar, and a Buffet Breakfast for two in Galileoâ€™s. While a little on the expensive side at $945, it nevertheless sounded like a good weekend away so I booked it. We both ended up arriving early at the hotel (about 1310 hrs â€“ check-in is at 1500 hrs). I wasnâ€™t met at the car when I pulled up but when I presented at the Conciergeâ€™s desk I was quickly attended and was able to hand off my car keys in less than a minute, and the bellman even checked back with me to see if I wanted my dry-cleaning hanging in the back of the car brought it as well (I had forgot to mention it). Reception staff were very professional and pleasant as well and advised us that while the room wouldn't be available until 1500 we were more than welcome to make use of the Day Spa downstairs. She even checked in two additional bags on the spot and escorted us to the elevator to send us on our way to the Day Spa. The Day Spa was small but nice with separate steam and sauna rooms for males and females (which is a welcome European touch) and I noted that the change room even included razors, shaving cream and mouthwash supplies to use. One minor lapse was that although the receptionist asked if we had our swimming trunks with us (we hadnâ€™t, as mine was in my bag upstairs) we werenâ€™t offered the guest loan swimwear that they have on hand for just such occasions (I didnâ€™t know about this I until I asked reception about where my mate could buy a pair of togs from so we could go for a swim a little later in the day). While the steam room was quite nice it would have been good to break up the couple of hours we spent in there with a swim in the pool. We went up to check-in at about 1510 to check in but our room was still not ready and it wasnâ€™t until about 1540 that we were able to go up to our suite on the third floor. When we did get to the room one odd thing I noted was that housekeeping had left a broken castor wheel on the bed for some unknown reason. The second thing I noticed was that the suite only had one King bed and not two beds like the photo of the room on the website had (although this is my fault for not checking). Not being that friendly with my mate I rang back down and asked to be relocated to another suite with two beds which, to the credit of the hotel, they arranged in less than 20 minutes (as they had to change the bed in another room). While we were waiting for our new room to be ready my mate and I noted with amusement that the walls werenâ€™t very soundproofed on the third floor as the noise of the very energetic couple next door broke through into our conversation. We moved down to the first floor into the Executive Suite named Ibis (all the Executive Suites are named after carriages on the Orient Express) which I actually liked better (as the layout of the rooms was in a Y shape with the bathroom off the hallway and not off the bedroom) but my mate thought that the furnishings were better on the third floor (although I canâ€™t say I noticed much of a difference). The Suite had a great bathroom with a really deep bath tub (which we didnâ€™t use although if I had the time Iâ€™m sure would have been great) and a great rainfall shower with single separate large massage jet shower head that could be turned on in conjunction with the rainfall shower (which is a good touch and is probably the best shower Iâ€™ve been in â€“ and that is against some stiff competition). The bathroom was tops. The bedroom and lounge were pleasant and in line with a five star hotel but not particularly memorable. On a personal pet peeve, from a laptop warrior, is when will hotels stop being idiots and stop having high speed internet services that require you to slog down to reception to buy log-on time (such as the Novotel chain do and as The Observatory required). Even the ridiculously expensive Telstra Hotspot service that some hotels provide is better than this. I want speed and ease when connecting my laptop, not some old world process. To all hotels - Please, please, please follow the Crowne Plaza example and provide either one-click wireless or ethernet hi-speed internet to your rooms that offers capped rates (fees cap at some 24hr access rate). It has been down successfully in a couple of chains and can't be that hard to replicate. Drinks at the Globe were very good, with great bar snacks provided, and we felt so comfortable we even lashed out on some $150 a glass Remy cognac. Our eight course degustation meal at the Galileoâ€™s was nice and was accompanied by good service from our waiter. While the portions are small they are well-presented and tasty but hungry people are better off choosing something else. We also received a complimentary glass each of Moscato before our pre-dessert course. While the service was good at Dinner at Galileoâ€™s our buffet breakfast was a disaster for service with wait staff seeming poorly trained, rarely attentive and making very basic food service mistakes (such as delivering an order of raisin toast without any butter, with the toast barely above room temperature). Definitely a souring experience, despite the otherwise tasty hot dishes, so I recommend ordering room service for breakfast instead. Some of the hype about The Observatory is well-deserved, but there are some areas where this old dame of the Sydney hotel market needs some work, and it was a shame to see some very poor performance overshadow the otherwise nice rooms and very good service provided by other members of this hotelâ€™s staff.

HotelInfo.Name: The Observatory Hotel by Orient-Express
HotelInfo.Address: 89 - 113 Kent St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
